Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Consumer Services 5,001-10,000 employees 5,864 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Pluxee is a global player in employee benefits and engagement that operates in 31 countries. Pluxee helps companies attract, engage, and retain talent thanks to a broad range of solutions across Meal & Food, Wellbeing, Lifestyle, Reward & Recognition, and Public Benefits.

Powered by leading technology and more than 5,000 engaged team members, Pluxee acts as a trusted partner within a highly interconnected B2B2C ecosystem made up of more than 500,000 clients, 36 million consumers and 1.7 million merchants.

Conducting its business as a trusted partner for more than 45 years, Pluxee is committed to creating a positive impact on all its stakeholders, from driving business to local communities, to supporting wellbeing at work for employees while protecting the planet.

üöÄ Your next challenge 

Pluxee Data organization has chosen a decentralized Data Hub (central) & Data Spoke (local) organization where the Spokes are data factory teams covering multiple countries' Data needs and supporting business teams by delivering operations reporting, the ad-hoc analysis supporting decision making and advanced insights aiming at predicting clients, merchants, or consumers behaviors.

To support this objective, your responsibilities will encompass:
Data Analysis and interpretation: collecting and analyzing data from various sources to identify trends and insights relevant for business improvement.
Visualization and reporting: developing clear and informative dashboards and reports using data visualization tools to effectively communicate findings to business teams.
Decision support: providing ad-hoc analyses and statistical modeling to assist business teams in making informed decisions and defining key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure progress.

üåü You‚Äôre a match

Technical Skills:
5 years of experience as Data Analyst with at least 3 years in a permanent full time Data Analyst role. 
Experience supporting business areas in E2E Data Analysis and Visualization process, from gathering stakeholder¬¥s requirements to data collection, cleaning, analysis, and dashboard, reporting, and KPIs design and delivery.
+3 years of work experience using SQL on daily basis.
+3 years of work experience with Data Visualization tools, with at least 2 years experience using Power BI and DAX with advanced proficiency and storytelling skills.
Knowledge of machine learning techniques, enabling advanced data analysis will be a plus Examples: Fraud detection, scoring, attrition.
Experience working with agile methodologies and tools such as Jira. 
Experience in finance or payment services companies will be a plus.
Excellent communication skills, oral and written, with the ability to interact with different types of stakeholders (technical, non-technical, C level).
Bilingual in French and Advanced level in English as will be working with Global teams.
Ability to work in a hybrid mode (3 days at the office and 2 days at home).

Soft Skills:
Effective communication: strong verbal and written communication skills in both French and English, adept at interacting with diverse stakeholders with varying cultural backgrounds and technical expertise.
Analytical thinking: highly analytical and detail-oriented, with a knack for problem-solving and extracting insights from complex datasets.
Proactive and motivated: proactive attitude, hands-on approach, and a high level of motivation to learn quickly and adapt to new challenges in an ever-moving domain.

üîé To get this challenge
Videocall with Talent Acquisition Expert.
Videocall with the Hiring Manager (Data Spoke Manager).
Technical interview.

üèÖ Your team
Reporting to Jean Francois Prince (Data Spoke Manager).

üìç Your Location
Central Paris, Paris.
Ability to work in a hybrid mode (3 days at the office and 2 days at home).

‚òÄÔ∏è Happy at work
A meaningful job: build the future of employee benefits and contribute to the quality of life at work for others, you will impact positively local communities too. It counts!
A great culture: we respect and care authentically about our people, we embrace work-life balance, new ideas and we have a lot of fun!
Employee experience is what we do. So, you can expect a comprehensive package including benefits and an annual bonus based on performance.

About Pluxee
Working at Pluxee is joining a multicultural team that moves as one. It‚Äôs also a place where your individual ideas, perspectives, and input count. You‚Äôll be given the freedom and autonomy you need to do impactful work, supported by a team that cares about your well-being, growth, and work/life balance.
It‚Äôs the agility you‚Äôd expect from a fast-growing small business, with the stability that only a globally renowned company with +45 years in the business can offer. Put a part of yourself into the future of employee benefits and meaningfully contribute to lives and communities worldwide."

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Delve into the dynamic world of data analysis with an exclusive internship opportunity offered by Kreativstorm, a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm based in Berlin, Germany. Work remotely with our multinational team and unlock your career aspirations in data analysis!

If you're passionate about data analysis and equipped with problem-solving skills, this internship is perfect for you. Under the guidance of industry experts, you'll tackle diverse data analysis projects, exploring concepts like data visualization, statistical analysis, predictive modeling, and data mining. Gain hands-on experience in uncovering insights and informing decisions, all from the comfort of your home.

Internship Overview and Details:

Location: Fully Remote

Schedule: Part-Time Internship

Duration: 3 months with the possibility of permanent employment after the internship period

Requirements

Ideal Candidates:

Students pursuing a degree or recent graduates in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field. 
Aspiring data analysts keen on unraveling complex datasets and extracting meaningful insights. 
Analytical thinkers adept at translating data into actionable recommendations. 
Effective communicators who thrive in collaborative team settings. 
Detail-oriented individuals excelling in fast-paced, analytical environments. 
Enthusiastic learners committed to honing their skills in data analysis. 
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Python, R, SQL) highly valued. 
Familiarity with statistical techniques, data visualization, and database management advantageous. 
Some initial industry experience is a big plus. 

Your Contribution:

Contribute to data collection, cleaning, and analysis processes. 
Collaborate with the data analysis team to develop analytical models and insights. 
Aid in interpreting data trends and patterns to inform strategic decision-making. 
Bring fresh perspectives and innovative solutions to tackle data challenges. 
Foster a collaborative team environment focused on excellence in data analysis. 
Assist in documenting and presenting analysis results and recommendations. 

Benefits

Why Join Us?

Kreativstorm is a dynamic and innovative management-consulting firm headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Our team of experienced consultants brings a diverse range of talents and backgrounds, allowing us to provide tailored solutions to businesses of all sizes and industries. As part of the Yes Network Group, LLC, a reputable US holding company, we have access to extensive resources and expertise. Join us and start your journey in data analysis today!

Apply now and pave the way for your future in data analysis!"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals 1,001-5,000 employees 81 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst (CRM Specialisation)

As Data Analyst with CRM Specialisation, you will contribute to the success of the Sales & Marketing teams of Everfield's portfolio across Europe:
Use your experience in Sales & Marketing analytics to present actionable insights to our Sales & Marketing teams (HQ & Portfolio).
Work with implementation partners and portfolio companies to ensure CRM systems are implemented in alignment with Everfield standards.
Cooperate with Data Engineers to create sustainable data pipelines from various CRM systems.

The company:
Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.

Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.

The team:
You will join the Business Intelligence (BI) team as the fourth member. Currently the team consists of two Data Engineers and a hands-on team lead. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield‚Äôs portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.

The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.

The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company‚Äôs growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 16 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.

Responsibilities:
Requirements gathering
Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans
Data Analysis
Perform Sales & Marketing analysis such as Cohort, Funnel, Pipeline coverage analyses, Revenue forecasting, etc.
Data Visualization
Design proof of concept solutions to showcase new features with shortened feedback loop
Create and maintain Power BI reports used by hundreds of users
Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation
Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiency
Data modelling and Transformation
Build data systems and pipelines based on a medallion architecture
Structure sales processes
Go beyond the data and work together with Everfield‚Äôs Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfield‚Äôs suggested data structure on CRMs and ensure consistency of definitions across the portfolio

Ideal candidate profile:
The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach.
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference.
Experienced with Sales analysis and business partnership with sales teams.
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point.
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas).
Experienced with data modelling.
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process.
Fluent in English.
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together.

What‚Äôs in it for you?
Grow your career in a fast-paced and growing organization.
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform.
Working with the latest Data Analytics & Data Visualisation technologies.
Long term career opportunities.
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio.
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany).

Continue the conversation
Interested? We would love to hear from you!

Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process."

"About the job
We‚Äôre looking for a talented Junior Data Analyst to help us change the world of digital advertising together!

WHO WE ARE
Seedtag is the leading Contextual Advertising Platform. Our proprietary, machine learning-based technology provides human-like understanding of the content in the web, the highest level of brand safety in the industry and unmatched cookieless targeting capabilities.
We engage with the market on both demand and supply side to create, activate and launch high-quality advertising campaigns at scale. We are committed to creating a more beautiful, respectful and engaging way to do advertising.

2014 ¬∑ Founded by two ex-Googlers
2018 ¬∑ 16M total turnover & Internationalization & Getting growth
2021 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 40M‚Ç¨ & +11 countries & +260 Seedtaggers
2022 ¬∑ Fundraising round of 250M‚Ç¨ + expansion into the U.S market

YOUR CHALLENGE
You will propose new analysis to get the most out of our current data and define what additional data will be needed to improve our current Contextual Understanding
Your data visualization skills will be key to grasp the attention of the public and transmit complex information into simple explanations

Finally, you will build a strong knowledge of the ecosystem and sector to develop a strong instinct of how to improve our products and positioning. Creativity here will also be a must!
During all these tasks, you will be using the latest technologies developed by our Machine Learning Engineers: amazing NLP and CV models to get the most out of massive amounts of data!

YOU WILL SUCCEED IN THIS ROLE IF
You have a relevant degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics or an analytics related field
You have between 1 and 3 years of work experience in Data Analysis or a related field
You are proficient in SQL and Python: data treatment and data visualizations are a must
You have an analytical mind capable of structuring complex problems into simple, iterative, solutions
You have full proficiency in Spanish and English
You are energetic, proactive and eager to work in a dynamic environment
You are a real team player with good communication and cooperation skills
You have proven ability to work in a fast-paced, informal, dynamic and exigent environment
You like to have fun while working and don‚Äôt take yourself too serious!

It would be a big plus if you
Have previous experience in a startup or have a background in consulting
Have previous experience in presenting and communicating data analysis results and insights to external stakeholders

SEEDTAG PERKS
üöÄ Key moment to join Seedtag in terms of growth and opportunities
üíØ One Seedtag: Work for a month from any of our open offices with travel and stay paid if you‚Äôre a top performer (think of Brazil, NY..., üèñÔ∏è)
‚åõ Flexible schedule to balance work and personal life
üá¨üáß üá™üá∏ üá´üá∑ Optional company-paid English, Spanish and/or French courses
üìö Access to learning opportunities (learning & development budget)
üçª We love what we do, but we also love having fun. We have many team activities you can join and enjoy with your colleagues! A Yearly offsite with all the company, team offsites, and Christmas events.
üèã Gympass

BENEFITS OF WORKING AT SEEDTAG
Growth: International, highly demanding work environment in one of the fastest growing AdTech companies in Europe. We reject ""that‚Äôs the way it‚Äôs always been done"". In Seedtag you can find an energetic, fresh workplace, multicultural work environment where our members are from different countries in Europe, LATAM, US and so many more!
Impact: The chance to have a direct impact, here you don't work for the sake of working, we all have an impact on seedtag in our own way, rowing in the same direction.
Diversity of methodology and people: Seedtag DNA is unique and highly appreciated by very different types of Seedtagers. We embrace diversity and encourage everyone to seek the best version of themselves and to show who they really are. With a total flexible methodology.
Flexibility: At Seedtag, we trust you, you can work from home, the beach or the office. The important thing is to work on your goals.

Title:
Data Analyst

Job Description:
"About the job
ComeOn Group in short
Founded in 2008, ComeOn Group is a leading global player in the rapidly growing iGaming market. Having launched its first online brand in 2010, ComeOn Group is running a wide range of exciting brands across multiple markets. Managing a multi-brand portfolio on its proprietary platform, offering a secure, innovative, and entertainment-driven player experience in both casino and sports. ComeOn Group is an international employer within the iGaming industry and has over 500 talented employees across 7 main locations.

Location: Malta + Hybrid 

We are on the lookout for a talented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team at ComeOn Group. In this role, you'll be at the heart of our data-driven decision-making process, transforming raw data into actionable insights that fuel business growth. As a Data Analyst, you'll extract, analyze and interpret complex data to provide clear, actionable insights. You'll collaborate with various teams, including Marketing, CRM, Compliance, and Payments, to support their data needs.

Responsibilities:
Design and develop complex SQL queries to extract and analyse large datasets.
Create data visualisations and reports using Tableau, to present findings to stakeholders.
Identify trends, patterns, and correlations in data to inform business decisions.
Provide ad hoc data analysis and reporting support to various stakeholders, including business leaders and product managers.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).
Assist in data-driven decision-making by providing data insights and recommendations.

About you:
Strong proficiency in SQL, including advanced querying techniques and database design
Experience with data visualisation tools like Tableau, Power BI
Good level of MS Excel / Google Sheets
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills
Ability to work independently and collaboratively as part of a team
Strong attention to detail and ability to meet deadlines
Enthusiastic, positive and self-disciplined
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment, adapt easily to changing situations and demonstrates flexibility in juggling priorities
At least 2 years of experience in data analysis
Experience with data analysis tools and technologies such as SQL, Tableau, Power BI
Knowledge of Python, and BigQuery would be considered a plus
Experience of working in igaming would also be a plus

So what can you expect from ComeOn as a place of work?

A competitive remuneration package including a company bonus scheme! üí∞
Fantastic quarterly team events and weekly company events üòé
A one-time bonus to help you set up a comfortable workstation at home (we‚Äôre truly Hybrid!)
On top of our Hybrid work arrangement, up to 40 days a year to work fully remote from anywhere üåé
Wellbeing allowance
A comprehensive, International Private Health Insurance
Breakfast at the office on Tuesdays
Lunch at the office on Mondays and Wednesdays

At ComeOn, we've embraced a Hybrid Work model, giving our employees the flexibility to work some days at home. Our offices are thoughtfully designed to support this model, featuring practical workspaces for focused efforts and collaborative zones for dynamic creative exchanges. We believe in the power of collaboration to drive innovation and success. While our offices are known for their vibrant atmosphere, rest assured that our primary focus is on achieving results together. We prioritize efficiency and maintain a balance between hard work and camaraderie. When you visit our offices, expect a warm welcome and professional support. Choose ComeOn for your next career move, and experience a workplace that values productivity, teamwork, and the spirit of collaboration.

At ComeOn Group we value diversity and we take concrete action to ensure fairness in our recruitment process. We are committed to assessing candidates on their merit without discriminating against any applicant for whatever reason that is protected by law. We truly value you, as you are.

Want to know more about us just visit our website www.comeon-group.com or any of our social media channels to take a deep dive into our culture!

Job Description:
"About the job
SQL Data Analyst/Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining SQL-based data solutions to support our business intelligence and data analytics initiatives. This role requires a strong understanding of SQL Server technologies, data integration tools, and reporting/analytics platforms.
The key elements resource should have:
SQL Development: Design, develop, and optimize SQL queries, stored procedures, and database objects to support reporting and data analysis requirements.
Data Integration: Utilize SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) to design and implement ETL processes for data extraction, transformation, and loading.
Data Analysis: Develop and maintain SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) multidimensional and tabular models to enable complex data analysis and reporting.
Reporting and Visualization: Create and manage Power BI dashboards and reports to provide actionable insights and support business decision-making.
Databricks: Leverage Databricks for big data processing and analytics, integrating it with SQL-based solutions as needed.
Data Modeling: Develop and maintain data models and schema designs to support reporting and analytics requirements.
Performance Tuning: Monitor and optimize database performance to ensure efficient data processing and query execution.
Collaboration: Work closely with business users and IT teams to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deliver solutions that meet business needs.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, data models, and reporting solutions.

Technical Skills: 
SQL Server: Proficiency in SQL Server (2008 and above) including T-SQL, SSIS, and SSAS.
Data Modeling: Experience with tabular models and multidimensional cube development in SSAS.
Power BI: Expertise in designing and developing Power BI reports and dashboards.
Databricks: Familiarity with Databricks for big data analytics and integration.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with attention to detail.
Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Project Management: Ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, delivering high-quality results within deadlines

Certifications Needed: 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Data Science, or a related field. Advanced degrees or certifications are a plus."

All Amach employees and contractors are expected to honour this policy and act to ensure that every individual is respected in the workplace.

Your personal data

Kept securely

"About the job

Het valt tegenwoordig niet meer bij te houden‚Ä¶ al die verschillende energie- en telecomaanbieders die zijn afgesloten binnen √©√©n huishouden. In een ideale wereld is er een provider die Alles-in-1 biedt en waar je ook nog eens weinig geld aan kwijt bent. Laat dit bedrijf van deze utopie nu werkelijkheid hebben gemaakt.

Vertel me meer‚Ä¶

Het liefst ben je zo min mogelijk tijd kwijt aan basisproducten, zoals stroom & gas, internet, TV & bellen, etc. Toch zijn deze producten onmisbaar voor een huishouden en vergen dus de nodige aandacht. Graag! Wat kan ik doen?

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

We help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.

, Job Description

The ISO unit of Verisk is looking forInsurance Data Analyststo support our large team of actuaries and data analytics experts, who create innovative analytic products based on our unique database of over 21 billion records spanning more than twenty lines of insurance.

You will play a hands-on role in developing new processes to create a wide variety of ISO‚Äôs analytic solutions including our advisory prospective loss costs and rating factors; analyses that underlie the development of our loss costs (such as distributions by peril, classification, or geographic area); actuarial projection of ultimate claims, and analysis of trends impacting premiums and claims; analytical data management, including smart data quality analytics, data aggregations provided to US state insurance regulators and analytic research & development.

A successful Insurance Data Analyst will possess excellent technical and mathematical skills, to manipulate data and derive analyses. Most important, though, is a sense of inquisitiveness about data, and the ability not just to manipulate data, but to also understand and preserve the business meaning behind it.

, Qualifications

Fluency in English is required (at least B2 spoken and written)
Knowledge of Excel (pivot tables, formulas, conditional formatting)
Attention to detail to follow elaborate instructions and to spot even little differences in data
Experience with big data sets (10 000+ rows)
Familiarity with SQL will be an asset but not required
Willing to work in a hybrid model as a full-time employee and grow within an insur-tech company
Ability to manage competing, high-priority demands and prioritize workloads while managing projects and multiple responsibilities against strict deadlines
Strong interpersonal/collaboration skills and ability to build relations with internal stakeholders

Additional Information

For over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.

At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.

For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work¬Æ for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work¬Æ Certification, we‚Äôve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companiesand by Forbesas a World‚Äôs Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.

We‚Äôre 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.

Verisk Businesses

Underwriting Solutions‚Äî provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precision

Claims Solutions‚Äî supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiences

Property Estimating Solutions‚Äî offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficient

Extreme Event Solutions‚Äî provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.

Specialty Business Solutions‚Äî provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governance

Marketing Solutions‚Äî delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagement

Life Insurance Solutions‚Äì offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.

Verisk Maplecroft‚Äî provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become stronger

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

http://www.verisk.com/careers.html

Unsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume."

Title:

Supply Data Analyst - Internship with verification
Industry: Advertising Services 501-1,000 employees 587 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Ogury is a global adtech company that delivers Personified Advertising solutions grounded in privacy to brands, agencies and publishers by focusing on targeting personas, not people.

We deliver relevant audiences at scale and on quality publisher inventory thanks to our exclusive data, which is meticulously collected and crafted from millions of self-declared customer surveys, enriched with billions of impactful data points, and refined by AI. This results in audience insights and performance not available through any other AdTech platform.

Founded in 2014, Ogury is a global organization with a diverse team of 500+ people across 17 countries.

At Ogury, our vision unites us all. But we know that it takes people from all walks of life to come together and make it happen. We embrace and celebrate what makes us different, creating a unique and winning culture where everyone feels safe, has access to the same opportunities, and is excited about bringing their most authentic self to work. Everyday.

Together we‚Äôre changing the face of adtech with values that inspire excellence, standards that encourage a leadership mindset, and an inclusive workplace where Ogurians are engaged and know they belong.

About The Role

Ogury is seeking a highly motivated Supply Data Analyst Intern to help our efforts towards data analysis. The intern will assist in collecting, processing, and analyzing data to support our business decisions and strategic initiatives. This internship offers an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data analysis and work within a dynamic and innovative tech environment.

What You Will Do

Data Collection and Cleaning: Assist in gathering data from multiple sources, including internal databases, spreadsheets, and third-party data systems. Perform data cleaning and preprocessing to ensure data integrity and accuracy. Help maintain data quality and support data management activities.
Data Analysis: Conduct basic statistical analyses and generate reports to identify trends and patterns. Support senior analysts with more complex data analysis tasks. Utilize tools such as Excel, SQL for data manipulation and analysis.
Reporting and Visualization: Create data visualizations, dashboards, and reports using Metabase as the main tool. Present analytical findings to team members and stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Support and Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support. Assist in developing and implementing data collection systems and strategies to optimize data efficiency and quality.
Learning and Development: Stay current with industry trends, tools, and techniques in data analysis. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance analytical skills and knowledge.

About You

Currently pursuing a Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or a related field.
Familiarity with Microsoft Excel; knowledge of SQL and data visualization tools such as Metabase is a plus.
Basic understanding of statistical methods and data analysis techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills.Good communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with programming languages such as Python.
Understanding of data warehousing concepts and tools.
Experience with big data tools and technologies."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Software Development 51-200 employees 361 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We're Creative Fabrica, a fast-scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.

Our mission

Enable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating, and sharing. The ‚ÄòCreative Inspiration Flywheel‚Äô

This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.

About the platform

We launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 8 years, we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!

We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, over 20 million listed products, and 20000+ active designers.

Our focus is to create a platform for designers to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.

Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. Suppose you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions. In that case, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.

In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.

What you will do:

Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency.
Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making.
Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies.
Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes.

What you will bring: 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Nice to have:

Experience in complex modeling.
Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R, and/or other relevant tools.
Experience and/or understanding of DBT (Data Build Tool).

Let us take care of you.

Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills, and ambition should be fairly compensated.
Top-Notch Tools and Gear: You'll be equipped with everything you need: a top-of-the-line laptop, the latest collaboration tools, and stylish accessories to match.
Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the center, working here means delicious lunches cooked by our very own chefs, plus access to our own CF library to keep the learning going.
And a great team: We work hard and have fun together. On Fridays, we kick off the weekend together at the local bar, but there's more; we regularly organize events and company trips, creating opportunities to bond and build meaningful connections.

Is this you?

Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.

You can apply by clicking the ""Apply now"" button.

Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees."

Title:
Portfolio Data Analyst
Portfolio Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Financial Services 10,001+ employees 87,983 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We offer:

‚Ä¢ Unique opportunity to get exposure to the global lending and capital markets business while working with colleagues in London
‚Ä¢ Technical language, proprietary environment, and infrastructure training
‚Ä¢ Technical and professional on-the job training in securitized products and structured credit
‚Ä¢ An introduction to Morgan Stanley and the global financial markets
‚Ä¢ Contingent/Leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley
‚Ä¢ Contract via 3rd party agency

You will:

‚Ä¢ Analyze assets including commercial real estate loans, residential mortgages, auto loans and other cash-flow generating assets
‚Ä¢ Provide oversight of ongoing client requests for fundings
‚Ä¢ Work with other internal teams to build-out transaction & collateral monitoring systems
‚Ä¢ Provide senior management with monthly, quarterly and annual updates on the lending portfolio
‚Ä¢ Conduct market and asset level research

You have:

‚Ä¢ BSc or MSc in finance or a quantitative field (e.g. finance, economics and engineering)
‚Ä¢ 0-3 years of experience. Preferably a background with a financial institution, rating agency or accounting firm
‚Ä¢ Excellent data management skills: MS Excel, pivot tables, database management (Access or SQL experience is a plus)
‚Ä¢ Strong work ethic, attention to detail, analytical mindset
‚Ä¢ Proficient verbal and written communication skills in English

Team profile:

Morgan Stanley FID Deleverage and Lending group (‚ÄúDLG‚Äù) is seeking to hire an analyst to be part of its lending portfolio management platform based in Budapest.
DLG provides asset-backed financing solutions to institutional clients and manages a portfolio backed by a diverse range of assets including consumer loans, residential and commercial mortgages, corporate loans, etc. The asset management team within DLG provides ongoing portfolio management, monitoring and risk oversight, and reports to senior management.

About Morgan Stanley

Morgan Stanley is a global financial services firm and a market leader in investment banking, securities, investment management and wealth management services. Throughout your contingent/leased assignment working onsite at Morgan Stanley, you will be exposed to a truly international and multi-cultural environment that appreciates and respects individuality. Our state-of-the-art offices in the City Centre have been designed to maximize collaboration.
At Morgan Stanley Budapest, we are shaping the future of our global business and contributing to our local community. Our team works across numerous areas, including Technology, Mathematical Modelling, Finance, Risk Management, Operations and Data & Analytics from our new state-of-the-art offices near the Danube and our City Gate office in the heart of the city center."

‚Ä¢ Utilize SQL for data querying, management, data manipulation and analysis, ensuring data accuracy and integrity across multiple sources and supporting BI reporting needs.

‚Ä¢ Develop and maintain efficient and scalable ETL processes and pipelines to integrate data from new external sources into an existing cohesive data warehouse.
‚Ä¢ Collaborate with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders to identify and clarify analytical requirements, understand data needs, deliver custom reports, and support data-driven decision-making.
‚Ä¢ Conduct ad-hoc analyses and present findings in a clear and concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.
‚Ä¢ Conduct thorough data analysis to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement.
‚Ä¢ Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
‚Ä¢ Participate in the evaluation and implementation of new BI tools and technologies.

What your background should be:
‚Ä¢ A degree in Computer Science, Data Analytics, Information Systems, or a related field is desirable.
‚Ä¢ 4+ years of experience in data, reporting and analytics, with a proven track record in Power BI, SQL and Python.
‚Ä¢ Demonstrate previous experience working with ETL processes and tools
‚Ä¢ Previous experience in the financial services industry is desirable.

If you're passionate about technology and thrive in a fast-paced environment, Apply now!"

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, deliver digital marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them to save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data and innovate. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland.

Job Description

We are recruiting for a fundamental role within our Marketing Analytics team. The Junior Data Analyst position is an important role within the department, reporting into the Targeting Analytics Manager.

What you'll be doing?

You will deliver analytical projects; this will involve analysing data sets, getting to the bottom of what is going on with the data and communicating your findings to different stakeholders within Experian.

Working with your team, you will blend a knowledge of mathematical, analytical or spatial techniques with a natural curiosity for understanding and analysing data.

Qualifications

What you'll bring?

Skills

We're after a team player who has a desire to deliver analysis projects to budgeted time, with accuracy, using core analytical techniques and applications. You will have a drive and determination to develop your skills. Therefore, you'll bring:

–úathematical competency;
Geospatial/GIS expertise;
Data analysis and interpretation.

The following additional skills would be advantageous but not essential:

Regression Modelling;
Segmentation;
Machine Learning;
Location analysis.

It Would Be Great If You Have Previous Experience Of Data Analysis And Interpretation And An Understanding Of Any Programming Languages And Applications Such As

R;
Python;
SAS;
Alteryx;
VBA;
SQL;
Tableau, MicroStrategy or PowerBI;
ArcGIS, MapIinfo or other GIS software.

Additional Information

Why Us?

No one makes sense of data like Experian. We are on a mission to deliver the full power of data, analytics and technology in ways that transform lives. As a team, we're committed to working together. So, we work in an inclusive environment that welcomes people with lots of different perspectives. We put people first and care about work that works.

We like to strike a balance between how much time we spend on work and how much we keep for ourselves. After all, we've all got commitments and interests outside the office. So, talk to us about how you'd best like to work with us. We're flexible and interested in helping you to get the best out of working with us.

What You Will Get

Work environment - excellent work conditions with friendly environment, recognized strong team spirit, and fun and quality recreation time.
Social benefits package including life insurance, food vouchers, additional health insurance for you and a family member, monthly flex allowance including internet bill coverage, sick leave allowance, corporate discounts, marriage and childbirth / adoption allowance, Multisport card, Sharesave plan, Employee assistance program, –∞ birthday gift and many more!
Work-life balance - 25 days paid vacation, 1 additional day off for your birthday and extra 3 paid days for participation in social responsibility events.
Opportunity for flexible working hours and home office.
Personal Development - career pathways for professional growth supported by learning and development programmes and unlimited access to online educational training courses, learning materials & books.

Our Social Benefits Package - the way we care for our People

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here"

"About the job
Data-analist

"About the job

Title:
Junior Data Analyst (EMEA, remote)
Junior Data Analyst (EMEA, remote)
Industry: Business Consulting and Services 11-50 employees 23 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Margera is a boutique analytics agency founded by an x-Googler. We help Enterprise companies grow through the use of data and analytics. We are proud to support top companies in various industries such as banks (Eurobank, Piraeus Bank, Astrobank), travel-related (Aegean Airlines, Sani/ikos Hotels), tobacco (Philip Morris in 6 countries) and gaming (OPAP, Stoiximan, novibet). Our main services are Digital Analytics (we are the only Google Analytics Sales Partner in Greece/Cyprus), Data warehousing (on-prem or on the Cloud), BI and Machine Learning.
 We have an ambitious growth plan (x5 in 3 years) and we are looking for a professional who will be joining our Data Analytics Team.
 Here‚Äôs who we‚Äôre looking for:
 You are a fresh graduate that wants to start a great career. You must thrive on problem-solving when somebody assigns something challenging to you, you do not say ""this cannot be done"", but rather ""how can this be done?"". As a Data Analyst, you will be expected to gather information from various sources, interpret patterns and trends and conclude to actionable insights.
 Typical responsibilities for this role would be:
 The primary responsibility of the Data Analyst is to perform analysis that leads to actionable insights based on the needs of our Clients. 
  Analysis: Analyse data collected from various data sources, identify new data sources or ways to look at the data, perform the synthesis of insights to generate a coherent story
Reporting: Design and create reports for periodic or ad-hoc needs
Development: Assist in data definitions for data warehousing projects or digital analytics. Need to understand the semantics of the data and business to participating in data modeling workshops or tracking guides.

 We do not care about a prestigious university degree or social connections. We care about raw intellectual capacity and drive.
 You must have:
  University degree in Mathematics, Economics (or a similar field)
Native-level proficiency in Greek and at least fluency in English
Strong knowledge of Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, vlookup, text functions)
Data curiosity


 Bonus points for:
  Having completed relevant internships
Knowledge of data-related programming languages (Python, R, etc)
Strong knowledge of SQL
Experience with BI tools (Tableau, Power BI, Qlickview)
Interest into Machine Learning/AI
At least 6 months of relevant work experience

 BENEFITS 
We know that the growth of our company is 100% based on our Team and therefore we are looking for talented and really ambitious people. If you are one of those rare breeds, you will be working with a team of young, smart people in a company with a clear growth mindset. 
 On top of this, we offer:
  Competitive salary
Monthly bonus
Discretionary annual salary increases
Internal trainings either product specific (like Google Analytics, Microsoft PowerBI) or data in general (SQL, AI/ML foundations).
Tech equipment (laptop and big screen)

 HIRING PROCESS
Our hiring process consists of the following steps: 
First Interview: An initial interview to get to know each other and discuss your qualifications and experience.
Exercise Assignment: An exercise, that will be send to you typically the same or the following day, which you need to complete and return to us within two days.
Virtual On-Site Day (Paid): On this day, we will give you an exercise to solve in the morning, which you will present to us at the end of the day. This day is designed for you to get to know the team, understand what a typical day is like with us, and experience working together (e.g., briefing, feedback, etc.). It also provides our team the opportunity to get to know you better and discuss the exercises you have prepared.
 If you want to be in a team that respects you, make an impact with your projects and learn new technologies and strategies through your work and trainings, then you should apply today. View more about Margera and learn how we make this happen."

Title:
Data Analyst Intern
Data Analyst Intern
Industry: Software Development 51-200 employees 90 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
üöÄ Founded in 2021, Echo's narrative is one of relentless growth, ambition, and promise. A cutting-edge startup at the forefront of Geospatial Data and Gen AI technologies, we have skyrocketed from 0 to 80+ employees in just three years!
Specialists in the location intelligence industry, we empower innovation by helping companies better understand the world around them.
In a world inundated with data, quality is crucial. We use data science, machine learning, and human feedback to build Europe's most comprehensive, high-quality datasets, enriched with differentiating attributes that outmaneuver the competition.
We aren‚Äôt just about reliable data (read: unmatched quality) though.
Life at Echo is about individual growth, collective ambition, and a culture that values and celebrates diversity; With a ""people first"" philosophy guiding everything we do.
You'll be at the heart of innovation, tackling projects that shape our future, with the best people possible!

Your Role at Echo 
Are you a Master‚Äôs candidate passionate (ideally) about data analysis and programming? Join us for a six-month internship as a Data Analyst Intern. Dive into diverse datasets - geospatial, trajectory - using tools like BigQuery, Looker, Python, and Airflow.

Collaborate with ML experts, data engineers, scientists, and product managers on real-world projects. Apply data analysis techniques to solve business challenges and make impactful contributions to geo-spatial datasets.

This internship offers hands-on experience and a dynamic environment to explore and implement new algorithms, contributing to the scaling of our products. Make a real-world impact with your passion for data!

As such, your main responsibilities will be:
Collaborate closely with the sales team in order to deliver analytical geospatial samples for our clients and prospects using sql or python
Support the data team on the automation of the delivery process
Collaborate with the data science and product management team to find solutions to improve the data quality of our product
Work on several projects that aims to improve and optimize our geospatial products
Be proactive in investigating and testing new tools, processes, and technologies on an ongoing basis

What we‚Äôre looking for:
Currently pursuing a Master's degree in Data/Business Analytics, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field
Data Analysis: Proven ability to analyze large datasets, identify trends, and extract actionable insights through using strong SQL skills for querying and data extraction
Programming Languages: Python is a plus, especially Pandas for data manipulation and analysis and Airflow for data orchestration
Data Visualization: Knowledge in creating interactive and insightful visualizations, using tools like Looker or Tableau..
Problem-solving: Adept in approaching analytical problems and proposing effective solutions
Excellent communication skills for conveying complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, in English
Strong team player with the ability to collaborate effectively in a fast-paced environment

Some preferred requirements:
Comfortable working with the Google Cloud Platform stack or another cloud environment
Experience with a version control system like GitHub or Gitlab
Experience with data engineering tools like Airflow
Experience with spatial-temporal datasets

Why us?
üåé A great diverse and international team based in Paris (25+ nationalities!)
üöÄ Impact and ownership mindset: at Echo we encourage everyone to take ownership of their projects
üéá People first company: without our people we have no business, we have dedicated a People Manifesto to them
üåÜ A contemporary office space in central Paris with a rooftop to admire the view
üíª Remote-friendly policy
ü•ò Free coffee, snacks on top of your lunch voucher card (Swile, 10‚Ç¨/ working day)

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Financial Services 201-500 employees 441 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

üåç Ready to join the ultimate decision-making dream team? Hop aboard the Rocketship!

At Finder, we're not just about helping people save money, make money, and snag sweet rewards; we're also on a mission to inject some excitement into the daily grind.

With offices in Sydney, Toronto, New York, London, and Wroclaw, we've built a dynamic community of over 290 curious minds. But we're not your typical corporate clan. Diverse thinkers united by our core purpose to make money easy, we have a shared passion for turning the norm on its head.

If you're itching to shake things up, develop your expertise, and be part of a crew that values creativity, drive, and a good dose of quirkiness, then you might just be the missing piece to our puzzle. So why wait? Join us and let's navigate this wild world of decisions together! üöÄüåü

Role Overview

The role‚Äôs purpose is to supercharge Finder‚Äôs data capabilities through the design, deployment and improvement of data analytics capabilities.

We are looking for a Data Analyst who will support our product teams with insights gained from analysing company data. The ideal candidate is adept at using large data sets to find opportunities for product and process optimisation and to test the effectiveness of different courses of action.

They must have a proven ability to drive business results with their data-derived insights. They must be comfortable working with a wide range of stakeholders and functional teams. The right candidate will have a passion for discovering solutions hidden in large data sets and working with stakeholders to improve business outcomes.

Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst at Finder, you will partner with stakeholders to build scalable infrastructure and a central hub of datasets and dashboards for the comparison business. This will support data-driven decisions and insights that translate directly to accelerate business growth and product improvement.

Work closely with the product, engineering, client services and publishing teams to support their decision making process with facts, insights and recommendations
Gather the requirements and determine the best course of action for analysis
Define a robust set of datasets and dashboards to support key business processes, e.g., forecasting, quarterly business planning etc.
Use the data to identify insights to inform hypotheses and test ideas.
Plan, and prioritise insights that drive Finder targets and ROI.
Analyse and evaluate A/B tests, report on results and recommend next steps
Build and maintain self-serve dashboards for internal and external stakeholders.
Train crew with dashboards / self serve analytics when needed.
Support company growth by discovering, analysing and communicating the critical user behavioural data

Desired Experience And Skills

Experience working with large-scale data sets
Experience of data analysis, cleaning or visualisation (for example using SQL, Python, spreadsheets or other technologies)
Experience in data modelling
Experience with Enterprise Digital Analytics such as Snowplow, GA360
Experience with modern data warehousing solutions (we use BigQuery)
Admirable team player qualities, including being collaborative, respectful, and service focused
A willingness to learn and apply various data analytics methodologies
A genuine passion for data and drive to communicate using data
Demonstrated analytical problem-solving skills and expertise
Demonstrated ability to pull apart complex data and communicate it to a non-technical audience

Preferred

Familiarity with dbt
Familiarity with GitHub
Deep understanding of building and maintaining data pipelines and assets, through robust change control.
Ability to work in an unstructured environment, navigate ambiguity, and bring clarity and structure as you go.
Ability to create and foster strong cross-functional networks and manage without authority.
Excellent presentation and communication skills.

Perks/Benefits

Vibrant office in the city center with a kitchen filled with snacks
Participation in our Finder Equity Plan (share options)
Organizational culture based on our core values
Multisport card
Access to training, development, and an extensive resource library
Private medical care
Lunch card
Hackofriday
Flexibility in when and where you can work with our hybrid policy, including opportunities to work abroad

Application Process

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you've been looking for, select the 'Apply Now' button below to submit your cover letter and resume. Use your cover letter to introduce us to you; we want to know who you are, what you've worked on and why you think you'd be a great addition to the Finder team.

Inclusion

To build technology and products that are used and loved by people and solve real-world problems, we need to build a team with many different perspectives and experiences. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. 

We encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply. Applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us. We will treat your request as confidentially as possible. In your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible. Email talent@finder.com with any questions or feedback."

"About the job
WHO WE ARE?
NOEWE group ‚Äî one of the major professional service providers in the Lithuanian market ‚Äî offers a portfolio of services in financial planning, legal, tax, business consulting, accounting services, as well as asset and wealth management.

Being a part of the NOEWE group, Management Consulting team offer one-stop-shop services in strategic assistance, and the solutions required for the implementation of these strategies. Every situation is unique. Our task is to understand client's challenges, or in some cases to leverage our experience in order to identify them. And because we are not bound by any conflicts of interest (as global professional service networks are) we always openly share our strategic vision, bold insights and solutions.

üì¢ We are looking forward to welcome a new Management Consulting team member - Data Analyst to work from our office in Vilnius!

Industry: Advertising Services 1,001-5,000 employees 727 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)"

Smadex is a leading advertising technology company founded in Barcelona in 2011 and sold to American-based and stock-listed Entravision in 2018 (NYSE::EVC). Title:
Junior Business Data Analyst
Junior Business Data Analyst
Industry: Hospitals and Health Care 11-50 employees 43 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
About Skinvision

Join SkinVision, a trailblazing company transforming skin cancer detection and prevention. Skin Cancer cases are growing at an alarming rate globally. In fact, 1 in 5 people will get skin cancer, but only 3% of the high risk population is known by the health authorities. At SkinVision, we are on a mission to save the lives of 250,000 people in the next ten years by revolutionizing the way we care about our skin. Our technology allows users to take ownership of their health, recognizing signs of skin cancer from anywhere, at any time by combining the recommendations of AI and dermatologists.

Business Data Analyst at SkinVision

We're on the lookout for a Business Data Analyst with excellent skills and experience to gain relevant insights into our business data, which is a vital asset to our core business stakeholders. The ideal candidate will possess a strong expertise in data analysis and visualization, with hands-on experience in SQL, Python/R, Git and visualization tools such as Looker/Tableau, along with a great business understanding and ability to manage stakeholders. Knowledge of the Cloud (AWS), data orchestration tools (Apache Airflow) and dbt are a plus!

Responsibilities

Partner with stakeholders to comprehend business requirements and translate them into actionable data analysis and reporting solutions.
Utilize advanced data visualization tools to create visually compelling and interactive dashboards, visualizations and reports for stakeholders throughout the organization.
Perform deep-dive analysis on large and intricate data sets, unearthing patterns, trends and actionable insights that drive strategic business decisions and optimizations.
Collaborate closely with product & marketing teams to identify key performance metrics and implement comprehensive tracking mechanisms for robust product analytics.
Execute data cleansing, manipulation and transformation techniques to ensure high-quality, reliable data for analysis.
Design and implement scalable data models and schemas that facilitate efficient data analysis and reporting leveraging data visualization tools (e.g., Looker or equivalent).
Stay abreast of the latest industry standards, best practices, and emerging trends in data analysis and product analytics, and share insights with the broader team.


Education and experience

1-2 years of proven professional experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, showcasing exceptional proficiency in data visualization tools (e.g., Looker or equivalent), product analytics, data insights gathering and ETL pipelines.
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science , Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.


Skills

Mastery of data visualization tools or platforms, enabling the creation of sophisticated visualizations, dashboards and reports that effectively communicate complex insights to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Proficiency in SQL and python for data retrieving and manipulation.
Strong analytical mindset, exceptional problem-solving skills, and the ability to extract actionable insights from intricate datasets.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the capacity to effectively convey technical concepts to diverse audiences.
Proven ability to thrive in a collaborative, cross-functional team environment, managing multiple priorities and deadlines.


What we offer you

3 office days per week with a healthy lunch and 2 days of working from home.
A competitive salary based on your experience.
Join our enthusiastic and professional team with colleagues from all over the world.
A dynamic and rapidly growing start-up in Amsterdam.
Unlimited skin checks for you.
Regular team events such as weekly drinks and monthly dinners.


Not sure if you are qualified?

Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria, women tend to only apply when they check every box. If you feel energized by our mission and would like to use your first-class talent to accelerate the growth of SkinVision but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description, please still apply. We'd love to receive your application and see if you could be a good fit.

JD - Junior Business Data Analyst.pdf"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Software Development 51-200 employees 361 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We're Creative Fabrica, a fast scaling tech start-up from Amsterdam.

Our mission

Enable creativity by giving access to everything related to the creative process: inspiration, learning, creating and sharing. The 'Creative Inspiration Flywheel'

This creates a self-sustaining community that lives within the Creative Fabrica ecosystem.

About the platform

We launched in 2016 as a marketplace for fonts with a subscription service. In the last 8 years we have been through tremendous growth, and we're just getting started!

We have scaled to 40 million+ monthly page views, over 20 million listed products and 20000+ active designers.

Our focus is to create a platform for designers that enables them to offer exceptional high-quality content. We make their products searchable in unique ways. This allows our customers to speed up their workflow, allowing them to focus on what they love most: Creating.

Creative Fabrica is on the lookout for a dynamic, inquisitive, and driven Data Analyst who is eager to dive into the depths of data, uncover hidden insights, and contribute to our ambitious growth plans. If you are passionate about turning data into compelling stories and making a tangible impact on business decisions, this is your opportunity to join an international team and shape the future of data analytics at Creative Fabrica.

In this role, you will be a key player in deciphering complex data, acting as a 'data detective' to uncover critical insights from vast data sets. You will be instrumental in enhancing our understanding of customers, improving our predictive capabilities, and driving growth.

What you will do:

Collect, manage, and maintain data sources, including internal databases and external datasets, to ensure data accuracy and currency.
Perform complex data analyses using statistical methods, machine learning algorithms, and data visualization tools to identify trends, patterns, and insights.
Identify business challenges and develop analytical solutions to address these challenges and support decision-making.
Clearly and concisely communicate the results of analyses to stakeholders through reports, dashboards, and presentations.
Translate data findings into actionable recommendations for improving processes, products, or strategies.
Collaborate with teams within the organization, including IT, marketing, and operational departments, to understand data analysis needs and provide appropriate solutions.
Stay up-to-date with new technologies and methodologies in the field of data analysis and apply them to enhance analysis processes.

What you will bring: 

Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field, such as statistics, computer science, mathematics, or a related field.
At least 2 years of industry experience.
Strong programming skills in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and data analysis tools.
Knowledge of statistical and machine learning techniques.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Nice to have:

Experience in complex modeling.
Strong programming skills, preferably in languages like Python, R, and/or other relevant tools.
Experience and/or understanding of DBT (Data Build Tool)

Let us take care of you.

Competitive Compensation: We believe that hard work, skills, and ambition should be fairly compensated.
Top-Notch Tools and Gear: You'll be equipped with everything you need: a top-of-the-line laptop, the latest collaboration tools, and stylish accessories to match.
Awesome Office: Based in a beautiful office in the center, working here means delicious lunches cooked by our very own chefs, plus access to our own CF library to keep the learning going.
And a great team: We work hard and have fun together. On Fridays, we kick off the weekend together at the local bar, but there's more; we regularly organize events and company trips, creating opportunities to bond and build meaningful connections.

Is this you?

Get in touch! We'd love to speak to you.

You can apply by clicking the ""Apply now"" button.

Creative Fabrica is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees."

Title:
Data Analyst (Remote, ROU)
Data Analyst (Remote, ROU) with verification
Industry: Computer and Network Security 5,001-10,000 employees 9,048 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
#WeAreCrowdStrike and our mission is to stop breaches. As a global leader in cybersecurity, our team changed the game. Since our inception, our market leading cloud-native platform has offered unparalleled protection against the most sophisticated cyberattacks. We‚Äôre looking for people with limitless passion, a relentless focus on innovation and a fanatical commitment to the customer to join us in shaping the future of cybersecurity. Consistently recognized as a top workplace, CrowdStrike is committed to cultivating an inclusive, remote-first culture that offers people the autonomy and flexibility to balance the needs of work and life while taking their career to the next level. Interested in working for a company that sets the standard and leads with integrity? Join us on a mission that matters - one team, one fight.

About The Role

CrowdStrike is looking for a Data Analyst to join our growing Generative AI Research Center. This is a junior/entry-level position with quick advancement opportunities. As Data Analyst you will focus on data and corpus labeling, as well as other data-related tasks critical to supporting our large language models (LLMs) and cybersecurity initiatives. This role is crucial in enhancing our products capabilities by ensuring the accuracy and quality of the data used to train models and detect threats, thereby supporting the overall mission of the Generative AI Research Center.

CrowdStrike is a cybersecurity company, but we do not require candidates for this role to have prior security industry experience. We will mentor and train in security topics as needed. We do expect a strong interest in CrowdStrike's mission and a willingness to engage with the needs of our product teams and customers.

If you are a hands-on engineer who loves technical challenges and wants to operate at scale, apply & let's talk!

Interviewing process: online and onsite where applicable

What You'll Do

Label and annotate cybersecurity-related datasets to prepare them for analysis and machine learning tasks.
Ensure labeling accuracy and consistency across different datasets, including threat intelligence data, incident reports, network logs, etc.
Gather data from various cybersecurity sources, including threat intelligence feeds, logs, and internal reports.
Clean and preprocess data to make it suitable for analysis and modeling
Perform exploratory data analysis to uncover patterns, trends, and insights related to cybersecurity threats and vulnerabilities.
Utilize statistical methods and tools to interpret data and identify potential security issues.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to communicate findings to cybersecurity stakeholders.
Develop visualizations to present data in a clear and concise manner, highlighting key security metrics and trends.
Work closely with analysts, data scientists, engineers, and other team members to support their data needs.
Support the implementation and optimization of MLOps pipelines, leveraging data insights to deploy, monitor and scale machine learning models for different solutions.
Participate in team meetings and contribute to project planning and discussions, providing data-driven insights.
Document processes, methodologies, and insights gained from data analysis and labeling activities.
Maintain clear records of data sources, cleaning steps, and labeling criteria to ensure reproducibility and auditability. 

What You'll Need

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related STEM field. 
Proficiency in data manipulation and analysis tools (e.g., Python, SQL).
Familiarity with relevant libraries and frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Experience with data labeling and annotation tools.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with an understanding of cybersecurity concepts.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy. 

Tech Stack (not mandatory to know everything; a robust learning capacity is essential):

Python 
SQL
Data Labeling and Annotation Tools like Labelbox, Prodigy, etc.
Data Analysis and Visualization like Pandas, NumPy, Matplotlib, Seaborn, etc.
Docker
Kubernetes
AWS
Kafka
GIT 

Bonus Points

Existing exposure to Go, AWS, Cassandra, Kafka, Elasticsearch.
Experience with Language Models, Data Science, Data Engineering.
Experience with data labeling and annotation tools, particularly in a cybersecurity context.

Benefits Of Working At CrowdStrike

Remote-first culture
Market leader in compensation and equity awards with option to participate in ESPP in eligible countries
Competitive vacation and flexible working arrangements
Physical and mental wellness programs 
Paid parental leave, including adoption 
A variety of professional development and mentorship opportunities
Access to CrowdStrike University, LinkedIn Learning and Jhanna
Offices with stocked kitchens when you need to fuel innovation and collaboration
Birthday time-off in your local country
Work with people who are passionate in our mission and Great Place to Work certified across the globe

We are committed to fostering a culture of belonging where everyone feels seen, heard, valued for who they are and empowered to succeed. Our approach to cultivating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture is rooted in listening, learning and collective action. By embracing the diversity of our people, we achieve our best work and fuel innovation - generating the best possible outcomes for our customers and the communities they serve.

CrowdStrike is committed to maintaining an environment of Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action. If you need reasonable accommodation to access the information provided on this website, please contact Recruiting@crowdstrike.com , for further assistance."
