Title:
Data Analyst : A/B-tests and customer onboarding (Remote)
Data Analyst : A/B-tests and customer onboarding (Remote)
Industry: Software Development 201-500 employees 458 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
About Us

Constructor powers product search and discovery for some of the largest retailers in the world, like Sephora and Petco. We serve billions of requests every day, and you've probably seen our results somewhere and used our product without knowing it. We differentiate ourselves by focusing on metrics over features, and reinventing search and discovery from the ground up as a machine learning challenge with the specific goal of improving metrics like revenue. We have grown several hundred percent YoY for the last 2 years and have customers in every eCommerce vertical, around the world, and spanning many languages.

We're a passionate team of technologists who love solving problems and want to make our customers' and coworkers' lives better. We value empathy, openness, curiosity, continuous improvement, and are excited by metrics that matter. We believe that empowering everyone in a company to do what they think is best can lead to great things.

Data Science Integrations team

Providing measurable KPI lifts is the goal of our platform, and most customers want to prove it running an A/B-test against either an in-house solution or one of our competitors. We have no doubts that our product discovery platform is the most effective on the market, and constantly prove it with huge conversion lifts in tests.

The Data Science Integrations team ensures that we run successful A/B tests at scale while minimizing manual engineering effort. The team owns the customer onboarding process from a data quality standpoint, verifies the quality of customer integrations and tracking, and ensures that Constructor algorithms work as expected when ramping out tests to live customers

The team consists of a mix of data analysts & data engineers. As a member of the Data Science Integrations team, you will use world-class analytical, engineering and data processing techniques to build the foundational infrastructure, tooling and analytical capabilities to enable the business to move forward. You will be working with leading e-commerce companies in the world to make our platform work at 100%, collaborating with almost every engineering team at Constructor.

Challenges you will tackle

Take initiative and perform data exploration to understand user behavior, suggest opportunities for improving our recommender & search systems, and implement pipelines for data delivery, as well as UX/UI changes
Ideate and deliver analytical insights to merchandizers to enable effective decision making and provide the best possible results during evaluation
Help the Customer Success team to communicate with merchandizers, fulfill their needs during integration, and provide best results for online metrics
Collaborate with the Customer Integrations team to make sure customers are integrated without bugs and with sufficient tracking to power data pipelines and models for search engine


Requirements

You are proficient in BI tools (data analysis, building dashboards for engineers and non-technical folks)
You are an excellent communicator with the ability to translate business asks into a technical language and vice versa
You are excited to leverage massive amounts of data to drive product innovation & deliver business value
You're familiar with math statistics (A/B-tests)
You are proficient at SQL (any variant), well-versed in exploratory data analysis with Python (pandas & numpy, data visualization libraries). Big plus is practical familiarity with the big data stack (Spark, Presto/Athena, Hive)
You are adept at fast prototyping and providing analytical support for initiatives in the e-commerce space by identifying & focusing on relevant features & metrics
You are willing to develop and maintain effective communication tools to report business performance and inform decision-making at a cross-functional level
Stack: athena/presto, python (notebooks), databricks, google analytics


Benefits

Unlimited vacation time -we strongly encourage all of our employees take at least 3 weeks per year
A competitive compensation package including stock options
Company sponsored US health coverage (100% paid for employee)
Fully remote team - choose where you live
Work from home stipend! We want you to have the resources you need to set up your home office
Apple laptops provided for new employees
Training and development budget for every employee, refreshed each year
Parental leave for qualified employees
Work with smart people who will help you grow and make a meaningful impact


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Constructor

At Constructor.io we are committed to cultivating a work environment that is diverse, equitable, and inclusive. As an equal opportunity employer, we welcome individuals of all backgrounds and provide equal opportunities to all applicants regardless of their education, diversity of opinion, race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, veteran status or affiliation in any other protected group. Studies have shown that women and people of color may be less likely to apply for jobs unless they meet every one of the qualifications listed. Our primary interest is in finding the best candidate for the job. We encourage you to apply even if you don't meet all of our listed qualifications."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Insurance 5,001-10,000 employees 4,485 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
This is an exciting time to become part of Tryg. With a strong focus on digitalization and data, our strategic ambition is to develop and improve our Data Transparency by offering a new and better solution across the Nordic.

We are in search for a new colleague within the Data Team, to help develop the future Data Transparency solution. Would you like to be a part of the development?

About Us

As a part of the Tryg transformation journey, Data Transparency is a crucial enabler for decision making. We are building end to end transparency of our system and application landscape where we are adding additional data layers to ensure the right perspectives and viewpoints to the organization.

The Transformation Office has the overall responsibility to drive the transformation Tryg is undergoing, and as a part of this, ensuring Data Transparency is critical.

You will become part of Business IT & Digitalization (BID), which today consists of approximately 700 dedicated employees across the Nordics, who support the current development of Tryg Group.

The Data Team is a part of our Transformation Office, which today consists of 8 people that work closely with other departments across the organization, in close cooperation with the Enterprise Architects and Finance.

About The Role

You will be a part of af team responsible for driving, defining and implementing the IT Data Transparency across Nordics.

We gather data from various systems, primarily through APIs, transform the data within our pipeline, and store it in SQL databases. Subsequently, the data is imported into Power BI, where we develop sophisticated and user-friendly reports.

As our Data Analyst you will be responsible for and ensuring:

 logical data coherence across systems according to the business requirements 
 understanding and translating data into communicative views through PowerBI, but also manual/excel reporting in interim phases 
 continuous development and maintenance of the reporting, primarily in PowerBI 
 driving the stakeholder management and ensure clear communication and alignment on requirements, expects outcomes and priorities. 

Within out Data Team, each member has their specific areas of expertise. However, given the size of our team, we place a strong emphasis on mutual support. It is therefore essential that team members are willing and able to undertake tasks outside their primary areas of expertise when necessary.

About You

We imagine that you have work experience from a similar position, where you have gained extensive understanding and experience with Data Analytics and PowerBI. You can translate requirements and ensure end-to-end understanding of what it takes in collaboration with the rest of the team, through your strong stakeholder management skills.

You will be exposed to the following tech stack:

 SQL 
 Microsoft Azure 
 Python 

 Curious? 

Send your application as soon as possible, but no later than 10th of August, as we‚Äôll be conducting interviews continuously. Due to summer vacation, the response time might be a little longer than usual.

If you have any questions regarding the role, you are welcome to contact Director of Tech Transformation, Portfolio & Financial Management, Ema Ljubinac, on ema.ljubinac@tryg.dk .

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Junior Business Intelligence Specialist
Junior Business Intelligence Specialist with verification
Industry: Software Development 201-500 employees 370 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Meet Sievo
At Sievo, we help the world's largest organizations make effective and timely decisions by creating smart and seamless procurement analytics software solutions. Our solutions are built in-house with the focus on continuous development.

At the core of our success are talented and passionate people. Sievo prides itself in creating a collaborative, welcoming, and enriching environment. We put people first, celebrate diversity and drive innovation.
We are now looking for a Junior Business Intelligence Specialist to join our Solution Support team in Bucharest to enable the growth we are experiencing.

About Us
Solution Support is a team of highly driven individuals who hold the happiness of our customers dear to our hearts. We currently have team members in Helsinki and Chicago and are now looking for more team members to join us in Bucharest! We offer support to our global customer base with operative issues and questions, as well as design and implement more complex technical functionalities.

Sievo is one of the fastest-growing procurement software companies in the world, however we feel that we have just scratched the surface and want to have an even bigger impact on the market.

We have a passion for data and analytics, enjoy working with customers and helping them solve complex procurement analytics-related problems, possess a certain intellectual curiosity for learning new as well a drive to get things done. We do value getting the work done ‚Äì but also relaxing after. Join us now to have a front-row seat for this great growth adventure!

About You
As a Junior Business Intelligence Specialist, you will
Serve our existing, diverse customer base globally and support all the different solutions we offer
Be the first in line tackling the challenges our customers have, advise them when they have questions about our software, and implement configuration changes to their environments using SQL and Qlik BI tools
Actively communicate with our customers in writing through our customer support software and occasionally participate in customer meetings
Take the initiative to solve the support requests on your own or by cooperating with your teammates, Customer Success Managers, software development teams and directly with customers
Take part in the continuous development of our internal processes and ways-of-working
Work mainly during the daytime, but be available for evening shifts that end at 1 am to offer support for our customers in the Americas

What typically gives a good starting point for a Junior Business Intelligence Specialist?
Understanding of relational databases, SQL or some other programming language, and/or Qlik BI tools
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Independent working style and taking ownership of what you do
Ability to learn quickly and figure out how to use new software
Strong desire to serve and support customers
Good communication skills
Fluency in English, other language skills are appreciated
Also, basic understanding of the Procurement/Finance context is a plus

What We Offer
A great place to work in downtown Bucharest with a relaxed work environment
A highly international setting with exciting global customers such as Levi‚Äôs, Orkla and Carlsberg, and a group of great people with diverse backgrounds
A company culture that challenges you to exceed and enables you to learn
A caring manager and teammates who will support you in your growth
Freedom and responsibility. We are looking for people who yearn for this freedom, are able to make the most out of it and are willing to take on the responsibility
Awesome perks such as private medical subscription, flexible benefits package, referral bonus, extra 5 days of vacation, and many more!

The pay for this position ranges from 4500 to 5000 RON/net per month. This is a full-time position and offers a great starting point at Sievo for someone with strong analytical skills and a customer service mindset.

How to Apply
We would love to hear from you next!

Send us your CV and motivational letter through our recruitment system. And yes, bonus points for videos :)
The application screening is done on an ongoing basis, and the position will be filled as soon as a suitable candidate has been found. So, if we sparked your interest, don't hesitate to apply already today!


At Sievo, we celebrate and support differences and strive to create a culture where everyone feels valued and included. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we do not discriminate against any individual in hiring or employment based on gender, gender identity or expression, age, ethnic or national origin, nationality, language, religion or belief, opinion, disability, state of health, sexual orientation, or other personal reasons."

Title:
Emerton Data - Data Scientist & Strategy Associate Consultant Internship
Emerton Data - Data Scientist & Strategy Associate Consultant Internship
Industry: Business Consulting and Services 51-200 employees 86 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
EMERTON DATA 
https://www.emerton-data.com/
Emerton Data is dedicated to digital and advanced data analytics activities. It is led by experienced partners in both data science & AI and management consulting. We support companies in their sustainability and digital transitions.
Emerton Data provides above standards data science and AI services. We help companies use data to drive decisions, create impact, and transform businesses. We empower organizations to become more data-driven by providing first-class advisory solutions and make-it-happen support.
We also help corporations designing their data strategies to give them a competitive edge and can support the transformation of businesses from top-line to bottom-line. Our clients are mainly large international corporations in the energy, consumer good, food services, industry, TMT, and insurance sectors.
Emerton Data offers both the environment of a fast-changing tech culture, together with the challenging and international work environment of Emerton, a high-standard Strategy Consulting firm, with offices in Paris, London, Munich and New-York. Emerton is listed by Vault ranking among the best 20 consulting firms to work for in Europe.
In the context of our fast-paced development we are looking for talented Interns to join our team in Paris.
YOUR ROLE
This position offers a dual-track as Data Scientist and Strategy Consultant. You will have the opportunity to contribute to a variety of projects:
Strategy projects (e.g., strategic due diligence, market opportunity, full potential strategic plan, etc.) that can be linked to data & AI topics or not
Data & AI strategy projects (e.g., data roadmap connected to business strategy, Responsible AI governance)
Data use case delivery projects (industrialized products), that often includes the following tasks: data science modeling, machine learning and advanced data processing and visualizations
Advanced data analytics projects (e.g., in-depth analysis of complex data such as order book data on energy markets)
After an onboarding period and under the guidance of partners and experienced consultants, you will join a project team and contribute to solving the client's toughest problems, for instance:
‚Ä¢ Conduct interviews, market analysis
‚Ä¢ Analyze facts and translate them into meaningful insights and recos
‚Ä¢ Identify, scope, and prioritize use cases
‚Ä¢ Collect and process data, using scraping technologies
‚Ä¢ Prepare data, both structured and non-structured
‚Ä¢ Find the adequate model to solve the problem
‚Ä¢ Implement machine learning algorithms and relevant optimizations
‚Ä¢ Find insights and communicate
‚Ä¢ Program code at best standards to ensure proper industrialization
‚Ä¢ Create meaningful and useful data products and visualizations
WHAT WE OFFER
- A full strategy consulting experience and its fast-paced learnings
- A solid culture of excellence, experienced at unleashing our talents' full potential
- Projects of major interest with key actors of our industries (Energy, Mobility, TMT, Industrial Goods, Healthcare)
- Early and accompanied client exposure
- Competitive compensation and benefits
- Flexible work from home/from the office policy (up to 4 days a week)
- An inclusive company culture in which individuals can be their authentic selves (Vault ranking Top 10 for Diversity & Inclusion)
WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR
‚Ä¢ MSc in the field of General Engineering, Computer Science, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Mathematics
‚Ä¢ Programming experience in Python, SQL
‚Ä¢ Strong interest in finding data science solutions to business problems
‚Ä¢ Sharp problem-solving capabilities, business acumen
‚Ä¢ Some experience in statistical modeling and machine learning techniques
‚Ä¢ Knowledge of the data techno ecosystem is a plus: NoSQL, Container technologies (Docker), cloud (AWS, Google Cloud Platform, Azure), Gitlab.
‚Ä¢ Excellent oral and written communication skills; in particular, flawless command of oral and written English and French"

Title:
Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst
Industry: Financial Services 201-500 employees 222 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.

Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you‚Äôre in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.

Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!

We are seeking a talented and driven Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategies and driving growth.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of decision-making, unlocking valuable insights from data and transforming them into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, problem-solving, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

What you might be doing:


Identify Business Opportunities: Take the lead in exploring new business opportunities for our products and services. Utilise your analytical skills to generate hypotheses and assess the potential benefits of each opportunity, providing valuable insights and driving strategic decisions
App User Activity Analysis: Dive deep into user activity within our app to uncover meaningful patterns, correlations, or bottlenecks. Your keen eye for detail will be essential in identifying areas for improvement and optimising user experiences
Data-Driven Insights: Leverage various data analysis techniques to transform raw data into actionable insights. Your ability to draw meaningful conclusions will be instrumental in guiding the company towards growth and success
Collaboration and Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and measure the impact of the most promising opportunities. Your role as a liaison between the data team and business squads will be essential in ensuring seamless communication and execution
Data Ambassador: Be the primary point of contact and ambassador for the data team within specific business squads. Your expertise will play a crucial role in aligning data-related objectives with overall business goals
Continuous Learning: Exhibit a hunger for knowledge and continuously strive to ask relevant and insightful questions. Embrace new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis processes




What you might bring:


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven insights to influence business decisions
Excellent communication and presentation abilities to convey data insights in a clear and understandable manner
Proficiency in SQL 
Experience with data analysis in Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib) 
Experience with statistics (A/B testing, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing) is a plus
Ability to collect, organise, and analyse large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail. 
Independent and proactive, have the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment




Why you should apply: 


 Freedom to build the company of your dreams
 Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business
 BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system
 Flexible working hours
 25 working days of vacation + local holidays
 We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work
 Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one!
 Continuous learning and development opportunities




If our job description speaks to you, but you don‚Äôt feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!

Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!"

Job Description:
"About the job
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Experian ist ein globales Daten- und Technologieunternehmen, das Menschen und Unternehmen weltweit neue Chancen er√∂ffnet. Mit unserer einzigartigen Kombination aus Daten, Analytics und Software haben wir uns auch in der DACH-Region als einer der f√ºhrenden Dienstleister f√ºr Risiko-, Fraud- und Identit√§ts-Management etabliert.

Unternehmen aller Gr√∂√üen und Branchen unterst√ºtzen wir, smartere Entscheidungen zu treffen, verantwortungsbewusster Kredite zu vergeben und sich sowie ihre Kunden vor Identit√§tsbetrug und Kriminalit√§t zu sch√ºtzen.

Wir investieren in unsere talentierten Mitarbeitenden sowie in neue, fortschrittliche Technologien, um die Macht der Daten zu nutzen und Innovationen voranzubringen. Wir besch√§ftigen 22.500 Mitarbeitende in 32 L√§ndern und sind ein FTSE 100-Unternehmen, das an der Londoner B√∂rse (EXPN) notiert ist. Unser Hauptsitz befindet sich in Dublin, Irland.

Stellenbeschreibung

Stellenbeschreibung

Wir suchen nach einem Junior Data Analyst (m/w/d), um unser Analytics, Consulting and Customer Services Team zu verst√§rken. In dieser Position arbeitest Du an vorderster Front mit, wenn wir unseren Kunden aus verschiedenen Branchen mit Daten und Modellen dabei helfen, Kreditrisiken richtig einzusch√§tzen und smarte Entscheidungen zu treffen. Zus√§tzlich erh√§ltst Du die Chance, im Unternehmen Impulse zum Thema AI/ ML zu setzen.

Die Hauptaufgaben Dabei Sind

Dein Fokus liegt auf analytischen und methodischen Fragestellungen im Kredit-Risikomanagement. Spannende Themen erwarten dich z.B. im Umfeld der Kreditw√ºrdigkeitspr√ºfung, Identit√§tsfeststellung oder bei der Erkennung von Fraudmustern.
Du arbeitest an kundennahen Themen, generierst und analysierst Daten und bereitest Deine Ergebnisse adressatengerecht auf.
Mit unseren Experian Data Services und weiteren Daten entwickelst Du analytische L√∂sungen, die unseren Kunden und deren Kunden Vorteile bringen.
Du unterst√ºtzt in enger Abstimmung mit Deinen direkten Kollegen und unserem Sales-Team bei der Kundenansprache und in der Vorbereitung von Terminen.

Qualifikationen

Fachlich versierte und methodisch sichere Mitarbeit in der Durchf√ºhrung von analytischen Projekten, sowohl in der Beratung und Mehrwertbetrachtung bei der kundenseitigen Anwendung von Experian Data Services, als auch in der Entwicklung und Validierung von Modellen unter Hinzunahme interner und externer Daten
Idealerweise hast Du bereits erste Erfahrungen und Fachwissen im Kredit-Risikomanagement sammeln k√∂nnen.

Title:

Data Analyst, Product Team with verification

Job Description:
"About the job
About Satispay

At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone‚Äôs life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

üöÄ Join us as Data Analyst - Product Team and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview

As a Data Analyst, Product Team, you will join the Tech & Product team and collaborate closely with stakeholders from the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams to identify business needs and uncover analytics opportunities.

Your Mission

Deliver real impact. Bring concrete impact to the product through research and implementation of rigorous data-driven solutions.
Analyze performance. Conduct thorough analysis of product usage and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement.
Generate actionable insights. Distill insights from big data and make recommendations to drive product decisions and future developments.
Design and optimize experiments. Develop and manage A/B tests to optimize and guide product enhancements.
Create and maintain dashboards. Track key metrics and visualize insights to inform stakeholders and drive data-driven decisions.
Manage analytic solutions. Modernize, standardize, troubleshoot, and maintain existing analytic solutions to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Stay current with industry trends. Continuously evolve the organization by adopting best-in-class technologies and techniques.
Enhance data-driven culture. Support decision-making and promote a data-driven culture through ad-hoc analyses and insights.

Your Ideal Profile

Proven experience and analytical skills. You have 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics and can apply high-level analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills to various scenarios. Experience in Product Analytics is a plus.
Expertise in programming. You possess advanced knowledge of SQL and query optimization, as well as extensive knowledge of Python or R. Additionally, you have experience with Looker, Tableau, or similar technologies.
Detail-oriented and communicative. You have a maniacal attention to detail and enjoy executing complex projects. You can communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust in a positive and professional way with various stakeholders.
Passion for fintech or startup environments. You are enthusiastic about working in dynamic, innovative settings.
Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Your Perks as a Satisperson

üçΩÔ∏è Fuel your day with our meal vouchers

üåê Preply language platform access to expand your language skills

‚≠ê Benefit from our 1.2k company welfare budget

üöÄ Own part of Satispay‚Äôs success with our Stock Option Plan

üë©üèª‚Äçüíª Gear up with our tech equipment

ü•≥ Join us in the fun with team-building events, parties, trips, and more!

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

"About the job
Senior BI Data Scientist 
Location: 100% Remote ‚Äì Home Base in Malta or other European Countries
Salary: ‚Ç¨80,000-‚Ç¨100,000 Dependent on Experience
Ref: J12815
 
A global leader in immersive and interactive AI is in search of an experienced Senior BI Data Scientist to transform raw data into valuable insights that inform strategic decision making across the organisation. You will be an exceptional communicator who excels at translating technical information to a wide audience.

Key Responsibilities:
Work with data engineer to set up the data infrastructure, including data warehouse and data visualisation.

Develop and maintain scalable data management systems, integrating data from various sources using advanced data extraction and transformation techniques.

Collaborate with different teams to understand their data needs and deliver comprehensive BI solutions.

and visualization tools, with big data and machine learning a plus. For example:

PyTorch expertise in data management, including extraction, cleaning, and
transformation of data.

Essential Soft Skills:
Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex data in an understandable manner.
Strong problem-solving abilities and a keen attention to detail.
Ability to lead and collaborate effectively within cross-functional teams.
Strong time management skills, with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously under tight deadlines.
Business acumen with an understanding of company goals and industry trends.

Title:
BI Analyst (Cloud) - Remote
BI Analyst (Cloud) - Remote with verification
Industry: Software Development 5,001-10,000 employees 9,375 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description

Do strategic analytics excite you?

Do you like collaborating across teams to deliver operational excellence?

Join our Strategy and Operations Team!

Our Business Operations, Strategy & Analytics team partners with our Cloud Technology Group to meet the needs of our customers. We collaborate together to make smart, informed data-driven decisions. We empower the business with insights, transparency and alignment across teams, ensuring the voice of the customer is embedded in everything we do.

Partner with the best

As a Product Strategy & Operations Analyst you will coordinate business with technical teams across Akamai. You will be responsible for analysis and data management supporting functional organizations within the Cloud Technology group. You will work closely with major stakeholders within the Platform, Product and Finance organization.

As a Product Strategy & Operations Analyst, you will be responsible for-

Identifying and implementing high performance business value creation and transformation through data and analysis
Providing Data Intelligence by designing, developing, and building dashboards and data sources by leveraging enterprise reporting systems
Developing and building metrics and key success measures for the business
Enabling better and proactive decision making, in areas including capacity delivery, financial performance and operations
Collaborating with CTG business partners and leaders to provide ad-hoc insights and/or regularly published reports
Leading the technical design of queries and models

Do What You Love

To be successful in this role you will-

Have advanced working knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Google Sheets including experience with pivot tables, v-lookup, formatting
Have programming experience in SQL
Have experience with data visualization and analysis tools (Tableau preferred)
Have experience analyzing data to provide actionable solutions and thought leadership to facilitate larger organizational initiatives
Be able to work cross-functionally and interact effectively with all levels of the organization
Have excellent written and verbal communications skills

Work in a way that works for you

FlexBase, Akamai's Global Flexible Working Program, is based on the principles that are helping us create the best workplace in the world. When our colleagues said that flexible working was important to them, we listened. We also know flexible working is important to many of the incredible people considering joining Akamai. FlexBase, gives 95% of employees the choice to work from their home, their office, or both (in the country advertised). This permanent workplace flexibility program is consistent and fair globally, to help us find incredible talent, virtually anywhere. We are happy to discuss working options for this role and encourage you to speak with your recruiter in more detail when you apply.

Learn what makes Akamai a great place to work

Connect with us on social and see what life at Akamai is like!

We power and protect life online, by solving the toughest challenges, together.

At Akamai, we're curious, innovative, collaborative and tenacious. We celebrate diversity of thought and we hold an unwavering belief that we can make a meaningful difference. Our teams use their global perspectives to put customers at the forefront of everything they do, so if you are people-centric, you'll thrive here.

Working for you

At Akamai, we will provide you with opportunities to grow, flourish, and achieve great things. Our benefit options are designed to meet your individual needs for today and in the future. We provide benefits surrounding all aspects of your life-

Your health
Your finances
Your family
Your time at work
Your time pursuing other endeavors

Our benefit plan options are designed to meet your individual needs and budget, both today and in the future.

About Us

Akamai powers and protects life online. Leading companies worldwide choose Akamai to build, deliver, and secure their digital experiences helping billions of people live, work, and play every day. "About the job
Rahantech is hiring a skilled Data Analyst / Data Engineer on behalf of a fast-growing company in Germany.

Title:
Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Industry: Information Technology & Services 51-200 employees 99 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do

Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making


Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English


What We Offer

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Food and Beverage Services 501-1,000 employees 325 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
About us

We are a multinational food company that conserves the goodness of nature in our products. We carefully select our fruit and vegetables from their origin, maintaining the highest quality and safety throughout the production process.

We pride ourselves in providing consumers with natural, healthy, and nutritious products that have made us a reference in infant and adult nutrition. In addition, the Hero Institute of Infant Nutrition is within the Hero Spain facilities.

Website: www.hero.es

Sector: Food company

Company size: More than 4,000 employees

Headquarters: Lenzburg, Switzerland

Company type: Private company

Categories: Baby food, Healthy Snacks, Natural Spreads, Sauces, Juices and Nectars, Cereal Snacks, Prepared meals

What is our commitment?

We are on a mission to delight consumers by conserving the goodness of nature. The world today is different from what it was 10 years ago, and nothing like it was in 1886 when Hero was founded in Lenzburg, Switzerland. However, our core goals remain the same. We have adapted to change, offering consumers high quality, healthy, natural and sustainable food.

Hero Spain, with its headquarter in Alcantarilla (Murcia), has formed part of this legacy since 1922. We are committed to naturalness in our products, maintaining a firm nutritional commitment and constantly improving thanks to our commitment to continuous innovation and research, to adapt to the needs of consumers, customers, and new market trends.

Team value proposition

Recently, Hero Spain has been certified as a #TopEmployer in 2023 and 2024 üèÜ, an achievement that reflects our ongoing commitment to the well-being and development of our team of talents. This recognition is a testament to the exceptional culture we have cultivated together, positioning us as one of the best companies to work for in Spain. This would not have been possible without the commitment and dedication of every person who is part of the Hero family.

We don't hire top talent so we can tell them what to do. That doesn't make sense. At Hero, we give you the opportunity to make your mark and contribute to something bigger. We‚Äôll give you the tools and skills to do your job and then get out of the way.

Purpose

We are on a mission to conserve what's good in nature. We do so by striving to conduct our business sustainably and striving to do the right thing. Always. Without compromises.

Values
The new values reflect the company today and the company we want to build in the future. Values are at the heart of who we are as people and they guide how we behave.

Create wow
We dare to do things differently, seek to always win with consumers and customers, and endeavor to be forever relevant and vital to our world. It‚Äôs about Curiosity, Innovation and Consumer/Customer Focus.
Everyone Hero
We work together in pursuit of our common mission and strategy, strengthening our local businesses by leveraging the power of the collective. It‚Äôs about Purpose, Performance and Teamwork.
Nourish others
We treat everyone with honesty, care and respect and provide our people, customers and consumers with what they need to thrive. It‚Äôs about Honesty, Empowerment, Respect and Diversity.
Take responsibility
We make good choices today to build a more sustainable business and environment fit for the needs of tomorrow. It‚Äôs about Sustainability, Ownership, Heritage and Quality.

Impact

We value good ideas, so we want the best talent. Our people can make a difference because we give them the freedom to act, to be entrepreneurial, and to make a difference. This is reflected in the responsibilities. Be yourself, be impactful.

Growth

We all win if we grow together. It's about professional and personal growth. The best way to grow as a company is to help you grow as a person, hence the availability of learning and development opportunities.

Meet you future department

The Finance department owns the financial close process and produces financial statements and reports to guide strategic decision-making.

How can you help us?

As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing large datasets to extract valuable insights and generate ideas that drive strategic decision-making within the company. Your ability to understand and use Business Intelligence tools, as well as your experience in the SAP environment, will be essential for success in this role.

Your main responsibilities

Gather and analyze data from multiple sources, including internal databases, SAP systems, and other relevant data sources.
Develop and maintain BI reports and dashboards to provide actionable insights to different departments.
Identify trends, patterns, and opportunities for improvement through data analysis.
Collaborate with interdisciplinary teams to understand the requirements of different areas and translate them into data analysis solutions.
Maintain and optimize existing BI systems, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Provide training and support to end users in the use of BI tools and SAP systems.
Participate in continuous improvement projects to drive efficiency and effectiveness of data analysis within the organization.

Academic Background

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.
Proficiency in Spanish and B2-C1 level of English.
Experience working with SAP systems (preferably SAP HANA) and in Master Data analysis and control.
Proven experience in data analysis, preferably in a business environment.
Proficiency in Business Intelligence tools, with particular value placed on Power BI.
Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel and Power Platform, Databases, DAX.

Skills and competences

Strong analytical skills and ability to translate data into meaningful information, as well as representing it in graphical and visual reports.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work effectively both independently and as part of a team.
Results-oriented and able to manage multiple tasks simultaneously.

Others

Based in Spain

What do we offer you?

(Confidentiality is assured)
During these 100 years we have come a long way, but we want to continue doing so for another 100 years. To do so, we need talented, curious, innovative, collaborative, diverse and responsible people to be part of this great team.

Benefits
Hybrid work
Flexible Schedule and early finish on Fridays, also during summer months
Attractive Compensation & Benefits package
Physiotherapist
Continuous learning and development
Ongoing feedback
Collaborative and challenging multinational environment
Strong values
Matrix organization
Open and transparent culture
Great work environment
Amazing people
and much more!

Would you like to join us?

If you what to know more about Hero, access our web site: www.hero.es
If you want to dive into our commitment to sustainability, access our 2023 Annual Report."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
We are looking for a talented HR Data Analyst to join our team in our Paris or Montpelier office (Hybrid work possible).

You will report to the Global Rewards Director and your main goal will be to shape and infuse a data-driven culture within the HR department of Teads. You will promote data accuracy, drive digitalization, and provide actionable insights to support strategic HR decisions.

What will you do?

As an HR Data Analyst attached to the Total Rewards team, your goal is to help infuse a data-driven culture in the HR department of Teads.

Data Management: Maintain and clean HR databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Optimize data flows and ensure compliance with data protection standards.
Reporting & Analytics: Clean and maintain the HR database using our HRIS and other HR systems (e.g., BambooHR, ATS, Performance Management), improve, optimize, streamline, and automate HR data flows through the integration of multiple APIs, ensure employee data processing adheres to stringent data protection standards for various strategic and legal requirements (e.g., audits, shareholders, leadership, HR, unions, stakeholders), and develop a deeper understanding of internal and external data management, including predictive models.
Insights & Performance: Deliver HR Key Indicators aligned with HR Roadmap, and Business strategy ensuring harmonized analytics across 35+ countries and diverse markets. Maintain, and improve BI Dashboards to support stakeholders in the decision-making regarding People & Reward management (salary cost/budget, reward campaigns, staff HC/mouvements, surveys‚Ä¶) and ad hoc analysis. Make recommendations to assess people and rewards program's effectiveness for continuous improvement.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Build strong partnerships with HR, Finance, IT, Innovation and other key contributors. Manage stakeholders‚Äô expectations to ensure a cohesive alignment of practices with overarching business strategies and financial considerations.

What will you bring to the team?

Master's Engineering degree in Technology, Business Intelligence, Data Science (Bac +5) with a strong interest in HR. 
Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets (AppScript/TypeScript) or Excel (VBA-SQL), Database management (Access levels, data accuracy) and Data visualization tools (Looker, PowerBi‚Ä¶).
Fluent English with excellent communication skills
First experience in BI, Reporting, Data Analytics as an intern and/or apprentice would be appreciated.
Passionate about agile methodologies.
User support-oriented mindset and proactive approach.
Curious, fast learner and strong attention to details.
Experience with data architecture, managing multiple APIs, HR information system (Core, ATS, ideally Bamboo, Greenhouse and/or Anaplan) will be a plus

About Teads

Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media. As an end-to-end solution, Teads‚Äô modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies.

For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world‚Äôs best publishers and content providers. Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.

Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries."

Title:
Data Strategy Analyst
Data Strategy Analyst
Industry: Software Development 201-500 employees 365 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Clarity AI is a global tech company founded in 2017 committed to bringing societal impact to markets. We leverage AI and machine learning technologies to provide investors, governments, companies, and consumers with the right data, methodologies, and tools to make more informed decisions.

We are now a team of more than 300 highly passionate individuals from all over the world. Together, we have established Clarity AI as a leading sustainability tech company backed by investors and strategic partners such as SoftBank, BlackRock, and Deutsche B√∂rse, who believe in us and share our goals. We are dedicated to cultivating an exceptional workplace environment. We take pride in our culture, defined by our commitment to being fact-based, diverse, transparent, meritocratic, and flexible.

We have plans to continue growing our teams in Spain, the UK, and the US this year, so if you would like to join us on this rocket ship, keep reading! üìöYour work will shape and guide the sustainable decisions of consumers and investors worldwide.

About The Role

We are looking for a Data Analyst that will help us continue enhancing the usage of data for the fact-based decision making processes that Clarity AI has as one of their core values and lead the lifecycle of transforming raw data into structured information üöÄ

The role provides an opportunity to join a dynamic, talented, diverse and young company, as well as be part of the team that leads Data acquisition...one of the foundations of Clarity AI value proposition ü™¥

What You'll Be Doing

Working as a Data Analyst you will be responsible for:

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems
Cleanse data and scrutinize reports and outputs to identify and rectify errors
Developing and maintaining data dashboards, charts used to support critical business monitoring
Performing ad-hoc complex data analysis using SQL and Python to support business initiatives
Conveying insights through both reports, dashboards and visual presentations
Collaborating with key stakeholders from the team to determine and rank the needs around forecasting and budget, as well as data collection monitoring and data sources usage
Collaborating with partners across lines of businesses and functions, navigating the organization and figuring out who is needed to get things done and understand data analysis requirements
Influencing key stakeholders through data analysis to establish a strong sense of collaboration towards a shared vision and goals
Identify opportunities for process enhancements


Location 

The role is based in Madrid or Barcelona üåç

Way of Working: Hybrid

Requirements

What You'll Need

Mastery in data analysis languages as excel, SQL, Python skills and/or R
Demonstrated experience working with BI Tools (Tableau, Quicksight, PowerBI etc)
Excellent analytical and problem solving skills
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights
Highly motivated, independent and deeply passionate about sustainability and impact
Years of Experience: At least 3 years of experience at a similar position
Educational Background: Degree in Business, Engineering or a quantitative discipline
Self-starter who will thrive in a start-up setting by taking ownership and initiative
Decisive and action-oriented who can get things done, make rapid decisions even when they are short of information, and someone who has high energy and stamina

Title:
eCommerce Data Analyst
eCommerce Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

"About the job
ABB E-mobility GmbH Are you passionate about Business Intelligence & Data Analytics and eager to make a meaningful impact on organizational success?

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

‚Ä¶ hebt ervaring of een eerste kennismaking met reporting en dashboardingtools zoals PowerBI.

‚Ä¶ wil je vooral smijten tijdens je volgende job.

What‚Äôs In It For You‚Ä¶

We bieden je een voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur (39u/week) aan. En vergeet ons hip hoofdkantoor in Vilvoorde niet! Hier bouwen we samen aan de knapste campagnes, heffen we regelmatig het glas op onze successen en niet onbelangrijk: we spotten er naar hartenlust schermgezichten!"

We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."
