Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Financial Services 51-200 employees 145 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Step into the future of fintech with Brite Payments! As our next Data Analyst, you'll play a pivotal role in advancing our innovative payment solutions through expert data analysis. Join our dynamic team in Stockholm, where your expertise will drive the evolution of Open Banking and A2A transactions. Your impact starts on day one, driving change in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.

About Brite 
Brite Payments is a leading Open Banking-powered Account to Account (A2A) payment provider of Instant Payments and Instant Payouts. We provide a convenient transaction experience for consumers and reduce the risk in the payment process for merchants. Founded in Stockholm in 2019, Brite is committed to providing the best possible payment solution for everyone involved in a transaction.

The team behind Brite has worked with launching the first-generation of fintech companies before founding Brite. We know the market landscape, technologies, opportunities, and challenges. Now we channel all those experiences into developing modern solutions that will benefit both merchants and end-users.

Want to join us on our journey? The future is brite!
 What You Will Do:
As a Data Analyst at Brite, you will take on the essential role of Finance Data Steward, overseeing the development and maintenance of our Finance Data Warehouse reporting to the CFO. You will also collaborate with colleagues from various departments within Brite‚Äôs Virtual Data Team, to enhance Bri+te‚Äôs data handling and reporting capabilities. Your responsibilities will include:
Develop reports towards different stakeholders to boost our analytical capabilities and support decision-making processes.
Serving as the Finance representative, you will address data and process requirements for the introduction of new products and markets.
Conducting investigations into potential errors in various system-generated jobs.
Taking charge of regulatory reporting to both Swedish and international authorities, ensuring compliance and accuracy.
Responding to ad-hoc requests from a diverse range of stakeholders, providing critical data insights on finance-related topics.

Are You a Brite Mind?
We are seeking a brite mind who possesses the ability to operate independently, yet demonstrating exceptional stakeholder management skills, a proactive can-do attitude, and the ability to foster collaboration across different teams and departments. The ideal candidate will have:
University degree in Mathematics, Economics, Statistics, Finance, or a related field.
Work experience as a Data Analyst or in a comparable role, with experience in a regulated industry being a plus.
Experience of working with large and diverse datasets
Strong SQL and Excel skills, along with data modeling capabilities; experience with DBT is a significant plus.
Proficiency in using dashboarding tools such as Tableau, Qlik, or Looker.
Excellent writing and communication skills in English
Interest in working with data across different dimensions, such as commercial, financials, operational dimensions.
Robust understanding of finance processes and at least basic knowledge of accounting principles.
Summer is here and vacation time has begun! This means our response time may be slightly longer than usual. We appreciate your patience and look forward to assisting you as soon as possible. Have a great summer!
What we offer
An optimistic, caring, and inclusive culture where we want you to be yourself
A dynamic, fast-paced, and innovative environment where you will have the possibility to make an impact from your first day onwards
A flat organization, friendly colleagues, and fast decision-making
An environment where we start small and learn fast to do big things
A team that cares about sharing, collaborative work, and prestigelessness
... and you will be part of a growing team of fun and skilled people ‚ú®
 Do you want to learn more about our recruitment process? Here you can read about the hiring flow and find answers to the most frequently asked questions.

Title:
Data Analyst (Hybrid)
Data Analyst (Hybrid) with verification
Industry: Financial Services 51-200 employees 106 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
About The Role

Embark on a transformative journey as a Data Analyst at Hokodo! In this role, you will play a pivotal part in leveraging data to optimise processes and drive growth within the fintech industry and at Hokodo.

As a Data Analyst, your primary focus will be on scaling our operations and enhancing efficiency through insightful data analysis and automation. Collaborating across various departments, including collections, payment ops, customer ops, and credit, you will apply your analytical prowess to uncover opportunities for data-driven improvements. By creating data visualisations and automating workflows, you'll contribute to streamlining operations and positioning Hokodo for continued success.

Location

We would like you to work from our office in Vilnius two days per week, joining our team of dedicated professionals and making your mark on the world of B2B e-commerce.

About Hokodo

We‚Äôre an international and diverse team, based in London, Vilnius and Paris, working to modernise B2B payments.


Our B2B Buy Now, Pay Later solution enables merchants to offer credit terms to their business customers instantly, resulting in a 40% average increase in revenue for integrated merchants.
We are scaling rapidly across Western Europe, with a list of stellar clients and have raised a total of over $50 million to support our mission of enabling 1 million businesses to access a better way to pay by 2025.
Join us in our efforts, as we have already made good progress with 50,000+ businesses regularly using Hokodo, but need your support to take us to the next level!


What you‚Äôll be doing - If you get excited by the following, this is the role for you. 


The honest answer is a little bit of everything when it comes to data! We are 100% in the cloud using Redshift, dbt, and Looker as the main tools with gitLab for version control.
We partner with pretty much every team across the organisation, you‚Äôll be working with them to help answer questions, and solve problems with data. You will also be a key part of our ‚ÄúHit Squads‚Äù, representing data in cross-functional teams who focus on solving the biggest challenges we face.
We own the data from once it hits our warehouse in its raw form right through to how it is consumed. This means you will be working to build on our transformation layer to create what you need for analysis and reporting.
Our self-serve ambitions mean that you‚Äôll need to be a go-to person for data, and help to develop the data literacy of everyone at Hokodo.


Who we‚Äôre looking for - At Hokodo, we prioritise hiring individuals who share our mission and values, and possess the right attitudes and behaviours for success. While some of the listed requirements may be important, don't worry if you don't meet all of them, we‚Äôd still like to hear from you. 


You have at least 3 years of experience working in data.
At Hokodo we are full-stack analysts and you are too, so you will have a track record of solving business problems, using the right tool for the right job and delivering value from data.
SQL is at the heart of everything we do in the data stack, so this is the main thing we‚Äôre looking for. If you are comfortable with window functions, CTEs then you are probably at the right level.
Everyone at Hokodo speaks English, so you will need to be fluent. We are a multi-national team who operate across Europe so If you speak another language as well then bonus points


Nice to have


Analytics Engineering is a big part of what we do, and while having direct experience of using dbt is not essential, you‚Äôre going to need to be interested in that part of the data lifecycle and getting hands on with it.
If you have used Looker in the past, then great! But having at least one BI tool under your belt would be beneficial.
We build bespoke web applications to support our customers and internal stakeholders, so having a bit of experience with Python would be helpful.


Interview Process


Intro, company fit and run through career history with the Talent team - 30-45 minutes - Video Call 
Technical, competency and team fit interview with the Hiring Manager - 45 minutes - Video Call
Case Study - Prepare at home and present your findings to the Hiring Manager and a member of the team over a Video Call - 60 minutes
Meet the team - Circa 30-45 minutes - Video Call


What‚Äôs in it for you?

We‚Äôre offering the chance to really make a difference to Hokodo and the wider B2B payments and e-commerce industry. The opportunity for personal growth in a fast-moving startup is massive. Your opinion and feedback will be heard and valued. You'll feel a part of a very special team.

We offer a competitive salary (‚Ç¨3,000 - ‚Ç¨4,000 gross/month depending on your profile and skills) and benefits package.

üìà Share Options

üéì Annual Learning and Development budget

‚úàÔ∏è Globetrotter travel policy: Spend up to 60 days abroad each calendar year

ü´Ç Taking well being seriously: Access to qualified therapist, confidentially via video or chat through Spill

üå¥ Yearly offsites and other company socials previously, we have been to Malta, Majorca and Vilnius, as well as regular meetups in London and Paris.

Our values

Hokodo is more than a place to work. We're passionate about making our industry better and aren't afraid of the competition. We pride ourselves on our culture of down to earth employees who are always willing to go the extra mile to help each other out!


Own the Outcome - We‚Äôre committed to our tasks, and take pride in the outcome. It‚Äôs never ‚Äúnot my job‚Äù. We are bold, we are brave, and we embrace change in all its forms. 
Trust and Build Trust - We are committed to earning and fostering trust through honest communication and deliberate actions. We support our team and value each other‚Äôs time, input, and take local decisions where possible. 
Never Be Satisfied - We challenge the norms and act boldly, even if it means failing. We are reflective, always learn from our mistakes, and continuously seek feedback and ways to improve. When something‚Äôs not quite right, we crave to fix it. We‚Äôre open to being challenged, and challenge others openly. 
No Passion, No Point - We bring passion and energy to everything we do. We get a lot done, and we have a good time doing it. We take every opportunity to celebrate our hard work, our wins - and some of our failures too! 
Be Genuine (No BS) - We are truthful and honest in our actions. We embrace and respect our individuality and encourage people to speak their mind. We are transparent and committed to doing what‚Äôs best for each other, our customers and our company. Put simply, we care. 


Don‚Äôt tick all of the boxes? Neither do we.

We are driven by hiring not only by experience and relevance for the role but also our mission and values, and possess the right attitudes and behaviours for success. We celebrate anything ‚Äòoutside of the box‚Äô, so if you don‚Äôt meet all of the listed tickbox criteria, please do still apply as we‚Äôd love to hear from you.

The diversity of our team reflects the diversity of our community and customers. We not only welcome but celebrate diverse communities. We feel we have an empowering environment where everyone is supported and respected, and we want you to feel this too. We welcome new ideas, thinking and approaches and listen intently, and we are strongly committed to learning and improving on this as we grow."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: IT Services and IT Consulting 501-1,000 employees 373 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Description

Are you an experienced data analyst looking to make a move to an innovative, forward-thinking tech company? Do you enjoy creating innovative analysis, finding impactful insights and answering key business questions? Good news! 1WorldSync is looking for a Data Analyst to join our Portugal team in Lisbon or Porto.

1WorldSync is the industry leader in product content management. With 600 employees across the US, Brazil, Canada, France, Portugal, Switzerland, Germany, and the UK, we‚Äôre seeking a Software Engineer to support our growing global team.

Role

Reporting to the Director, Data & Analytics, the Data Analyst will play a crucial role in our Data team. Your primary responsibility will be to collaborate with various departments including Product, Sales, Customer Success, and Engineering, to develop and implement automated, data-driven solutions and analytical tools that empower users to make effective decisions, both internally and externally to the company. You'll contribute to enhancing operational efficiencies and informing decision-making processes across the organization. As a Data Analyst, the successful candidate will:

Develop data-driven dashboards using Python, BigQuery SQL, and Power BI.
Conduct in-depth analysis of extensive datasets, extracting insights into patterns, trends, and seasonal fluctuations.
Perform ad-hoc analyses to address immediate business needs.
Identify opportunities for process optimization and implement automated solutions aligned with predefined objectives.
Apply analytical techniques to tackle operational challenges.
Assist in eliciting data requirements from cross-departments, including Customer Support, Product, Finance, Engineering and Sales teams.
Update, remove or archiving data flows in the context of Data Analysis, where applicable.
Maintain proper documentation for all queries, script and other tools used/developed, including processes and procedures.
Guide the data side process of performing A/B tests to aid in critical business decisions, including all related analytical work.
Translate Business Requirements into detailed functional specifications, training programs and process documentation. 
Follow security processes for the development of analytical tools/dashboards, including the operations and administration of related systems where these will be made available (e.g. Power BI).
Communicate and collaborate with internal and external customers to analyze information needs and functional requirements.
Assist in project feasibility and level-of-effort analysis by providing findings, with supported evidence, of the best approaches to take.
 Identify and manage risks with timely reporting and appropriately escalates issues.
Communicate solutions, designs, and processes with the QA, Development and launch teams.
Perform QA on developed solutions to ensure quality is as expected, before being reviewed by senior colleagues.
Other duties as assigned.

Required Skills And Experience

A professional with 1-3 years of experience in data analytics, with a strong foundation in analytical capabilities.
A graduate in Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science, or a related field.
Proficient in Python, BigQuery, and BigQuery SQL.
Skilled in predictive analytics and experienced in BI tools, particularly Power BI.

Desired Skills And Experience

Experience with A/B test theory and practice, including different methodologies applied in A/B testing and best practices.
Familiarity with BI UX design, dashboard layout, and chart/card design within the Domo platform.
Experience with cloud platform-based servers and systems.
Experience working with JIRA and Scrum.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office and Google Tool Suite (i.e. Google Sheets, Google Slides & Google Docs).
Capabilities in Data Science with Python and experience with Keras/Tensorflow for deep learning applications.
Familiarity with building Machine Learning models and deep learning for Data Science tasks.
Manage multiple priorities and deliver to project timelines.
Proven track record of delivery and cross functional collaboration.
Proven ability to assemble the appropriate resources to resolve issues quickly and innovatively.
Demonstrates 1WS Core Values in Action

Environment

Software: Domo, SQL, Python, Power BI, BigQuery

Benefits

Health-care provision
28 days paid vacation, as well as public holidays, and volunteer time off 
Summer and Winter salary payment
Daily meal allowance per day of effective work 
Employee assistance program, including health and wellbeing support

Additional Details

This is a remote position, with the option to work in the Porto or Lisbon office. with occasional visits to Porto or Lisbon offices. 
This role requires the candidate to have the authority to work in, and be located in Portugal.

1WorldSync is an Equal Opportunity Employer and is committed to providing employees and applicants with an environment free of discrimination and harassment. All employment decisions at 1WorldSync are based on business needs, job requirements, and individual qualifications. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, family or parental status, veteran or disability status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate.

1WorldSync will provide reasonable accommodations during the application process upon request as required to comply with applicable laws. If you have a disability and require assistance in this application process, please contact us at [email protected]."

"About the job
Company Description
AUTODOC is a multicultural tech-company active in 27 countries and with ~5000 people from over 50 nations where things are going fast forward. Job Description

Join AUTODOC as a Product Data Analyst and play a pivotal role in shaping and steering our product strategy through insightful data analysis and experimentation. Our mission is to transform insights into action, leveraging data driven decision making to refine our product offerings and customer experience.

In this role you will be responsible for creating and managing comprehensive reports and self-serving tools, conducting in-depth analysis of market trends and user behavior, and delivering statistical insights that highlight the impact of our product initiatives in the business.

"About the job

About Us

Pennylane is one of the fastest growing Fintechs in France (and soon to be in Europe!)

In 4 years of existence, we‚Äôve managed to:

üíª Make ourselves known as a groundbreaking accounting and financial software for small businesses and their accountants

üí∞ Raise a total of ‚Ç¨84 millions, including from Sequoia üå≤, the famous fund from the Silicon Valley who invested early in companies like Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Stripe, Paypal and much more...

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Grow from 7 cofounders to 350+ happy Pennylaners: we‚Äôre now recognized as one of the greatest places to work in France (but also remotely), with a 5/5 rating on Glassdoor and an e-NPS of 94

WHY this position is of utmost importance to reach our mission

This culture is embraced by the leadership team, and actively promoted everywhere. The role of the data team is to make this possible by treating data like a production asset, making it available company-wide, and using it proactively to improve Pennylane‚Äôs user experience.

By joining us as a Senior Data Analyst, you will have a pivotal role in large projects, bringing your business sense and analytical thinking to help us meet our high delivery standards.

HOW You Will Contribute To The Company

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be part of the Science & Analytics team (7+ people), inside the Data department (18+ people).

 You will proactively use data to identify opportunities to grow our business or improve our processes.
 You will be a real sparring partner for Product & Operation leaders, feed their strategy by anticipating the most important product and business questions, and leverage your data & statistical skills to answer them.
 You will drive our self-service approach to analytics, by understanding our colleague‚Äôs needs in their use of data, and promoting a data driven culture. The Science & Analytics team is also fully in charge of creating data models in the Data Warehouse (using dbt).
 You will contribute to shaping the Data Engineering roadmap to deliver the best experience for your colleagues on the data platform.

WHAT You Can Expect From Your Life At Pennylane

Within one month:

 You will learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week.
 You will get familiar with our stack, and have delivered a few small projects which will give you a concrete taste of our tools & processes.
 You will be given time to meet your future stakeholders, and gain a deep knowledge of our product and operations.

Within 3 months:

 You will be fully in charge of supporting some area of the business (product or operations), prioritizing your tasks with decision makers from this area.
 You will be confortable with our technical stack (Python, Redshift, dbt, PySpark).
 You will contribute to larger cross-company projects.

Within 6 months:

 You will proactively contribute to the team‚Äôs roadmap.
 You will work with engineers and data practitioners on improving our stack and data platform.
 You will share your learnings and best practices within the team.

And beyond: the data team will continue growing with the company

Which means:

 Opportunities to recruit and mentor new team members,
 Increased accountability in project leadership,
 Responsibilities to design and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even more efficiently.

What do we do to make your work life easier

üè¢ You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to, however, we would prefer for you to be based in Paris most of the time, as this is a Hybrid role.

üíµ You‚Äôll have a compensation package

üìà You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

üè° You‚Äôll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

‚õπÔ∏èThrough our partner Gymlib, you‚Äôll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

üá¨üáß You‚Äôll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

üíª You‚Äôll get the latest Apple equipment

üéâ You‚Äôll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

üè¢ You‚Äôll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

üèùYou‚Äôll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

üçú You‚Äôll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

üè• You‚Äôll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries. 

What does the recruitment process look like?

 A first interview with R√©mi, Tech Recruiter (30 min)
 A case study interview to discuss a topic closely related to one of our priorities (75 min)
 A past project interview to hear about your experience (60 min)
 An interview with our Tech & Product leaders to discuss our company culture (30 mn)

Who are we looking for ?

You may have noticed that there was no section listing the skills or qualities required to apply for this specific job. Researches have shown that some people are less likely to apply than others, if they don‚Äôt feel like they meet the full list of criteria. So we have decided to take it down entirely.

We have tried to give you as much details as we could about the purpose, missions and environment of this role; it is now up to you to tell us if you think this is a position in which you could a) have fun and b) bring value to our company.

If you‚Äôre hesitating, we encourage you to apply anyway: worst case scenario, you might lose a few minutes, and in the best case, it will be the start of a meaningful and long-lasting collaboration.

We also want to emphasize that we fully embrace diversity and that we‚Äôre doing our best to create a safe and inclusive environment. We are committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of gender, sexual orientation, origin, disabilities, or any other traits that make you who you are. If anything, diversity makes us a more fun place to work at.

To end with a humble illustration of our commitment, we‚Äôve recently signed the Pacte Parit√© to set concrete goals in building a better and more inclusive workplace in the years to come."

Title:

Data Governaance Analyst/Data Steward with verification
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 201-500 employees 204 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Governance Analyst 
Amsterdam, The Netherlands 
Salary up to 80k 

THE COMPANY 
This international organisation are looking for a Senior Data Governance Analyst to work within their growing Data team. Since their establishment they have won multiple awards and are now looking to grow their data function. This is a really exciting opportunity to be part of a greenfield working environment and work across a variety of projects.

THE ROLE 
In this you will be instrumental in developing and implementing a comprehensive data governance framework. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to define data policies, standards, and procedures, ensuring adherence to regulatory requirements and industry best practices. This is an exciting opportunity for a seasoned data governance professional who is passionate about shaping the data landscape of a forward-looking organization.
Responsibilities:
Develop and implement a robust data governance framework, including policies, standards, and procedures.
Collaborate with stakeholders to define and document data quality standards and metrics.
Establish and enforce data governance best practices to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance.
Lead efforts to classify and categorize data assets, and implement access controls based on sensitivity.
Oversee data stewardship programs, ensuring accountability for data quality and ownership.
Collaborate with IT and business units to implement and monitor data governance initiatives.
Stay current on industry trends, regulations, and emerging technologies related to data governance.

Qualifications:
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Information Management, Data Science, or a related field.
Proven experience in data governance, data management, or a related role.
In-depth understanding of data governance principles, practices, and industry standards.
Familiarity with regulatory requirements related to data, such as GDPR, HIPAA, or other industry-specific standards.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and drive change.
Experience in implementing data governance tools and technologies is a plus.

Benefits:
Fantastic benefits on offer"

Title:
Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Industry: Personal Care Product Manufacturing 501-1,000 employees 628 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

Created in France in 1978 by Dr. Michel Tordjman, Laboratoires Filorga has been part of the Colgate-Palmolive group since 2019.

With a presence in over 70 countries, Laboratoires Filorga is an international brand that develops high-performance anti-aging solutions, offering a line of dermo-cosmetics: innovative formulas and high-tech ingredients derived from the Laboratory's expertise. 

Colgate-Palmolive Company is a caring, innovative growth company that is reimagining a healthier future for all people, their pets and our planet. Focused on Oral Care, Personal Care, Home Care and Pet Nutrition, we sell our products in more than 200 countries and territories under brands such as Colgate, Palmolive, elmex, hello, meridol, Sorriso, Tom‚Äôs of Maine, EltaMD, Filorga, Irish Spring, PCA SKIN, Protex, Sanex, Softsoap, Speed Stick, Ajax, Axion, Fabuloso, Soupline and Suavitel, as well as Hill‚Äôs Pet Nutrition.

We are recognized for our leadership and innovation in promoting sustainability and community wellbeing, including our achievements in decreasing plastic waste and promoting recyclability, saving water, conserving natural resources and improving children‚Äôs oral health.

If you want to work for a company that lives by their values, then give your career a reason to smile and join our global team!

What you will do:

In the Consumer & Marketing Insights department, you will work closely with Brand management, Finance, Marketing and Commercial teams to help them in their day to day & strategic thinking needs, constantly exploring new opportunities for business growth.

Reporting to the Consumer & Marketing Insights Director, you will be responsible for:

Business reporting and deep diving into market dynamics & consumer knowledge to drive insights and strategic recommendations: 
Understand & master countries‚Äô & categories‚Äô dynamics (Europe, Asia, North America) 
Deliver analytic insights to track performances of Filorga and our competitors: global market evolution, by category, new products, etc. 
Build operational competitor deep dives: the objective is to have a better understanding of competitors‚Äô strategies (portfolio management, distribution, pricing, launches, communication = 360 vision)
You will contribute to transversal projects, deep diving into market dynamics & consumer knowledge and combining resources from various areas to find out business opportunities 
Be the consumer champion by developing a deep understanding of consumer insights, unmet needs, marketplace trends, and the competitive environment 
You will also support top management/marketing/trade/countries in day to day questions
Data crunching and data automation: 
You will mine multiple sources of data and you will be in charge of the regular update of reporting tools (shared with the whole organization)
Check data quality and challenge data providers if needed
Work on building and maintaining data base & KPI reporting 
Automation/visualization: Build one global dashboard where all countries' data is available with the CBS (Center of Business Services) team (internal business consulting) 
Demonstrate use of data visualization 
Required Qualifications

Minimum 5 years working experience with data and minimum 3 years experience in similar assignments (using R or Python for data analysis)
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer science, IT 
Advanced skills on R and Shiny
Google analytics experience preferred
Prior working experience in skincare, health or beauty preferred
Analytical minded, with the capacity to summarize & extract key insights with a clear purpose
Be able to communicate your findings clearly and explain them. 
Be able to use your Marketing and business experience to translate the department's needs in requests than you can execute or pass to a technical team (translate marketing needs into data needs)
Confident to take the lead and present your projects
Rigorous, responsive, curious and proactive
Excellent planning and organization skills, ability to manage several projects and deadlines at once
Interest for beauty and consumer trends 
Strong storytelling and presentation skills - ability to find clear and compelling ways to communicate rich consumer insights to multi-functional partners with clear implications that drive action
Fluent French
Excellent written and oral English 

Our Commitment to Sustainability

With the Colgate brand in more homes than any other, we are presented with great opportunities and new challenges as we work to integrate sustainability into all aspects of our business and create positive social impact. We are determined to position ourselves for further growth as we act on our 2025 Sustainability & Social Impact Strategy.

Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity & Inclusion

Achieving our purpose starts with our people ‚Äî ensuring our workforce represents the people and communities we serve ‚Äîand creating an environment where our people feel they belong; where we can be our authentic selves, feel treated with respect and have the support of leadership to impact the business in a meaningful way.

Equal Opportunity Employer

Colgate is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, ethnicity, age, disability, marital status, veteran status (United States positions), or any other characteristic protected by law.

Reasonable accommodation during the application process is available for persons with disabilities. Please contact Application_Accommodation@colpal.com with the subject ""Accommodation Request"" should you require accommodation."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: IT Services and IT Consulting 11-50 employees 29 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
DBServices helps to design, develop and support digital platforms for large and mid-sized companies in ITC, Banking, Retail, Government, Health, and other industries in Europe and Americas.

Tasks

Integrate into our Data Team, working together with the NY Data Office, as well as team members in Paris and Porto, to elevate Porto's expertise in this practice.

Collaborate with business analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and developers to deliver comprehensive solutions.

Requirements

Over 5 years of experience in data management, analytics, and visualization tools. 
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Mathematics, or a related field.
Proficiency in creating data workflows, including data preparation and reconciliation, using Alteryx or comparable data analytics tools such as Dataiku or Knime.
Experience with Business Intelligence and data visualization tools, particularly Power BI.
Capability to develop and maintain solutions using Power Apps and Power Automate.

"About the job
Who are we?

At Stenon we are on a mission to democratize soil data. We have become the global market leader in real-time, digital soil data that is laboratory-independent. This provides farmers with essential data to make optimal and sustainable cultivation decisions, boosting yield, crop quality, and soil health while saving money on inputs. Stenon has closed a $20 million Series A funding round and is expanding internationally.

Position

We seek a skilled Business Intelligence / Data Analyst to empower our business and product with data-driven processes and decision-making. You will be working with a team to mine data, develop analytics tools, and share insights and findings with the rest of the organization. You will report directly to Stenon Management.

Tasks

Discuss, design, and develop metrics, reports, analyses, and dashboards to drive key business and product decisions
Conduct deep-dive data analysis for important business topics
Regularly collaborate with the Senior Leadership Team as a key component of the decision making process

Will support investor relations


Requirements

At least 3+ years of hands-on experience in BI and Data Analysis
Ability to run your own projects and work independently
Ability to write complex SQL, do cohort analysis, comparative analysis, etc.
Advanced data visualization skills using tools like Metabase, Tableau, and Looker
Cross-functional collaboration skills and experience working directly with internal stakeholders (Product, Finance, and Business Development) to build reports and dashboards
Understanding of Data Models and Data Warehouse structures
Very good English language skills

Benefits

A fully remote or hybrid work setup‚Äîwork anywhere in Germany
Permanent full-time position with flexible work hours 
A role within a highly productive and supportive team full of dedicated, hard-working professionals
An agile work environment with flat hierarchies and an international team
Company provided laptop
Home office allowance
Team building and company retreats: Last year we went to Mallorca for a 3-day company retreat.

Why us?

At Stenon, we empower farmers to make informed decisions for sustainable agriculture. Our team is passionate about innovation, collaboration, open communication, and excellence.

We are on a mission to make soil data accessible in real-time, thus changing how farmers can cultivate their land. To achieve this, we put our customers first and try to understand the challenges they face deeply. This will allow us to build the best possible products. We value transparency and honesty to become as performant as possible. With an open yet always constructive feedback culture, we learn from each other and improve continuously. We have high standards and reward performance, but at the same time, we want to work with positive people who treat their colleagues exceptionally well.

comparative analysis

cross-functional collaboration

english

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Join the movement at Klim, a Berlin-based clean-tech company on a mission to transform climate protection through the widespread adoption of regenerative agriculture across Germany and Europe. Our vision is a thriving earth with a fully regenerative system that protects the world‚Äôs most precious resource: Soil.

At Klim, we've pioneered the world‚Äôs first digital platform for regenerative agriculture, empowering thousands of farmers to champion sustainable practices. We provide financial compensation to farmers for their regenerative practices and offer high-quality advisory services. We connect the farmers with forward-thinking companies who want to invest in a greener future. By purchasing the carbon credits generated from these sustainable practices or implementing regenerative agriculture in their food supply chain, these companies not only fulfill their environmental responsibilities but also fuel a cycle of positive change.

Now, we're looking for a Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. In this role, you'll have the opportunity to be at the forefront of change, driving impactful insights and reporting to guide and shape our company as it grows.

Backed by visionary investors like Atlantic Food Labs, Ananda Impact Ventures, and AgFunder, we're on a trajectory of growth and innovation. If you're ready to make a difference and be part of something truly meaningful, join us at Klim, and together, let's cultivate a brighter tomorrow for all.

Tasks

Analyze sales, operational, and product datasets and extract relevant insights
Work with stakeholders to design effective reporting and dashboarding; and to define and refine meaningful KPIs
Understand business logic, build context, and deliver insights in the form of analyses, recommendations, visualizations, and presentations
Contribute to the development and maintenance of robust internal data models
Perform ad-hoc requests as necessary


Requirements

Minimum three years experience in an analytics or analytics-adjacent role; or educational equivalent
Strong statistical background with intermediate to advanced knowledge of SQL. Python knowledge is beneficial
Experience using Apache Superset or a similar BI tool for reporting and visualization
Experience using DBT
Excellent communication skills to relay complex findings to non-technical audiences
Comfortable working independently with loosely defined problems
Full working proficiency in English. German language skills are a plus


Benefits

Opportunity: Be part of our journey from the very beginning, working on an equal footing with the leadership team to build a new company

Impact: Make a daily and active contribution to combating climate change, promoting consumer education, and fostering fair conditions for our climate-conscious farmers

Autonomy: Take ownership of your projects and enjoy a high degree of creative freedom

Competitive package: Receive a competitive salary and have the opportunity to participate in our VSOP program

Flexible work model: At Klim, we foster a flexible, hybrid work approach and facilitate remote work (within the EU). For this role, it is important that you live in Berlin or can be present in our beautiful office on a regular basis.

Additional benefits: We offer membership in the Urban Sports Club, a company pension scheme, team lunches (if in Berlin) and regular team events

We are looking forward to meeting you! At Klim, we place great value on equal opportunities. We believe that an outstanding work environment should reflect diversity of backgrounds, talents and thoughts. Together, we grow as a team based on our individual strengths. Every personnel decision is made solely on the basis of qualifications, performance and the requirements of the company."

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description
Our Mission
As part of the ongoing development of Business Information Services, Coface is recruiting a Senior Marketing Data Analyst for Business Information. This key role will report directly to the Group Marketing Director: Business Information at Coface. In this role you will oversee various aspects of Marketing performance operations and reporting, including producing systematic reporting and actional analytics covering pricing, product performance and usage, inbound demand generation, outbound lead generation analysis, GTM and communication impact analysis and pricing projects.
High level remit:
Key member of the BI Marketing team, championing an insight led approach to inform marketing decisions and to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing activities across go-to-market, lead generation, product and pricing.
Collaborate with the Distribution Squad Leadership (Sales, Marketing and Customer Success) to formulate and execute on insight led approach to corridor planning, go-to-market and lead generation marketing activities.
Lead development of best practice in measurement and evaluation of marketing activities, working closely with group colleagues to facilitate demonstrating the contribution of BI marketing activities.
What you will be doing:
Goal Setting and Strategy: responsible for surfacing insights, building reports and supporting an insight led approach to decision making for planning and implementation of marketing strategies across GTM, lead generation, product and pricing.
Reporting and Process Analysis: responsible for defining and setting up best practice processes on all aspects of marketing reporting so that we can track the revenue impact of all marketing activities and identify areas for continuous improvement.
Delivering Actionable Insights: identify insights that can drive revenue growth and improvements.
Pricing Analysis: gather and collate competitive pricing insights from the regions, drive the development and implementation of advanced pricing analytics to inform strategic decisions, assess the impact of annual price changes on market performance and revenue growth by creating reports and dashboards to track the effectiveness of pricing initiatives,
Pricing projects: work with the BI Pricing Director to streamline the quote-to-cash sales process by implementing a CPQ and CLM proof of concept and subsequent roll out, to enhance sales efficiency and customer satisfaction.
Regularly update: Senior Marketing and Commercial Leadership, as well as other key stakeholders on progress, challenges, and results.
Conduct sophisticated, detailed analysis and clearly communicate results so that decisions can be made with confidence.
Qualifications
Experience & Skills:
Minimum five years of experience in the areas of data modelling and visualization, preferably in a B2B or SaaS company.
Proven ability in using statistical analysis, predictive modeling and explanatory modeling to identify trends.
Experience designing and delivering Revenue Performance Insights, Sales coverage modeling, Sales productivity, revenue reporting, forecasting and pipeline reporting.
Experience working within a high-growth technology company would be beneficial
Self-motivated, action-oriented, multi-tasking individual with a great sense of urgency and follow-through
You must be a meticulous observer and be able to work under pressure since the job requires you to manage the entire revenue cycle from start to finish.
End to end project management and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
Ability to think strategically, but also have great attention to detail to facilitate program management execution.
Proficiency in BI tools such Power BI for data visualization and insights, along with programming languages capabilities in Python, R, SQL for data analysis and automation."

Title:

Risk & Compliance Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Financial Services 10,001+ employees 53,812 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
The Data Analyst role forms part of the UK Risk and Compliance (‚ÄúUKR&C‚Äù) function. UKR&C reports through to the Global Law and Compliance function. The primary responsibility for this role will be to turn data in to information, turn information into insights which can then support the R&C team to make better business decisions.

If you are excited to work with data, keep on reading!

Aon is in the business of better decisions 

At Aon, we shape decisions for the better to protect and enrich the lives of people around the world.

As an organization, we are united through trust as one inclusive, diverse team that is passionate about helping our colleagues and clients succeed.

What Makes This Position Different

This position is critical to the overall success of the Compliance Assurance (CA) team and the development of a Data Analytics capability UK R&C to support ongoing 2nd line assurance activity and improve the insights that can be delivered through MI and reporting.

What The Day Will Look Like

Gather data from primary and secondary sources, ensuring the upkeep of databases and data systems. This also includes filtering the data, investigating missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance.
Transformation of data gathered from various sources across the firm into structured information to provide insights that shape the direction of assurance reviews as well as driving longer term decisions on the ongoing Compliance Assurance plans.
Work with the CA & Analytics Lead and other members of the R&C SLT to determine and prioritise the needs of different teams and enhance the analytical and reporting capability across the function.
Undertake data analysis lifecycle activities on assurance reviews and other data related projects - this covers requirement gathering, activity execution and design planning.
Detect, examine, and decode trends or patterns within intricate datasets. Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyse data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends and produce actionable business insights.
Develop data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision-making across the department.
Convey insights through reports and creation of visual representations of data findings to make the data understandable at a glance.

Skills And Experience That Will Lead To Success

English level - B2+/C1 minimum (written and spoken).
Possess a solid foundation in statistics and practical experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS) and mastery in data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R.
Exhibit exceptional analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, and present substantial data sets with precision and thoroughness.
Sound knowledge of data management and data privacy concepts
Capable of critically evaluating data to derive meaningful, actionable insights.
Ability to communicate effectively on all levels. Strong communication and presentation capabilities, adept at simplifying complex data insights for audiences without a technical background.
Experience with Tableau, Power BI or alternative data visualization packages
Solid attention to detail.
Excellent organisational and time management skills, able to cope during times of high workloads. Proactive and able to identify priorities effectively.
Experience of working in an international environment would be an asset.

How We Support Our Colleagues

In addition to our comprehensive benefits package, we encourage a diverse workforce. Plus, our agile, inclusive environment allows you to manage your wellbeing and work/life balance, ensuring you can be your best self at Aon. Furthermore, all colleagues enjoy two ‚ÄúGlobal Wellbeing Days‚Äù each year, encouraging you to take time to focus on yourself. We offer a variety of working style solutions, but we also recognise that flexibility goes beyond just the place of work... and we are all for it. We call this Smart Working!

Our continuous learning culture inspires and equips you to learn, share and grow, helping you achieve your fullest potential. As a result, at Aon, you are more connected, more relevant, and more valued.

We provide individuals with disabilities reasonable accommodations to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment in accordance with applicable law. Please contact us to request an accommodation on ReasonableAdjustments@Aon.com

Aon values an innovative, diverse workplace where all colleagues feel empowered to be their authentic selves. Aon is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.

The ideal candidate will be adept at manipulating data from diverse sources, including SQL databases and Excel, and proficient in visualizing data insights using Power BI or similar dashboard tools. A minimum of 5 years of experience and a B2 English level is required.


Responsibilities:
Data Management: Efficiently collect, clean, and manage data from various sources (SQL databases, Excel spreadsheets, etc.) to ensure accuracy and reliability.
Data Analysis: Conduct thorough analyses using statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in complex data sets.
Dashboard Development: Design and develop intuitive and interactive dashboards using Power BI (or equivalent tools) to visualize data insights and support business decision-making processes.
Reporting: Generate and present regular reports that clearly articulate findings, insights, and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work closely with different departments, including marketing, finance, and operations, to understand their data analysis needs and provide strategic support.
Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of the latest industry trends and advancements in data analysis tools and methodologies to continuously improve data analytical processes.

Skills:
Power BI Proficiency: Demonstrated expertise in developing interactive dashboards and reports with Power BI. Must be able to integrate data from various sources and create visualizations that effectively communicate data insights.
Excel Mastery: Advanced proficiency in Excel, including the use of formulas, functions (e.g., VLOOKUP, INDEX/MATCH, and pivot tables), and data analysis tools within Excel.
Advanced SQL Skills
Analytical Thinking
Problem-Solving

Requirements:
5+ years experience in the Data Field (Analytics, Data Engineering, Data platforms)
Hands-on experience in manipulating big amounts of data
Documentation and white-boarding skills.
Be a proactive person meaning a natural storyteller capable of translating the data into business insights
Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or relevant experience

Nice to Have:
Familiarity with programming languages (Python)
BigData experience is a big PLUS (Spark, Dataproc, etc.)
Familiarity managing Data directly in any Cloud Provider (AWS, GCP or Azure)

How to apply:

Job Description:
"About the job
About the Role
VBET is a B2C international gaming operator with 20 years of experience in the industry. It is powered in-house by BetConstruct, which holds over ten licenses and operates in 12 European countries. VBet is headquartered in Yerevan, Armenia, operates both B2B and B2C, employs around 8,000 people and has several business lines, such as sports betting, gambling and crypto.
We are looking for a skilled BI/Data Analyst who is in strong collaboration with global VBet analytical teams to help the Romanian branch with data discovery, finding insights, defining user behavior patterns and tracking business into numbers (through metrics and KPIs). As a BI/Data Analyst, you will collaborate with all other departments (Business Development, Marketing, Operations and Finance) of our company and be a part of developing VBET Analytical platforms. 
With the experience gained through this job, you will be able to develop an internal career path and grow within the company.

Responsibilities
Participated in developing and managing the BI platform with global VBet analytical teams
Deep data analysis on information from different departments
Provide analytical support to key decision-makers, enhance reporting capabilities
Participated in developing and tracking product and business metrics and KPI
Support regional, marketing, operations and finance initiatives with data-discovering
Continuously data-discovering, finding insights, identifying trends and patterns in numbers
Present insights, findings and recommendations to key stakeholders at all levels

Our expectations
 University degree in Maths, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or a related fields
 At least two years of experience in a relevant position (iGaming, online products, e-commerce) is mandatory.
 Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze large datasets, knowledge in data discovering methodology
 Understanding of metrics related to online business (web, product, CRM, general financial)
 SQL skills are mandatory and knowledge of Python will be an advantage
 Experience in web analytics will be an advantage
 Advanced English is required and other languages will be an advantage.
 Proactive communication and presentation skills to communicate with team members, external data providers, C level
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team"

Title:
Product Data Analyst, Ring AI Data Engineering & Analytics
Product Data Analyst, Ring AI Data Engineering & Analytics with verification
Industry: Software Development 10,001+ employees 752,061 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Description

As a Product Data Analyst you will drive actionable insights for AI Services Product Management team, and influence decision-making across the org. This is a highly visible role in which you will communicate actionable insights to decision-makers. You will ‚Äòtell the story‚Äô around data about features usage insights, user journey analysis, support hypothesis testing from methodology to results evaluation. You will utilise advanced analytics techniques to derive insights about product usage patterns. You will also create self-service dashboards, and work closely with data engineers on data pipelines automation.

Key job responsibilities

 Use data to create insights which include detailed product users behaviour analysis, outlining segments and different patterns, which may lead to business opportunities. You are passionate about turning data into actionable insights that will inform product development and strategy.
 Write compelling narratives to share data stories to stakeholders and equip them to make informed decisions and future plans.
 Take a proactive approach to defining new metrics, reports, and dashboards. You seek to develop a deep understanding of our metrics, reporting tools, and data structures in order to provide actionable intelligence with existing metrics.
 Utilise advanced analytics techniques for conducting deep dive studies around certain device use cases.
 Provide data for monthly business reviews, which includes results of experiments and A/B tests, features health indicators, activation and engagement metrics.
 Develop self-service dashboards using Tableau.
 Browse available data sources in order to understand and enhance analytics signals logging.
 Work closely with the data engineering team to design, execute and maintain reporting modules, define requirements for automation of recurring reports.

A day in the life

The successful candidate will be on the lookout for ways to learn more about Ring devices usage behavioural patterns, optimise the ways how metrics used for decision making, superior communications skills and the ability to deliver analysis in a clear and actionable format for Product Managers, have technical skills to come up with insights.

About The Team

Our Product Data Analytics team mission is to equip AI Services Product Management team to make data-driven decisions around features with AI component development (e.g. Package detection), starting with insights for feature proposal and to feature post-launch evaluation. We do this by quantifying user experience on each feature usage stage (activation, engagement, retention, reactivation), identifying usage patterns and new opportunities to improve customer experience with Ring devices.

Basic Qualifications

 3+ years of experience in analyzing and interpreting data, performing statistical analysis
 Experience with data visualization using Tableau, Quicksight, or similar tools
 Experience with writing advanced SQL queries
 Experience in statistical and root cause analysis techniques
 Experience in product data analytics or user experience analytics

Preferred Qualifications

 Experience with advanced analytics techniques.
 Experience with data modelling, warehousing and designing ETL pipelines.
 Experience in data mining in a business environment with large-scale, complex datasets.
 Experience with AWS, including Redshift, S3, RDS, Athena.
 Proficient in handling big data volumes, composition of advanced SQL and query performance tuning skills.
 Experience in collaborative workflow using version control systems.

Amazon is an equal opportunities employer. We believe passionately that employing a diverse workforce is central to our success. We make recruiting decisions based on your experience and skills. We value your passion to discover, invent, simplify and build. Protecting your privacy and the security of your data is a longstanding top priority for Amazon. Please consult our Privacy Notice (https://www.amazon.jobs/en/privacy_page) to know more about how we collect, use and transfer the personal data of our candidates.


Company - Ring of Security B.V. - H42

Job ID: A2718593"

"About the job

Zo help je jouw opdrachtgever met het maken van datagedreven beslissingen voor de onderneming. Jouw inbreng is dus van onschatbare waarde!

Hier gaan we vanuit

Een afgeronde HBO- of Academische opleiding.
Uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse & Engelse taal in woord en geschrift.
3 jaar aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met het maken van dashboards met data visualisatie tools, bij voorkeur MS Power BI.

Je bent bereid om te reizen (indien nodig) voor je werk. Uiteraard houden we rekening met jouw woonplaats.
Je herkent je collega‚Äôs bij &More aan hun betrokkenheid en open houding. Dit zijn essenti√´le eigenschappen voor onze potenti√´le nieuwe collega‚Äôs. Je vindt het leuk om jouw kennis te delen, mee te denken in de groei van onze organisatie en betrokken te zijn bij onze in- en externe events.


Arbeidsvoorwaarden

Als medewerker krijg je een salaris van 3000 tot 5500 euro bruto per maand
Als je op vakantie wilt kan dit! Je hebt 25 vakantiedagen
Je werktijden worden flexibel

lease-auto van het bedrijf
tankkaart van de zaak

Een bonusregeling is mogelijk


Over &More Professionals:

&More Group bestaat uit ondernemende Consultants die uw organisatie, afdeling of projectgroep adviseert en ondersteunt om grip op uw data te krijgen √©n te behouden. &More kan de gehele dataketen afdekken door zowel eigen Datamanagement Specialisten als Interim Professionals. In het specifiek ondersteunen wij uw organisatie door middel van de 3 focusgebieden: Data Governance, Business Intelligence en Data Integratie. ROI; Return on Involvement Return on involvement (ROI) staat centraal binnen de &More cultuur. Title:
Internship: Data Scientist - Quantitative Investment Research (m/f/d)
Internship: Data Scientist - Quantitative Investment Research (m/f/d)
Industry: Financial Services 11-50 employees 35 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Your Mission

This internship provides you with the opportunity to become part of our Asset Allocation Team with a focus on data science for quantitative investment strategies.

The Asset Allocation Team identifies relative performance opportunities in international multi-asset markets for tactical portfolio decisions. Applying Machine Learning to Asset Pricing problems helps us to discover non-linear relationships between the macroeconomic environment, market sentiment, and systemic risk.

During your internship, you will work closely with our specialists in quant finance and machine learning engineering. Within our supportive team environment you will have the opportunity to take ownership and full end-to-end responsibility.

Your tasks

Work intensively on the development and continuous enhancement of our cutting-edge, ML-based, systematic investment strategies as part of our Asset Allocation Team
Be involved in the further development and implementation (e.g., conducting experiments as well as evaluations) of our hypothesis-driven research agenda along key building blocks (e.g., data, transformations, model(s), targets) relevant for product performance
Work closely with our senior quant finance and machine learning experts
Write clean, efficient, and well-documented code in Python

Your Skillset

Currently pursuing a degree in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, or Economics/Finance with quantitative focus
Solid knowledge of data analytics in Python as well as corresponding state-of-the-art tools and frameworks
Experience in working with data, building quantitative models, data-driven decision-making
Strong foundation in or willingness to learn software engineering principles, and a commitment to developing high-quality code that aligns with industry best practices
Proactive and independent workstyle
Strong interpersonal skills and a real passion for working in a team environment
Passion for quantitative investing
Fluent in spoken and written English, good communication skills
Bonus: Proficiency with Git, the distributed version control system that‚Äôs integral to collaborative coding endeavors

Why us?

An exciting and involving role with significant impact on shaping the future of AI-based sustainable investing
A company culture that is based on a spirit of cooperation and is characterized by a high level of quality awareness, openness and attention to detail in all areas of our work
The opportunity to work in an interdisciplinary team with our experienced quant finance, software engineering and machine learning experts
A modern loft office in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg, healthy food (including coffee, juices, fruit, vegetables, sandwiches) and high-end hardware from Apple 
Internal workshops, unique learning possibilities across a wide range of domains as well as amazing team events
Benefits such as Urban Sports Club or Fitness First as well as corporate benefits

About Us

We are a deep tech pioneer, providing AI-based investment solutions to our clients. Building on the best practices of quantitative asset management we tap the potential of machine learning for sustainable investments on capital market.

Our interdisciplinary team consists of experts in the fields of finance, computer science, software engineering, machine learning as well as mathematics, physics, and neuroscience. Ultramarin is embedded in the global AI community, through a close exchange with leading universities and as a member of Inquire Europe.

To date Ultramarin is one of the leading drivers for AI-based analyses and decision-making processes in asset management. Ultramarin has been founded in 2017, is headquartered in Berlin, with additional locations in Frankfurt and Munich, and is backed by leading international business angels and VCs."

"About the job
At Siemens Global Business Services (GBS), we shape the future. We support Siemens customers from every industry and around the globe.

On our reporting platform, Pulse (www.pulse.cloud), our international team tackles the most exciting challenges of our customers. Seize your chance to contribute your own ideas and elevate yourself, our platform, and our customers to the next level.

You will be responsible for the technical implementation of challenging international projects in the field of our cloud-based analytics and survey platform.

Your profile - solid and ready for the future

The opportunity to become a Siemens shareholder and receive free shares.

Siemens is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, colour, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

We are committed to forming a team that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. This is how we work best. Problem solvers and entrepreneurs are highly welcome.

Make your mark in our exciting world at Siemens and learn more: www.siemens.com"

Title:
Data Analist
Data Analist
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 11-50 employees 40 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Leasen: het is meer dan een auto afhalen. Het is een samenwerking die allerlei vormen en maten aan kan nemen, met verschillende wensen bij elke afspraak. Je kunt hierin heel veel aanbieden, en dat is wat ze hier doen. Maar klantvriendelijk zijn vraagt om goede collega‚Äôs.

Wat doen ze hier?

Leasen is lang niet voor iedereen hetzelfde. De ene organisatie wil een volledig wagenpark, de ander wil een enkele heftruck. Ieders eisen, wensen en budget zijn anders en daar is service voor nodig. Flexibiliteit is iets waar het bij veel leasepartijen nog aan ontbreekt, maar dat is niet overal het geval.

Hier hebben ze meer dan je gebruikelijke auto van de zaak. Deze organisatie is echt een partner voor operationele, financi√´le √©n equipment lease. Je kunt hier inderdaad ‚Äògewoon‚Äô een wagenpark opzetten, maar ook een heftruck leasen. Afhankelijk van de precieze wensen van de aanvraag kunnen ze van product tot service en oplevering helemaal met je meedenken. Daardoor hebben ze al jaren stevige groeicijfers.

Mooi! En wat kan mijn rol hier worden?

Als Data Analist haal jij de beste customer insights naar boven. Je focus ligt echt op de klantdata, en je analyseert welke ontwikkelingen nodig zijn om de klanttevredenheid effectiever en effici√´nter te verhogen. Hiervoor gebruik je de vrijheid om je kennis en ervaring te gebruiken binnen het CX team. Binnen dat team is het doel om dagelijks impact de maken op de klantervaring, en dat kan niet zonder jou.

Kennis en ervaring gebruiken, zei je?

Hiermee bedoelen we in ieder geval twee jaar werkervaring in data. Als je ervaring hebt met Customer Experience heb je extra voordeel maar dat is niet verplicht. Met een sterk analytisch vermogen en oog voor detail glippen er geen kansen tussen jouw vingers door. Werken in een team versterkt jouw productiviteit en inspelen op de wensen van een klant is voor jou de norm. Bovendien spreek en schrijf je vloeiend Nederlands.

Check, check en check. En wat krijg ik ervoor terug?

Het maandsalaris start op ‚Ç¨3.900,- maar kan zo oplopen als je wat ervaring hebt. Vakantiegeld en pensioenregeling komen hier nog bij en de collectieve zorgverzekering staat voor je klaar. De kilometervergoeding is 21 cent en thuiswerkvergoeding is aanwezig voor als je liever weinig reist. Klaar om aan de bak te gaan? We gaan graag met je in gesprek!"

Title:
