Title:
Risk Data Analyst
Risk Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Financial Services 1,001-5,000 employees 2,286 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
The world of payment processing is rapidly evolving, and businesses are looking for loyal and strategic partners, to help them grow.

Nuvei (Nasdaq{{:}} NVEI) (TSX{{:}} NVEI) is bringing payments up to speed. Our future-proof technology allows businesses to accept cutting-edge payment options, optimize new revenue streams, and get the most out of their stack. We believe in turning payment barriers into accelerants, propelling businesses forward with tailored solutions. With a single integration and advanced customization tools, Nuvei delivers unsurpassed flexibility that enables businesses to adapt quickly and enter new markets seamlessly.

At Nuvei, we live our core values, and we thrive on solving complex problems. We're dedicated to continually improving our product and providing relentless customer service. We are always looking for exceptional talent to join us on the journey!

Your mission

We are looking for a Risk Analyst to join our international team. The person on this position will participate in the process of monitoring of portfolio of clients from different industries. Strong analysis skills with the ability to apply logic, creativity, and problem-solving techniques are required for this role.

Responsibilities

Assist in preventing, identifying, analyzing and handling fraud patterns and trends and preparing descriptive analyses of fraud data;
Monitoring of fraud and chargeback rates for our merchants;
Monitor and analyze traffic for Money Laundering or Terrorist financing patterns/ activities;
Assist in developing and improving our risk monitoring system;
Maintain and implement the risk management plan;
Manages communication with customers in risk related issues. 

Requirements

University degree (preferably in Finance or Economics). 
A minimum of 2 years of professional experience in a fraud-related field. 
Knowledge of risk assessment models. 
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize and analyze significant amounts of information via multiple systems. 
SQL knowledge is a plus. 
Strong collaboration and communication skills as well as a strong focus on meeting deadlines. 
Attention to detail and accuracy. 
Fluency in English. 

Benefits

2.5 additional days of annual leave a quarter, if company hit quarterly targets 
Private Medical Insurance 
Competitive remuneration package and flexible benefits. 
Free tea & coffee 
Access to the relaxation area where we have PlayStation 5, Ping-pong, team games and other facilities."

Title:
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Industry: Advertising Services 1,001-5,000 employees 727 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)"

Description

 Strong SQL knowledge, and experience in using data visualization tools (Tableau, PowerBI, or other) to produce insightful reports & insights

üïπÔ∏è What your Hack The Box adventure will have in store:  

üéØYou'll have the exhilarating opportunity to contribute to a product that is highly appreciated by users and the cybersecurity community at large
üéØ You'll experience a highly supportive and caring environment, fostering growth, flexibility, and autonomy
üéØ You'll embark on an exciting journey of continuous learning and problem-solving, leveling up as our organization grows
üéØ Most importantly, you'll have a blast at HTB ü•≥ because fun is an essential ingredient in our recipe for success! Just wait until you see our global meet-ups! 

üí∞ The gems you'll be enjoying as a Data Analyst:

Private insurance
25 annual leave days
Dedicated budget for training and professional development, participation in conferences
State-of-the-art equipment (Macbook, iPhone, and mobile plan)
Free lunch & snacks at the office
Full access to the Hack The Box lab offerings; so you can learn how to hack
Flexible/Hybrid working

üó∫Ô∏è The Quest of Becoming Hack The Box's Data Analyst

Level 1: Like in any game, you start as a Noob. Level one's objective: submit your application
Level 2: After applying, you unlock the Script Kiddie rank! This level's objective: pass the screening process. 
Level 3: Now you're officially ranked as Hacker and you're ready to meet the Talent Acquisition team. Level's objective: complete two online assessments, highlight your past achievements, ambitions, and values during a virtual interview. 
Level 4: As a Pro-Hacker at level 4, you'll unlock the ""boss level"", which involves meeting the hiring manager. Level's objective: connect with the hiring manager and share with them your achievements. 
Level 5: Now you're an Elite Hacker! Level's objective: complete an assignment that aligns with day-to-day job-related tasks and responsibilities
Level 6: Congratulations, you're now a Guru! Not many reach this level üí™. Level's objective: have a constructive, final conversation with senior leadership to explore the role and your future at HTB. 
Level 7: You've achieved the Omniscient rank and officially received an offer from HTB! To complete the last level and the Quest, all you need to do is accept the offer. 
Quest complete. Congratulations, you're officially one of us ü•≥üéâüéáYour next quest: complete the onboarding. 


About Hack The Box

Hack The Box is the Cyber Performance Center with the mission to provide a human-first platform to create and maintain high-performing cybersecurity individuals and organizations. Hack The Box is the only platform that unites upskilling, workforce development, and the human focus in the cybersecurity industry, and it's trusted by organizations worldwide for driving their teams to peak performance. Offering an all-in-one environment for continuous growth, assessment, and recruitment, Hack The Box provides solutions for all cybersecurity domains.

Launched in 2017, Hack The Box brings together the largest global cybersecurity community of more than 2.6 million platform members. Rapidly growing its international footprint and reach, Hack The Box is headquartered in the UK, with additional offices in the US, Australia, and Greece.

üö® News & Resources: 

Get the most important updates on HTB's latest year!
We are super proud to share that HTB's all three entities across the UK, US, and Greece have been Certified as a Great Place to Work (Oct 2023-Oct 2024). 
Furthermore, the HTB's Greek entity has been listed by the Great Place to Work Insitute as the #4 Best Workplace in Greece and #7 in Europe for 2023, among more than 3,300 companiesüí™ 

Take a sneak peek at how it is to be part of HTB and our 2023 Global Retreat. Get more insights about our HTB culture and employee experience by visiting the ""about us"" section of our site, our career site, and Glassdoor.

At Hack The Box, we are committed to fostering a diverse, inclusive, and equitable workplace. We believe that diversity enriches our performance, services, and the communities we serve. As such, we ensure that all job applications are considered solely based on merit, skills, and qualifications. We do not discriminate on grounds of race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. We are dedicated to providing a fair and respectful work environment that reflects our values."

Title:
Data Analyst Stage
Data Analyst Stage with verification
Industry: Truck Transportation 1,001-5,000 employees 936 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
sennder is Europe‚Äôs leading digital freight forwarder. In a traditional industry, we are moving fast to digitize and automate all road logistics processes. We move trucks with courage and the power of data to unlock endless and sustainable capacity at exceptional quality. Get to know us better by reviewing our ""About Us"" presentation. 

We are a growing team looking for a Data Analyst Intern in the Operations Program & Innovation department to help us on our journey to revolutionize road freight logistics. The role is located in our Milan office.

What You Will Do ‚Ä¶

As a Data Analyst Intern, you will play a crucial role in enhancing real-time visibility and driving advancements in tracking technologies. You will support the management of the ""Service Quality and Visibility Program,"" collaborating with various stakeholders to develop processes aimed at delivering high-quality services to our carriers and shippers. Additionally, you will assist in leading projects focused on visibility and service quality improvements to meet company objectives.

In this role, you will ‚Ä¶

Assist in managing the ""Service Quality and Visibility Program,"" working closely with internal and external stakeholders.
Support the execution of projects aimed at improving our services, contributing to the achievement of company goals.
Assist in the preparation of ad hoc analyses, forecasts, reports, and presentations for senior leadership, providing insights into the effectiveness of outputs.
Aid in building, managing, and maintaining performance reports and dashboards related to key metrics such as GPS coverage, Perfect Service Shipment, and On-Time Performances.
Collaborate with the Product Team to contribute ideas for new solutions, enhancements to existing ones, and draft business requirement documents.
Assist in monitoring and enhancing GPS integration processes of carriers regularly.
Support daily interactions with third-party service providers to enhance real-time visibility.
Serve as a primary point of contact for Operations Teams regarding visibility and service quality matters.

What We Are Looking For ‚Ä¶

Bachelor's degree in engineering, business, statistics, or a related field.
At least 1 year of experience in operations management, quality management, performance management, consulting, or similar roles.
Preferred experience in the transportation/logistics industry or familiarity with supply chain visibility concepts.
Proficiency in G-suite and MS Office; SQL skills are a plus.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in both Italian and English.
Demonstrated ability to work independently and proactively.
Strong analytical skills and a data-driven mindset.
Fast learner with a collaborative approach to teamwork.

ABOUT Sennder Italia

sennder Italia, based in the heart of Milan, is a joint venture company between sennder and Poste Italiane. Our company matches the digital and innovative focus on technologies and digitalization of sennder with the expertise and know-how of the largest distribution network in Italy, Poste Italiane.

We not only connect shippers to our fleet of thousands of trucks, but also improve how they move products in sustainable, cost-efficient, and transparent ways - making the logistics industry fit for the future. In a traditional industry, we‚Äôre growing and moving fast to digitally automate all road logistics processes.

We are building a curious team that is driven by an ambitious desire to solve the toughest logistics puzzles. What others may consider uncertainty, we see as an opportunity to learn and be proactive. We invite you to go on this journey with us and be part of one of Europe‚Äôs inspiring growth stories as we fast-forward road logistics into digitalization. Read more about the sennder Italia joint venture here.

What You Can Expect‚Ä¶

At sennder, we want to maximize the individual potential of all employees and reinforce an inclusive culture and environment of continuous learning that empowers people to succeed as a team. In addition to humility, we value commitment, team spirit and respect to build fruitful collaboration across teams. Learn more about who we are on our career site.

Fast growth scale-up with an international team of 1000+ people, 74+ nationalities spread across 11 European offices. With English as our common language, we are able to work together.
Learning and development on the job and with the support of a bi-annual review process, learning allowance, high potential programs, sennder onboarding academy, and internal trainings. 
Various opportunities to connect with colleagues through regular team events and company get-togethers such as our highly anticipated sennder Summer Camp.
Prioritize employee engagement and mental well-being by fostering a supportive environment through the Likeminded platform and conducting regular employee satisfaction surveys. 
Hybrid work model where you seamlessly merge virtual productivity and in-office collaboration with your colleagues. 
Commuter allowance to assist employees with their daily travel expenses and a one-time home office benefit to ensure that you're properly equipped wherever you work.
Competitive compensation package including objective-based bonus, referral reward, and in some cases virtual option plan.
For the Milan office we offer: free on-site gym!
Vibrant offices complete with healthy snacks, focus zones, and social areas to connect with your colleagues. Click here for a virtual tour and better yet, hope to see you soon!

We value humility and we're as interested in your character as we are in your talent. Please apply, even if you feel you only meet part of our listed criteria. Diversity drives our innovation and we offer a collaborative, dynamic, and international work environment. Just be yourself. We are excited to meet you and for you to join us in shaping the future of the logistics industry in Europe.

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Online Media 1,001-5,000 employees 6,170 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description

About Our Organization:

Dow Jones is a global provider of news and business information, delivering content to consumers and organizations around the world across multiple formats, including print, digital, mobile and live events. Dow Jones has produced unrivaled quality content for more than 130 years and today has one of the world‚Äôs largest news-gathering operations globally. It is home to leading publications and products including the flagship Wall Street Journal, America‚Äôs largest newspaper by paid circulation; Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch, Mansion Global, Financial News, Investor‚Äôs Business Daily, Factiva, Dow Jones Risk & Compliance, Dow Jones Newswires, OPIS and Chemical Market Analytics. Dow Jones is a division of News Corp (Nasdaq: NWS, NWSA; ASX: NWS, NWSLV).

About the Team: Our Technology team drives the evolution of our Technology, Engineering, Data, Product and User Experience functions. With a keen focus on delivering cutting-edge solutions, we shape the digital landscape for our customers, readers, and users. From revolutionizing visuals to optimizing tools and harnessing the power of data, mobile, video, and social platforms, our team is committed to providing a seamless and immersive experience across all touchpoints. Collaborating closely with our newsrooms and strategic partners, we spearhead the development of groundbreaking products and technologies.

Position Overview

Dow Jones is seeking a talented Data Analyst with expertise in Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to join our B2C data team. The ideal candidate will possess a strong analytical mindset, a passion for data-driven decision-making, and a deep understanding of digital analytics. This role will be instrumental in leveraging GA4 & other sources of marketing, web, & app data to create a cohesive set of reports and dashboards usable by a variety of stakeholders. This position will report to the Senior Manager, B2C Analytics.

Key Responsibilities

Utilize Google Analytics 4 (GA4) to track, measure, and analyze key performance metrics across various digital marketing channels, including but not limited to website traffic, user behavior, campaign performance, and conversion rates.
Ensure data quality. Prioritize and execute best practices to ensure data validation, integrity, and accuracy across various analytical tools and processes, including GA4, Adobe Analytics, and other data solutions.
Combine multiple data sources such as Google Campaign Manager, GA4 and others to provide holistic reporting and deeper insights into marketing programs.
Develop and maintain daily, weekly, monthly and quarterly dashboards and build new dashboards or custom reports using GA4, or other approved data visualization tool leveraging BigQuery and our Data Lakes.
Conduct in-depth analysis of web & app data and marketing initiatives to identify trends, opportunities, and areas for optimization.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, across Marketing, Technology, and Product to support marketing and product initiatives with available data.
Work with technical teams to implement and manage data layer and data tags to meet marketing and analytics needs, ensuring they provide consistent and reliable data sources.
Assist our data engineering team in conjunction with our data teams to help classify our data architecture for use with various reporting and database tools.
Be a steward of our data governance and data privacy requirements; erring on validation with key stakeholders first to ensure accuracy of data is provided, reduce misinterpretation of data, and prevent misuse or dissemination of sensitive data.
Document and make transparent to stakeholders the data quality, sources, and methodology and requirements of projects delivered.
Provide training and support to internal stakeholders on how to effectively utilize GA4 and interpret marketing analytics data to drive business results.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in digital analytics and GA4, and proactively recommend innovative approaches to improve data collection, analysis, and reporting capabilities.

Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, Economics, or a related field.
Previous Experience in web/app analytics, with a focus on Google Analytics (GA4 experience preferred).
Proficient in SQL for data analysis, with a strong understanding of fundamentals, proficient in writing optimized queries, managing datasets, and leveraging advanced features for efficient data solutions.
Experience with statistical software (such as Excel, SPSS, SAS), data analysis languages including SQL, Python, and R, and data visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau.
Knowledge of Google Campaign Manager and Display & Video 360 (DV360) preferred
Experience with audience segmentation/management platforms (CDP, CRM, etc) preferred
Strong understanding of digital marketing principles, including SEO, SEM, social media, email marketing, and content marketing.
Knowledge of tag management tools, such as Tealium, Google Tag Manager preferred.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders.
Detail-oriented with strong problem-solving skills and a demonstrated ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.

Reasonable accommodation: Dow Jones, Making Careers Newsworthy - We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.EEO/AA/M/F/Disabled/Vets. Dow Jones is committed to providing reasonable accommodation for qualified individuals with disabilities, in our job application and/or interview process. If you need assistance or accommodation in completing your application, due to a disability, email us at talentresourceteam@dowjones.com. Please put ""Reasonable Accommodation"" in the subject line and provide a brief description of the type of assistance you need. This inbox will not be monitored for application status updates.

Business Area: Dow Jones - Experience - Data & AI

Job Category: Data Analytics/Warehousing & Business Intelligence

Union Status

Non-Union role

Since 1882, Dow Jones has been finding new ways to bring information to the world‚Äôs top business entities. Beginning as a niche news agency in an obscure Wall Street basement, Dow Jones has grown to be a worldwide news and information powerhouse, with prestigious brands including The Wall Street Journal, Dow Jones Newswires, Factiva, Barron‚Äôs, MarketWatch and Financial News.

This longevity and success is due to a relentless pursuit of accuracy, depth and innovation, enhanced by the wisdom of past experience and a solid grasp on the future ahead. More than its individual brands, Dow Jones is a modern gateway to intelligence, with innovative technology, advanced data feeds, integrated solutions, expert research, award-winning journalism and customizable apps and delivery systems to bring the information that matters most to customers, when and where they need it, every day.

If you are a current employee at Dow Jones, do not apply here. Please go to the Career section on your Workday homepage and view ""Find Jobs - Dow Jones."" Thank you.

Req ID: 42409"

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.

Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you‚Äôre in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.

Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!

We are seeking a talented and driven Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategies and driving growth.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of decision-making, unlocking valuable insights from data and transforming them into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, problem-solving, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

What you might be doing:


Identify Business Opportunities: Take the lead in exploring new business opportunities for our products and services. Utilise your analytical skills to generate hypotheses and assess the potential benefits of each opportunity, providing valuable insights and driving strategic decisions
App User Activity Analysis: Dive deep into user activity within our app to uncover meaningful patterns, correlations, or bottlenecks. Your keen eye for detail will be essential in identifying areas for improvement and optimising user experiences
Data-Driven Insights: Leverage various data analysis techniques to transform raw data into actionable insights. Your ability to draw meaningful conclusions will be instrumental in guiding the company towards growth and success
Collaboration and Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and measure the impact of the most promising opportunities. Your role as a liaison between the data team and business squads will be essential in ensuring seamless communication and execution
Data Ambassador: Be the primary point of contact and ambassador for the data team within specific business squads. Your expertise will play a crucial role in aligning data-related objectives with overall business goals
Continuous Learning: Exhibit a hunger for knowledge and continuously strive to ask relevant and insightful questions. Embrace new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis processes




What you might bring:


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven insights to influence business decisions
Excellent communication and presentation abilities to convey data insights in a clear and understandable manner
Proficiency in SQL 
Experience with data analysis in Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib) 
Experience with statistics (A/B testing, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing) is a plus
Ability to collect, organise, and analyse large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail. 
Independent and proactive, have the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment




Why you should apply: 


 Freedom to build the company of your dreams
 Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business
 BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system
 Flexible working hours
 25 working days of vacation + local holidays
 We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work
 Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one!
 Continuous learning and development opportunities




If our job description speaks to you, but you don‚Äôt feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!

Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Insurance 201-500 employees 586 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
DKV maakt deel uit van de internationale Munich Re Group, een van de werelds grootste herverzekeraars. Werken bij DKV betekent werken voor de Belgische marktleider in particuliere ziektekostenverzekeringen.

Het betekent eveneens het nastreven van waarden zoals klant- en resultaatgerichtheid, integriteit en betrokkenheid (organisational commitment). Wij bouwen aan een open en inclusieve bedrijfscultuur gebaseerd op vertrouwen, teamwerk, transformationeel leiderschap en zin voor initiatief.

Samen zetten wij deze waarden elke dag om in de praktijk om zo het vertrouwen van onze twee miljoen verzekerden verder te versterken.

Functie:

Als Data Analyst ben je verantwoordelijk voor het accuraat rapporteren, analyseren en opvolgen van de commerci√´le data van DKV Belgi√´. Je maakt deel uit van het Sales Data|Study team en je hebt een sleutelrol in de ondersteuning van de Sales afdeling.

Data

Je bent verantwoordelijk voor de rapportering en analyse van de sales cijfers om de uniformiteit en betrouwbaarheid van de gerapporteerde resultaten te bewaren.
Je bouwt een eenvormig rapporteringssysteem uit, doet analyses en optimaliseert de procedures.
Door inzicht in de sales cijfers en producten van DKV, samen met je vermogen om vlot contacten te hebben met andere departementen, kan je de rapportering verder optimaliseren en implementeren doorheen de organisatie.
Je beheert de sales cijfers en houdt alle relevante data up to date.
Je voegt actief waarde toe aan de ontwikkeling van een data warehouse vanuit sales oogpunt.
Je ontwikkelt en onderhoudt de analytische tool die Accountmanagers gebruiken om hun makelaars/agenten te ondersteunen.
Je werkt nauw samen met Marketing, (Key/Sales) Accountmanagers en het statistisch team van de afdeling Finance.
Je past de Data Governance regels die gelden binnen DKV correct toe
Je volgt de geldende regels voor het opstellen van de juiste documentatie en procesbeschrijving.


Study

Managementstudies uitvoeren door gegevens te verzamelen, te verwerken en te analyseren op basis van intern of extern opgevraagde gegevens, rekening houdend met sectorale bewegingen, langetermijnontwikkelingen, wetgeving en de structuur van bestuurs- en overlegorganen
Inzicht verwerven in organisatiestructuren en aanbevelingen doen
Ondersteuning bieden aan de CCO en advies geven aan andere afdelingen binnen het bedrijf met betrekking tot de toegewezen domeinen.


Profiel

Je beschikt over een bachelordiploma of een gelijkwaardige ervaring
Je bent tweetaling (NL/FR) met een goede kennis van het Engels
Je hebt een goede kennis van MS office, PowerBi, SQL
Je bent een goede teamplayer, en kan daarnaast ook zelfstandig werken en verantwoordelijkheid nemen voor de uitvoering van de afgesproken taken binnen het team
Je beschikt over een groot leervermogen
Je bent communicatief
Je kan projectmatig denken en werken


Ons aanbod

Bij DKV bieden wij u een gevarieerde job met ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden (opleidingen, coaching, projectwerk en interne mobiliteit) en dit alles in hartje Brussel (vlak bij de grote markt en het centraal station).

Naast een competitief brutoloon bieden wij u een uitgebreid standaardpakket van extralegale voordelen aan :

eindejaarsgratificatie (13de maand)
collectieve verzekeringen (hospitalisatie verzekering, ambulante verzekering, verzekering gewaarborgd inkomen en aanvullend pensioenplan)
korting op DKV verzekeringsproducten
gratis openbaar vervoer
bedrijfsrestaurant
maaltijdcheques
ecocheques
cadeaucheque
collectieve bedrijfsbonus (CAO 90)
internetvergoeding
thuiswerkvergoeding


Bovendien kunt u ook rekenen op een aantrekkelijke verlofregeling (minstens 31 dagen verlof) en de mogelijkheid om tot drie dagen per week te telewerken. Deze manier van hybride werken garandeert u een goed evenwicht tussen werk en uw priv√©leven.

Wij zijn een werkgever die gelijke kansen biedt. Alle aspecten van tewerkstelling zijn uitsluitend gebaseerd op prestaties, bekwaamheid, gedrag of de behoeften van de onderneming. Als u enige ondersteuning nodig hebt voor toegang tot onze gebouwen, dan raden wij u aan ons daarvan op de hoogte te stellen op het moment van uw sollicitatie, zodat wij de nodige redelijke aanpassingen kunnen doorvoeren om u tijdens uw wervingstraject te ondersteunen."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Company: Agency for Control of Outstanding Debts
Industry: Financial Services 51-200 employees 27 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description
The Agency for Control of Outstanding Debts (ACOD) is a non-banking financial institution in Sofia, specializing in buying out and managing portfolios of nonperforming loans. With high ethical standards and individualized debt recovery solutions, ACOD has become a reputable partner for financial institutions and utility companies. ACOD is part of the Management Financial Group (MFG) and operates within Central and Eastern Europe, managing successful financial endeavors.

Role Description
This is a full-time on-site role for a Data Analyst at the Agency for Control of Outstanding Debts in Sofia. The Data Analyst will be responsible for analyzing and interpreting complex data sets, creating data models, and providing insights to support decision-making processes within the organization.

Qualifications
Analytical Skills, Data Analytics, and Statistics proficiency
Strong Communication skills
Data Modeling expertise
Experience with data visualization tools
Ability to work with large datasets and databases
Knowledge of debt collection industry practices is a plus
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
Experience in finance;
Experience with BI tools (eg Power BI, Tableau, Qlik View, Google Data / Looker Studio)
Experience with SQL (eg MS SQL, Oracle DB, MySQL)
Experience with ETL processes or data mining tools (eg Alteryx, SPSS Modeler, KNIME, SAS Enterprise Miner)
Experience with statistical processing in R, Python, or Matlab

What will we offer you?
Excellent working conditions - work in a modern office in the center of Sofia;
Five-day work week, eight-hour work day;
Good social policy
Food vouchers
Multisport card at a preferential price
Additional health insurance
Participating in special team building initiatives
Fruit and hot drinks in the office
Training and development program
Possibility of additional days of paid leave
Possibility to work from home
Additional bonus for referring a friend
Birthday present"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Junior Power BI Analyst (Remote, Contract)
Industry: Advertising Services 1,001-5,000 employees 727 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
OUR HIRING PROCESS:

We will review your application against our job requirements. We do not employ machine learning technologies during this phase as we believe every human deserves attention from another human. We do not think machines can evaluate your application quite like our seasoned recruiting professionals‚Äîevery person is unique. We promise to give your candidacy a fair and detailed assessment.
We may then invite you to submit a video interview for the review of the hiring manager. This video interview is often followed by a test or short project that allows us to determine whether you will be a good fit for the team.
At this point, we will invite you to interview with our hiring manager and/or the interview team. Please note: We do not conduct interviews via text message, Telegram, etc. and we never hire anyone into our organization without having met you face-to-face (or via Zoom). You will be invited to come to a live meeting or Zoom, where you will meet our INFUSE team.
From there on, it's decision time! If you are still excited to join INFUSE and we like you as much, we will have a conversation about your offer. We do not make offers without giving you the opportunity to speak with us live. After all, we consider our team members our family, and we want you to feel comfortable and welcomed.

Are you passionate about transforming data into actionable insights? Do you thrive in a dynamic environment where your analytical skills can make a real impact? Join our team as a Junior Power BI Analyst and embark on an exciting journey to drive data-driven decision-making within our organization. In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge BI tools, collaborate with talented professionals, and contribute to innovative projects that shape our business strategy. If you are eager to grow your career in data analytics and possess a keen eye for detail, we invite you to be part of our forward-thinking team. Unleash your potential and help us unlock the power of data!

Responsibilities:

Design dashboards in Microsoft Power BI and build business intelligence reports according to the needs.

Clean and ensure accuracy and integrity of data; review data for inconsistencies or anomalies.

Maintain dashboards to identify reporting issues or gaps and drive timely resolution.

Prepare clear and concise reports.

Development, optimization, and support of existing analytical reports.

Identify opportunities for improvements.

Implement the best practices in collaboration with other team members.

Requirements:

Strong data visualization (experience with Power BI or similar tools) and presentation skills.

Strong data analysis and problem-solving skills.

Excel knowledge (incl. pivot tables, dashboard creation).

Ability to work with large volumes of data; extrapolate conclusions from a variety of data sources, both quantitative and qualitative.

Strong DAX & SQL knowledge, Python will be an advantage.

English proficiency (Upper Intermediate or higher)"

Job Description:

Var Group, certificato Great Place to Work, √® operatore leader nel settore dei servizi e delle soluzioni digitali. Inizia il tuo percorso professionale nel mondo dei Dati e della consulenza IT con Mediamente Consulting!

Mediamente Consulting √® parte integrante della Business Unit Data Science di Var Group, specializzata nella gestione e valorizzazione dei dati. Posizione:

Attraverso il nostro tirocinio formativo, avrai l'opportunit√† di specializzarti nella consulenza informatica in uno o pi√π dei seguenti ambiti:

 Data Engineering e Generative ETL
Task: Sviluppo e implementazione di soluzioni di data engineering, automatizzazione dei processi di data engineering, miglioramento della qualit√† dei dati, implementazione di automatizzazione tramite soluzioni di intelligenza artificiale generativa.

Task: Analisi e visualizzazione dati, data management, miglioramento della qualit√† dei dati, business intelligence

Requisiti:

Laureati o laureandi magistrali in ambito STEM con conoscenze basiche di SQL, database, principi di data visualization

Spiccata attitudine al problem solving.

Altre informazioni:

Modalit√† di Inserimento 

Possiamo attivare due differenti modalit√†, a seconda delle necessit√† rispetto al tuo percorso accademico:

Var Group, pi√π che un luogo di lavoro, √® un ambiente aperto all‚Äôinnovazione, alla ricerca e alla condivisione di esperienze eccellenti. Una realt√† nella quale √® possibile crescere e ricoprire ruoli sfidanti, sempre in stretta relazione con i leader mondiali del settore.

Var Group S.p.A. garantisce un approccio equo, meritocratico e trasparente al fine di creare un‚Äôorganizzazione che ponga al centro la persona, valorizzando i differenti background, esperienze e competenze di ciascun individuo. Title:
Data & Analytics Intern (Manufacturing and R&D)
Data & Analytics Intern (Manufacturing and R&D) with verification
Industry: Food and Beverage Services 10,001+ employees 9,943 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

Would you like to join an internship at a Coffee & Tea company that

values your future success and prioritizes your passion for positive change?

Check out this internship starting September 2024 and Unleash Your Possibility at JDE Peet's!

Company Details

At JDE Peet's (before: JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS), we're not just about Coffee or Tea; we're all about the moments and connections they spark. With a history spanning 270 years, we've been shaping the daily rituals of people worldwide, driven by our dedication to quality products and sustainability.

We are action-driven and deliver our commitments. This means the freedom to challenge the status quo and to look for different perspectives. Our teams work by four fundamental values: We are progressive in outlook, ambitious in nature, resourceful in action and decisive in approach. These values paint the best picture of the kind of fast-moving culture you'll join at JDE Peet's.

Job Description

Join us as Data & Analytics Intern (Manufacturing and R&D) at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you will gain hands-on experience by helping our R&D team to digitize the process for creating a prediction-based test plan for acrylamide (a substance released during coffee roasting) per blend ‚Äì and you will grow your knowledge and skills with process mapping, automation, and analytics.

Your Key Activities Will Be

Collect requirements from the business to understand the process of acrylamide testing and mapping of the process
Evaluate which steps of the process can be automated further (e.g. collection of acrylamide test results, creation of data pipeline for the Machine Learning (ML) model, visualization of the output) and find technology solutions to implement these automations
Implement low code workflow or visualization solutions for automating the acrylamide testing tool in an agile way
Collect feedback from the business to tailor the solution to their needs, while aligning with the IT team to ensure the usage of fit-for-purpose technology solutions

Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning journey as part of our Global IT Core Functions team, where you'll gain valuable insights into mapping and requirement gathering, and using low code automation and workflow (Power Apps, Power Platform) and visualization (PowerBI) technologies.

What's in it for you?

A monthly internship allowance of ‚Ç¨525 (full-time)
Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
Paid holidays for each internship term
Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
The chance to learn from the best IT professionals out there!

Qualifications

Are you bursting with fresh ideas and a hunger for learning? We want you!

Here's What We're Looking For

Academic Program: You are enrolled in a BSc or MSc program for the entirety of the internship, preferably in Data Analytics, Automation, or a related field.
Skillset: You possess strong MS Office skills and fluent proficiency in speaking and written English ‚Äì Having some similar hands-on experience with food research activities is always a benefit.
Personal traits: You have a structured approach, a driven and energetic personality, excellent communication and people skills, and the ability to work both in a team and independently.
Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 5 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to January.
Availability: You can join the internship for 4 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.

As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:

Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.

Additional Information

Are you ready to Unleash Your Possibility within JDE Peet's?

Here's How To Apply

Upload your resume (in English) using our LinkedIn or career site application form.
After applying, we'll reach out within three weeks to let you know what's next.
During the application process, you'll be asked to do an online assessment and at least one interview at our Utrecht office.

If you have questions, don't hesitate to contact our Campus team at IHQinternships@jdecoffee.com -- We're here to help!"

Title:
Junior Data Scientist / Analyst
Junior Data Scientist / Analyst with verification
Industry: Software Development 10,001+ employees 28,148 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
At Nielsen, we believe that career growth is a partnership. You ultimately own, fuel and set the journey. By joining our team of nearly 14,000 associates, you will become part of a community that will help you to succeed. We champion you because when you succeed, we do too. Embark on a new initiative, explore a fresh approach, and take license to think big, so we can all continuously improve. We enable your best to power our future. 

About the Role
Nielsen measures the media-consumption habits of homes globally. Our data paints a rich portrait of the audience in those markets we measure. As a pioneer and industry leader in audience measurement for more than half a century, we take pride in our technology and processes, and we are constantly searching for new ways to advance our culture of innovation and growth. 
Our areas of expertise include researching hardware, software, quality controls and business rule changes that will improve the accuracy of our data reporting. 
In this role, you will learn and become an expert in Nielsen‚Äôs TV panel data, with a focus on Meter hardware and software used for data collection and crediting. You will help to design and execute analyses, develop necessary underlying data pipelines, and help to provide data-driven recommendations based on findings. 
This role can be based out of our offices in Koper or Ljubljana.

Responsibilities
Learn and become an expert in Audience Measurement, with a focus on streaming meter technology used for data collection and crediting. 
Contribute to analysis plan design, develop underlying data pipelines, execute analyses and summarize results
Identify, clean, and summarize data, potentially from disparate and complex data sources, to facilitate high quality analyses. 
Create simple, meaningful visualizations to help support data analysis and stakeholder communications 
Develop and share efficient code used for analyses
Incorporate quality checks to proactively detect and correct for errors throughout analysis. 
Provide clear data-driven recommendations based on research findings
Support senior team members in collaboration with department stakeholders (Engineering, Data Science, Technology, etc.). This includes providing status updates, developing timelines, sharing data, executing tests, presenting results, etc

Key skills
Bachelor‚Äôs Degree or higher in Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, Data Science, Data Engineering or equivalent experience
Proven years of experience with the following: Manipulating, analyzing and interpreting complex data sources to tell a story from data through analyses; Programming in Python, PySpark and SQL for data pipeline development used to support analytics; Trending and visualizing data within Tableau; Experience working in cloud-based environments such as AWS
Able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing
Embraces innovation with a readiness to explore new solutions and a commitment to rapid iteration based on customer feedback
Demonstrates strategic thinking, understanding the broader impact of data insights on product and business objectives
Good level of English


Diversity
 Here at Nielsen, we believe strongly in the value of diversity and creating supportive, inclusive environments where our colleagues can succeed. As such, Nielsen is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We welcome applications from people that are excited to work for us, regardless of their background - so please get in touch!
 Nielsen provides equal employment opportunities to applicants and employees without regard to any protected characteristics under local law."

"About the job
Cosa farai concretamente?

All'interno del Team Risk Anticipation, ti occuperai dell'analisi del rischio del portafoglio di Findomestic, calcolando l'Expected Credit Loss ed i suoi principali componenti (PD, LGD, EAD,...). Siamo Top Employer 2024. Farai parte di un'azienda che investe nella crescita delle sue persone offrendo al contempo un ambiente di lavoro stimolante ed innovativo. Scopri le nostre  Findomestic Stories!

"About the job
Senior data analyst

SCORIFY is a successfully growing company bringing cutting edge technologies based on big data analytics, artificial intelligence, and machine learning. Our solutions are being used by financial institutions, peer-to-peer lending platforms, telcos, and central banks. We are looking for a strong addition to the team who will join us in creating new AI models and services.

Your responsibilities:
Ownership of Data Reporting:
Own the data reporting process by conducting data analyses to identify trends, test hypotheses, support initiatives, and provide actionable insights.
Provide daily support, troubleshooting, and assistance with data queries and issues for team members and stakeholders, ensuring data integrity and reliability.

Data Engineering Tasks:

Participate in data pipeline development and maintenance.

Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role.
Strong proficiency in SQL, Excel.

Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.

Experience with Python or R.
Experience in the financial services industry.

Vast amounts of diverse data to torture.
Competitive salary and benefits package.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨ 3000 - ‚Ç¨ 4200 gross per month.
 CV submission deadline is 12th of August"

Title:
Stagiair | Junior Data Analist
Stagiair | Junior Data Analist
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 201-500 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Beschrijving van het bericht

Stagiair | Junior Data Analist

Op zoek naar een meewerkstage waar je als onderdeel van een innoverend datateam impact gaat maken op de duurzame inzetbaarheid van medewerkers? Wordt dan onze nieuwe stagiair Data Analist!

Dit ga je doen

Als Stagiair Data Analist Employee Wellbeing ga je klanten van Aon in staat stellen om data-gedreven te sturen op onderwerpen als vitaliteit en verzuim. Dit doe je door het bouwen van visueel aantrekkelijke rapportages en dashboards in Power BI. Ook duik je zelf in de data om op basis van correlaties, regressies en machine learning tot nieuwe inzichten te komen. Samen met je team werk je aan innoverende oplossingen op het gebied van Employee Wellbeing.

Ook hier word je enthousiast van

Meedenken over hoe we de medewerkers van onze klanten n√≥g beter kunnen bedienen
Innoveren en pionieren: we zijn samen aan het bouwen dus er is veel ruimte voor creativiteit en nieuwe idee√´n
Jonge en gedreven collega's met een focus op het maken van impact


Hier kom je te werken

Aon is wereldwijd een toonaangevende wereldwijde adviseur op het gebied van risico-, pensioen- en gezondheidsoplossingen. We helpen organisaties en individuen om hun volledige potentieel te bereiken door het beheer van risico's, het optimaliseren van hun personeelsbestand en het bevorderen van welzijn en gezondheid. Met meer dan 50.000 medewerkers in ruim 120 landen zijn we toegewijd aan het leveren van innovatieve oplossingen en diensten van topkwaliteit.

Dit ben jij

Bachelor- of master in Information Sciences, Data Science, Statistiek, Computer Science of een gerelateerd veld.
Affiniteit met het werken met diverse datasets en het toepassen van data-analysemethoden.
Motivatie en bereidheid om met Power BI te leren werken. Indien je hier al mee kan werken is dit een enorme plus.
Kennis van programmeertalen (bijv. Python, R) is ook een pluspunt. 
Interesse in welzijns- en gezondheid gerelateerde vraagstukken en trends.
Creatief, nieuwsgierig en in staat om out-of-the-box oplossingen te bedenken.
Teamspeler met een proactieve en resultaatgerichte mentaliteit.


We begrijpen dat een stagiair mogelijk nog niet aan alle kwalificaties en vereisten voldoet, en daarom staan we open voor een flexibele aanpak waarbij we de functie en bijbehorende verantwoordelijkheden zo goed mogelijk laten aansluiten op jouw behoefte4n en talenten.

Dit verzekeren wij

Een stagevergoeding van ‚Ç¨400,- (HBO) of ‚Ç¨550,- (WO) bruto per maand. Mocht er een match zijn kijken we na je stage ook graag naar verdere doorgroeimogelijkheden binnen Aon na je stage.

En nu?

Wil je graag meer inhoudelijke informatie over deze vacature? Dat kan. Voel je meer dan vrij te schakelen met onze Talent Acquisition Business Partner (Early Careers) Dis Gr√∂tzinger via 06-27173154.

Na je sollicitatie:

 Ontvang je meteen een bevestiging in je inbox
 Binnen 2 werkdagen neemt onze Recruiter Dis Gr√∂tzinger contact met je op voor een kort kennismakingsgesprek
 Iedereen enthousiast? Dan plannen we een afspraak in waar ook de manager van deze vacature bij aanschuift

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals 1,001-5,000 employees 81 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
The company:

Everfield is a platform with a mission in acquiring, building and operating vertical market and specialist software companies, focused on European businesses. We invest in and provide support and best practices to software companies in order for them to live up to their full potential by offering a very established approach to promote growth.

Everfield is looking to be the leader in European Vertical and specialist software solutions across myriad niche industries who provide mission critical applications, service, and support to their clients.

Everfield seeks to deliver innovation and growth to its acquired companies by providing best practices and operational support to help identify opportunities and install proven methodologies to accelerate customer and market share. Everfield is located throughout Europe, with offices in UK, Germany, the Netherlands, France, Poland, Spain, and Latvia.

The position:

As Data Analyst specialized on CRM data, you will work closely with our portfolio companies, Everfield‚Äôs Sales & Marketing Leads and Head of Business Intelligence to improve our sales processes. You will also work closely with two data engineers to create sustainable data pipelines and turn the Sales & Marketing data into actionable insights.

In this role you will become the fourth member of the Business Intelligence (BI) team. The BI team creates value for various stakeholders (CEO, Finance, COO, Sales, Marketing, and Everfield‚Äôs portfolio companies), by creating insights, delivering analysis, automating reporting processes and improving data quality.

The team builds pipelines with Synapse to ingest the data into our data platform, uses Databricks for data transformation and Power BI for data visualization. For analytics the team also uses SQL.

The scope of the team is expected to scale with the company‚Äôs growth and maturity level. Everfield will scale from 13 portfolio companies currently, to approximately 90 companies in the next 4 years.

Responsibilities:

Requirements gathering

Align with key stakeholders to understand reporting requirements
Create feature development and communication plans
Identify new data variables to be captured on a portfolio level

Data Analysis

Exploratory Data Analysis to test feasibility of requests and propose additional features
Suggests alternatives if requirements cannot be met

Data Visualization

Design proof of concept solutions fit for user acceptance testing
Maintain and update Power BI reports

Data Ingestion, Verification and Validation

Extract raw data from upstream sources
Improving data quality and efficiency

Support portfolio companies with quality assurance of their CRM data

Analyse and organize raw data

Data modelling and Transformation

Build data systems and pipelines based on a medallion architecture

Compliance & Security

Create and maintain data glossary

Structure sales processes

Go beyond the data and work together with Everfield‚Äôs Sales Lead to structure sales processes in the portfolio companies
Support portfolio companies in implementing Everfield‚Äôs suggested data structure on CRMs

Ideal candidate profile:

The position requires a self-starting personality, that fits into an environment that is characterised by entrepreneurship and has a customer centric approach. 
The candidate will have at least 3 years of experience within an international or complex environment and the right drive and ambition to make the difference. 
Experienced with Sales processes and business partnership with sales teams. 
Relevant experience with Synapse or Azure Data Factory and Databricks is a plus-point. 
Knowledge and hands on experience with Python (PySpark, Pandas). 
Experienced with data modelling. 
Experience with working in a DevOps team, following a structured, iterative Agile development process. 
Fluent in English. 
Above all, a great colleague, enthusiastic, approachable, honest, committed, result focused, a team player who wants to achieve the best results together. 

What‚Äôs in it for you?

Grow your career in a fast phased and growing organization. 
Enable exponential growth by designing a world class data platform. 
Working with the latest Data Analytics technologies. 
Long term career opportunities. 
Working closer to leadership teams within the Head Quarters and Portfolio Companies. 
Flexible work environment with offices around Europe (Netherlands, UK, Spain, France, Poland, Germany). 

Continue the conversation

Interested? We would love to hear from you!

Apply now with your CV and if you are selected our Talent Acquisition colleague will contact you to schedule the 1st call and start our hiring process."

Job Description:
"About the job
De voorbije 2 jaar hebben we met Catcoon een indrukwekkende groei doorgemaakt en scherpte we onze dienstverlening aan, met een speciale focus op sectoren waar we √©cht het verschil maken: HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector en Energie.

Onze ambitie is om te blijven groeien en daarom zoeken we een gedreven Data Analyst om samen met onze klanten datagestuurde besluitvorming te stimuleren en hen te helpen transformeren richting een data gedreven organisatie. Je werkt samen met verschillende rollen in het datadomein en het is aan jou om ervoor te zorgen dat data wordt omgezet in verstaanbare inzichten die de bedrijfsstrategie ondersteunen.

Heb je zin om een dosis empathie en rationeel gezond verstand te combineren met data gedreven inzichten en processen? Ben jij iemand die analytische vaardigheden combineert met zakelijk inzicht, de kracht van data begrijpt en kan zorgen voor de juiste governance?

Dan leren we je graag kennen.

Wat ga je doen?
Je wordt ingezet als Data & Analytics consultant voor √©√©n van onze klanten binnen onze sector (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
Je analyseert complexe datasets om bruikbare inzichten te genereren die de strategische doelen van de klant ondersteunen.
Je helpt bij het opzetten van een Data & Analytics groeipad van reactieve analyses naar voorspellende analyses.
Je gebruikt geavanceerde analytische technieken en tools om patronen te identificeren, voorspellingen te doen en aanbevelingen te geven.
Je werkt nauw samen met klantteams om data-analyse initiatieven te leiden en de implementatie van data gestuurde besluitvormingsprocessen te ondersteunen.
Je presenteert en visualiseert gegevens op een manier die begrijpelijk en overtuigend is voor zowel technische als niet-technische stakeholders.
Je verzamelt, reinigt en organiseert data uit verschillende bronnen om inzichten te cre√´ren voor de klanten.
Je implementeert het data governance beleid en procedures om datakwaliteit, data-integriteit en data-veiligheid te waarborgen bij de klant. Je kan hier ook kritisch naar kijken en advies over geven.
Je blijft op de hoogte van de nieuwste trends en ontwikkelingen in data science, machine learning, big data technologie√´n en data governance.
 Wat verwachten we van je?
Je hebt minstens 3 jaar ervaring in Data-analyse of Business Intelligence
Je hebt bij voorkeur minstens 1 jaar ervaring in 1 van onze sectoren (HR, Gezondheidszorg, de Publieke sector of Energie)
Je bent gepassioneerd door data en hebt diepgaande kennis van analytische methoden, statistische modellen en data governance principes.
Je hebt ervaring met SQL, Python, R of andere data-analyse tools en platforms.
Je hebt ervaring met het visualiseren van data met tools als Tableau, Power BI, Qklik of vergelijkbare software.
Je hebt sterke communicatieve vaardigheden en kunt complexe idee√´n duidelijk en effectief communiceren aan een gevarieerd publiek.
Je bent kritisch en weet wanneer te luisteren, wanneer terug te duwen en wanneer te leiden.
Je bent nieuwsgierig, innovatief en hebt een sterk probleemoplossend vermogen.

Wat mag je van ons verwachten?
Een competitief loon in functie van jouw ervaring
Een firmawagen
Alles wat je nodig hebt om jouw job uit te oefenen, zowel thuis als op kantoor
Vrijheid en ruimte voor eigen idee√´n en initiatief
De optie om aan persoonlijke cases te werken met een focus op onderzoek en innovatie
Interne opleidingen en de mogelijkheid om te groeien in een ervaren team
Sfeervol hoofdkantoor in een oude opslagplaats nabij Park Spoor Noord te Antwerpen (www.hoi.be)
Leuke collega‚Äôs, teamsfeer en -events!
Extralegale voordelen zoals hospitalisatieverzekering, groepsverzekering, maaltijdvergoeding en ecocheques

Iets voor jou?
Stuur ons je inspirerende motivatiebrief en CV naar info@catcoon.be en bouw mee aan een mooiere digitale wereld."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Software Development 501-1,000 employees 411 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Large company with great ambitions and close relations
efficy is a leading European Customer Relationship Management (CRM) solution that provides businesses of all sizes with complete, flexible, customizable, and scalable software to enable their growth. efficy‚Äôs platform includes products for marketing automation, sales, project management, customer service, and customer nurturing. Currently, more than 300,000 users from 63 countries use efficy‚Äôs tool.
Founded in 2005 and headquartered in Brussels, efficy‚Äôs around 500 employees work in local offices in Belgium, France, Spain, the Netherlands, Sweden, Denmark, Finland, Norway, Spain, Hong Kong, or remotely.
Our mission is to contribute to the success of every company by helping them transform customer data into customer insight while simplifying the work of their employees.
In efficy, two days are rarely the same, and things are changing rapidly. So, fasten your seat belt, and join us on the journey.

A Unique Work Experience & Company Culture
We want our employees to thrive in their daily lives, and therefore you can expect challenges, online music quizzes, onsite ping-pong tournaments, and lots more. Communication is informal, and your colleagues are only a short call away.

Your Impact

As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our data strategy and ensuring the successful implementation of our data initiatives. You will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, providing actionable insights and reports, and contributing to the development of our data platform. Your technical aptitude, curiosity, and autonomy will be essential as you collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive data-driven decision-making.
As we embark on an exciting journey to create a robust data service, establish comprehensive data governance, and develop an innovative data platform!
We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our dynamic team.

Key Responsibilities
Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends that support business objectives.
Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate data findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data engineers to design and implement data pipelines and ELT processes.
Participate in the creation and enhancement of our data platform, ensuring it meets the needs of various business units.
Provide technical expertise and support in data modeling, data integration, and data warehousing.
Work closely with stakeholders to understand their data needs and provide solutions that drive business value.
Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and best practices in data analysis, data engineering, and data governance. 

About YOU

More than 3 years of significant experience as a Data Analyst, preferably in a Startup or a software company.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python, R).
Technical expertise in data engineering, including experience with ELT processes, data pipelines, and data warehousing.
Familiarity with data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, Power BI).
Understanding of data governance principles and best practices.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Ability to work autonomously and manage multiple tasks simultaneously.
Strong communication skills in both French and English.
Curiosity and a passion for leveraging data to drive business outcomes. 

We offer YOU

A competitive salary package with a bonus system and a referral program
A stable and growing company with an entrepreneurial mindset where we will listen to your ideas and support you to make it happen
High flexibility and hybrid work is part of our DNA
State-of-the-art offices with our unique co-living-co-working concept where teamwork is the norm
International growing opportunities and internal mobility
Events: team lunches, after work, sports, trips
Learning opportunities: languages, tech, product,... 
Do you have questions about this position? Please contact jobs@efficy.com
Find more jobs at https://jobs.efficy.com.

efficy is a people-first employer. We offer equal opportunities to all our candidates. We pride ourselves on the diversity of our people. We welcome you, and everything that makes you‚Äîwell, you. That includes your gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, age, or disability status. So, if you‚Äôre interested in joining us, please feel free to apply. We can‚Äôt wait to meet you!

Disclaimer 
efficy is not accepting unsolicited assistance from search firms for this employment opportunity. Please, no phone calls or emails. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at efficy via email, the Internet, or in any form and/or method without a valid written search agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of efficy. No fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by efficy as a result of an unsolicited referral or through other means."

Job Description:
"About the job
Job Description: In this role, you will be the key link between Commercial and Finance teams. You will be the Subject Matter Expert responsible for Sales Force Metrics and Performance & KPI tracking. You will also coordinate contract management in collaboration with Sales, Legal, and the EMEA contract management team. Your role involves providing sales, volume, and financial analysis to evaluate business opportunities and generate market intelligence presentations for internal and external use. Occasionally, you may join customer meetings as a consultant. You should possess strong business acumen, combined with analytical and local thinking, to translate data into actionable commercial strategies and reports.

Responsibilities:
Act as the local admin and champion for Salesforce (SFDC).
Gather and share market data and insights (GFK) to detect and share market opportunities.
Conduct commercial customer analysis on category, channel, distribution, and product.
Provide in-depth analysis for Strategic Partner Accounts.
Coordinate and follow up on contract management.
Process third-party sell-out data and update the Customer Performance Dashboard (Excel).
Collaborate closely with National Sales Managers (NSMs) to support SFDC KPI metrics and performance reporting.
Provide volume and financial analysis to evaluate financial results.
Create toolkits for field sales representatives to enhance business opportunities.
Analyze the market for new products and trends, identifying opportunities and potential threats.
Support and implement regional and local strategies with the Benelux commercial team.
Work with Marketing on campaign processes, registration, and tracking.
Handle customer contract administration with local Key Account Management and regional headquarters to ensure a smooth contract process.
Manage and maintain the CRM system as the admin for Salesforce (territory management, user setup, data validation, managing sales reps, reporting, and dashboards).
Handle customer segmentation from a finance perspective, in consultation with the regional manager.
Consult with the EMEA team about data quality and make necessary changes (Cognos, SFDC, Oracle).
Produce ad-hoc reports as needed.

Candidate Profile:
Start as soon as possible, with a one-year contract and potential for permanent hire.
36-40 hours per week.
1-3 years of experience;
Strong knowledge and experience with Excel are a must.
Experience with Salesforce, SQL, and/or Tableau is a plus.
Reports to the Business Controller.
Salary between ‚Ç¨45,000 and ‚Ç¨65,000 depending on experience, with an annual performance bonus of approximately 10%.
30 vacation days.
Background in economics/finance.
Team player who enjoys being in the office, proactive, good at data interpretation and presentation, and enjoys interacting with colleagues and stakeholders.
Fluent in Dutch.
Hybrid work model: 3 days in the office, 2 days at home.
Affinity with medical devices is considered a plus.

Qualifications:
Hard Skills:
Experience with Business and financial analysis
Superior Excel skills (pivot tables, macros, lookups, sum if, complex link files)
Database management (Cognos and preferably Tableau)
Project management
Computer skills (word processing, spreadsheet, database tools, design tools, and presentation/chart applications)
Salesforce
Forecasting and statistical modeling
Advanced database and Excel skills
Cognos reporting and Hyperion (training can be provided)
Relevant degree (business/management/economics/finance)
Soft Skills:
Effective communication across all levels
High accuracy and attention to detail
Fluent in Dutch and English
Commercial mindset
Excellent analytical skills
Ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously
Teamwork and collaboration
Proactive and self-motivated
Adaptability and flexibility

Desired Skills and Experience
Excel (pivot tables, macros, lookups)
Salesforce (SFDC)
SQL
Tableau
Cognos
Oracle
Hyperion"

Job Description:
"About the job
Founded in 1948, SLG (Sales Lentz Group) is one of the leading players in the field of mobility, tourism and travel in Luxembourg.

With a heritage of over 75 years marked by innovation and a strong sense of customer service, we offer a wide range of transport and tourism-related services through our various brands such as Sales Lentz, Voyages Leonard, Flibco.com, Travel Pro, Sightseeing.lu, and many others.

Our team of nearly 2,000 talented and committed professionals actively contributes to the continued growth and diversification of the SLG Group, while maintaining a high level of excellence. We are constantly striving to meet our customers' needs and anticipate market developments.

As part of our expansion, we are looking for a Data Analyst for our head office in Bascharage.

You are an enthusiastic, communicative and results-driven person with the ability to analyze data and identify potentials? You‚Äôre keen to take on new challenges, work independently and support others with their required data? For you, the results are what matters ? You‚Äôre eager to work in a fast-paced and agile environment and collaborating with multiple highly motivated teams?
Then you are reading the right offer for you!

Within our corporate group, you‚Äôll take on responsibility in consulting and supporting our various subsidiaries in their data activities. You will work with the business teams to identify potentials in the data.

Your responsibilities

Collaborate across the subsidiaries from different domains to help them understand their business need from a data perspective.
Generate information that helps others to make decisions
Find meaningful insights while exploring Data Sources. Explore possible data correlation between KPIs to explain trends
Provide help to the team working on data requests and optimize existing processes
Create dashboards and charts to visualize insights
Manage and maintain data sources
Establish Connections to internal and external systems (3rd-party) and prepare Data Sources
Setting up processes and systems to make working with data more efficient
Respond to data-related queries and keeping track of these
Presenting information generated to management and stakeholders

Your profile

Relevant Experience in BI, Data Analysis, Data visualization Tools (Tableau, QlikView, PowerBI)
Good knowledge in databases (relational/non-relational)
Experience in ETL-Processes and transformation tools (dbt)
Knowledge in AI/ML methods
Experience in data clouds/data lakes (S3, Azure, Snowflake)
Excellent analytical and mathematical skills
Able to identify and solve issues
Strong English (written and verbal)
Excellent soft skills (communication, presentation, negotiation, conflict resolution, etc.)
Ability to handle multi-threading activities

SLG values diversity and is committed to providing equal opportunities to all qualified candidates, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age or disability.

Please note that the position is based in Bascharage, Luxembourg."

We're looking for a Data Analyst experienced in eveloping data-driven solutions for the financial services industry, specifically in areas like banking, collections, or similar domains. You will work within AI & Advanced Analytic team, where there are ‚Äúunits‚Äù working on several initiatives. They are composed of Data Scientists and Data Analysts. Besides that you will work closely to the team of Data Engineers and MLOps Engineers.
