Title:
HR Data Analyst
HR Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Advertising Services 1,001-5,000 employees 1,330 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are looking for a talented HR Data Analyst to join our team in our Paris or Montpelier office (Hybrid work possible).

You will report to the Global Rewards Director and your main goal will be to shape and infuse a data-driven culture within the HR department of Teads. You will promote data accuracy, drive digitalization, and provide actionable insights to support strategic HR decisions.

What will you do?

As an HR Data Analyst attached to the Total Rewards team, your goal is to help infuse a data-driven culture in the HR department of Teads.

Data Management: Maintain and clean HR databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity. Optimize data flows and ensure compliance with data protection standards.
Reporting & Analytics: Clean and maintain the HR database using our HRIS and other HR systems (e.g., BambooHR, ATS, Performance Management), improve, optimize, streamline, and automate HR data flows through the integration of multiple APIs, ensure employee data processing adheres to stringent data protection standards for various strategic and legal requirements (e.g., audits, shareholders, leadership, HR, unions, stakeholders), and develop a deeper understanding of internal and external data management, including predictive models.
Insights & Performance: Deliver HR Key Indicators aligned with HR Roadmap, and Business strategy ensuring harmonized analytics across 35+ countries and diverse markets. Maintain, and improve BI Dashboards to support stakeholders in the decision-making regarding People & Reward management (salary cost/budget, reward campaigns, staff HC/mouvements, surveys‚Ä¶) and ad hoc analysis. Make recommendations to assess people and rewards program's effectiveness for continuous improvement.
Cross-functional Collaboration: Build strong partnerships with HR, Finance, IT, Innovation and other key contributors. Manage stakeholders‚Äô expectations to ensure a cohesive alignment of practices with overarching business strategies and financial considerations.

What will you bring to the team?

Master's Engineering degree in Technology, Business Intelligence, Data Science (Bac +5) with a strong interest in HR. 
Advanced proficiency in Google Sheets (AppScript/TypeScript) or Excel (VBA-SQL), Database management (Access levels, data accuracy) and Data visualization tools (Looker, PowerBi‚Ä¶).
Fluent English with excellent communication skills
First experience in BI, Reporting, Data Analytics as an intern and/or apprentice would be appreciated.
Passionate about agile methodologies.
User support-oriented mindset and proactive approach.
Curious, fast learner and strong attention to details.
Experience with data architecture, managing multiple APIs, HR information system (Core, ATS, ideally Bamboo, Greenhouse and/or Anaplan) will be a plus

About Teads

Teads operates a leading, cloud-based, omnichannel platform that enables programmatic digital advertising across a global ecosystem of quality digital media. As an end-to-end solution, Teads‚Äô modular platform allows partners to leverage buy-side, sell-side, creative, data and AI optimization technologies.

For advertisers and their agencies, Teads offers a single access point to buy the inventory of many of the world‚Äôs best publishers and content providers. Through exclusive global media partnerships, Teads enables advertisers and agencies to reach billions of unique monthly users in brand safe, responsible advertising environments, while improving the effectiveness and efficiency of digital ad transactions.

Teads partners with the leading marketers, agencies and publishers through a team of 1,200+ people in 50 offices across more than 30 countries."

Title:
eCommerce Data Analyst
eCommerce Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

"About the job
Ben jij een datagenie dat eender welke code kraakt en de beste analyses maakt? Sta je goed met een commerci√´le bril op je neus? En vooral: ben je fan van lokale media zoals Play, Nieuwsblad of VRT Max? Dan moet jij eens met ons komen babbelen!

Ads & Data is kort samengevat de meest badass reclameregie van Vlaanderen. En jij kan ons team van mediagekken versterken, want het Technology team van Ads & Data breidt uit!

Wat je doet‚Ä¶

Jij soigneert onze dataproducten en zorgt dat ze inzetbaar zijn. Da‚Äôs de clou van het verhaal. Uiteraard bieden we je eerst een boeiende en intensieve onboarding, met tal van training en ondersteuning. Jij tovert met gebruikers- en commerci√´le data en weet als geen ander inzichten te genereren. Je speurt doorheen interne en externe bronnen, en zet een grondige analyse om naar heldere vaststellingen.

Intern zien wij jou als een expert voor een reeks van dataproducten. Zowel in het gebruik van deze producten als in het samenstellen van documentatie errond. Jij bent de schakel tussen onze salesteams, product owners en het datateam, en adviseert in ontwikkeltrajecten. Jouw visie en input is bijzonder waardevol en essentieel: zowel in de ontwikkel- als in de testfase.

Dankzij jouw knap werk schiet het gebruiksgemak van de eindgebruiker de lucht in. Doen er zich complexe problemen voor, dan is het jouw verantwoordelijkheid om de vinger aan de pols te houden, samen met de Product Owner en de Care Expert.

Jij ‚Ä¶

‚Ä¶ hoeft nog geen tonnen ervaring te hebben. Goesting, motivatie en een goeie attitude is belangrijker voor ons.

‚Ä¶ beschikt over een masterdiploma.

‚Ä¶ kan problemen analyseren, begrijpen en gepast communiceren naar verschillende stakeholders.

‚Ä¶ bent een sterke communicator, een vlotte babbel.

‚Ä¶ bent een geboren probleemoplosser, een fixer.

‚Ä¶ kan een kritische houding aannemen, altijd met het gemak van de eindgebruiker in het achterhoofd.

‚Ä¶ houdt ervan om op de hoogte te zijn van alle nieuwtjes op de markt.

‚Ä¶ hebt ervaring of een eerste kennismaking met reporting en dashboardingtools zoals PowerBI.

‚Ä¶ kan overweg met analytische talen zoals SQL en Python.

‚Ä¶ wil je vooral smijten tijdens je volgende job.

What‚Äôs In It For You‚Ä¶

We bieden je een voltijds contract van onbepaalde duur (39u/week) aan. Je komt terecht in een bo√Æte boordevol sympathieke collega‚Äôs, waarbij verantwoordelijkheid en autonomie deel uitmaakt van onze bedrijfscultuur en geven je voldoende ruimte om je te ontplooien en bij te leren. Persoonlijke groei van onze mensen vinden we dan ook ontzettend belangrijk. Daarnaast maken een aantrekkelijk salaris aangevuld met extralegale voordelen deel uit van het aanbod. En vergeet ons hip hoofdkantoor in Vilvoorde niet! Hier bouwen we samen aan de knapste campagnes, heffen we regelmatig het glas op onze successen en niet onbelangrijk: we spotten er naar hartenlust schermgezichten!"

"About the job

Fluent in English and skilled at simplifying complex concepts for diverse audiences.

Your Work Environment:

A tech-forward, primarily digital workspace.

We acknowledge that many candidates may not meet every single role requirement listed above. If your experience looks a little different from our requirements but you believe that you can still bring value to the role, we‚Äôd love to see your application!

Who We Are:

Criteo is the global commerce media company that enables marketers and media owners to deliver richer consumer experiences and drive better commerce outcomes through its industry leading Commerce Media Platform.

At Criteo, our culture is as unique as it is diverse. From our offices around the world or from home, our incredible team of 3,600 Criteos collaborates to develop an open and inclusive environment. We seek to ensure that all of our workers are treated equally, and we do not tolerate discrimination based on race, gender identity, gender, sexual orientation, color, national origin, religion, age, disability, political opinion, pregnancy, migrant status, ethnicity, marital or family status, or other protected characteristics at all stages of the employment lifecycle including how we attract and recruit, through promotions, pay decisions, benefits, career progression and development. We aim to ensure employment decisions and actions are based solely on business-related considerations and not on protected characteristics. As outlined in our Code of Business Conduct and Ethics, we strictly forbid any kind of discrimination, harassment, mistreatment or bullying towards colleagues, clients, suppliers, stakeholders, shareholders, or any visitors of Criteo. All of this supports us in our mission to power the world‚Äôs marketers with trusted and impactful advertising encouraging discovery, innovation and choice in an open internet.

Why Join Us:

At Criteo, we take pride in being a caring culture and are committed to providing our employees with valuable benefits that support their physical, emotional and financial wellbeing, their interests and the important life events. We aim to create a place where people can grow and learn from each other while having a meaningful impact. We want to set you up for success in your job, and an important part of that includes comprehensive perks & benefits. Benefits may vary depending on the country where you work and the nature of your employment with Criteo. When determining compensation, we carefully consider a wide range of job-related factors, including experience, knowledge, skills, education, and location. These factors can cause your compensation to vary."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Associate Applied Data Scientist
Associate Applied Data Scientist with verification
Industry: Advertising Services 1,001-5,000 employees 2,646 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
dunnhumby is the global leader in Customer Data Science, empowering businesses everywhere to compete and thrive in the modern data-driven economy. We always put the Customer First.

Our mission: to enable businesses to grow and reimagine themselves by becoming advocates and champions for their Customers. With deep heritage and expertise in retail ‚Äì one of the world‚Äôs most competitive markets, with a deluge of multi-dimensional data ‚Äì dunnhumby today enables businesses all over the world, across industries, to be Customer First.

dunnhumby employs nearly 2,500 experts in offices throughout Europe, Asia, Africa, and the Americas working for transformative, iconic brands such as Tesco, Coca-Cola, Meijer, Procter & Gamble and Metro.

We‚Äôre looking for an Associate Applied Data Scientist who expects more from their career. The role requires a balance of both technical competency and client facing skills. The candidate must be motivated to engage with the client to understand their business questions and to conduct the analysis. The successful candidate will take responsibility for performing the technical exercise of gathering the data, interpreting them into insights and delivering clear and compelling results.

You‚Äôll have the opportunity to learn amongst a community of the Data Scientists and we offer extensive training opportunities for both technical & soft skills. You‚Äôll have access to varied, large & complex data sets, and perform analysis using Python, SQL, Spark & Hadoop.

What We Expect From You

1-2 years of experience required
Degree in a relevant subject
Exceptional communication skills and experience presenting to clients. 
Bachelor‚Äôs degree or equivalent in Data Science/Analytics, Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Applied Statistics, Physics, Engineering or related field. 
Experience with programming, and the ability to quickly pick up handling large data volumes with modern data processing tools, e.g. by using Hadoop / Spark / SQL / Python. 
Analytical Techniques 
Data Interpretation/ Insight Analysis.
Data Visualization
Insight Storytelling
Client relationship building and management.

What You Can Expect From Us

We won‚Äôt just meet your expectations. We‚Äôll defy them. So you‚Äôll enjoy the comprehensive rewards package you‚Äôd expect from a leading technology company. But also, a degree of personal flexibility you might not expect. Plus, thoughtful perks, like flexible working hours and your birthday off.

You‚Äôll also benefit from an investment in cutting-edge technology that reflects our global ambition. But with a nimble, small-business feel that gives you the freedom to play, experiment and learn.

And we don‚Äôt just talk about diversity and inclusion. We live it every day ‚Äì with thriving networks including dh Gender Equality Network, dh Proud, dh Family, dh One and dh Thrive as the living proof. We want everyone to have the opportunity to shine and perform at your best throughout our recruitment process. Please let us know how we can make this process work best for you. For an informal and confidential chat please contact stephanie.winson@dunnhumby.com to discuss how we can meet your needs.

Our approach to Flexible Working 

At dunnhumby, we value and respect difference and are committed to building an inclusive culture by creating an environment where you can balance a successful career with your commitments and interests outside of work.

We believe that you will do your best at work if you have a work / life balance. Some roles lend themselves to flexible options more than others, so if this is important to you please raise this with your recruiter, as we are open to discussing agile working opportunities during the hiring process.

For further information about how we collect and use your personal information please see our Privacy Notice which can be found (here)"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: Staffing and Recruiting 2-10 employees 11 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are on the lookout for a Data Analyst with a specialization in marketing analytics. In this critical role, you will harness the power of tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to derive actionable insights that drive our marketing decisions. Your expertise in analyzing complex datasets and turning them into understandable and strategic information will be essential in shaping our marketing strategies. This position is ideal for someone who thrives on data-driven challenges and has a passion for leveraging technology to inform business decisions.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Data Analysis and Interpretation: Utilize tools like Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI to analyze marketing data and extract meaningful insights. 
Developing Reporting Dashboards: Create dynamic dashboards and reports that provide real-time insights into marketing performance. 
Collaborating with Marketing Teams: Work closely with marketing teams to understand their data needs and provide insights that inform strategy and decision-making. 
Data Integration and Management: Integrate data from various sources to provide a comprehensive view of marketing performance. 
Performance Tracking: Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the effectiveness of marketing campaigns and strategies. 
Predictive Analysis: Use data to predict trends and market movements, aiding in proactive strategy development. 
Training and Support: Provide training and support to team members in using data analysis tools and understanding reports. 

Who You Are

Proficient in Data Analysis Tools: You have strong experience with tools such as Google Data Studio, BigQuery, and Power BI. 
Analytical and Insightful: You possess the ability to analyze complex datasets and turn them into actionable insights. 
Collaborative in Nature: You work well with marketing teams, understanding their needs and communicating data insights effectively. 
Skilled in Data Integration: You are adept at integrating and managing data from various sources. 
Detail-Oriented: You have a keen eye for detail and accuracy in data analysis and reporting. 
Proactive and Predictive: You are capable of conducting predictive analyses to inform future marketing strategies. 
Excellent Communicator: You can clearly convey data insights and their implications to non-technical team members. 

What Success Looks Like

30 Days

Establish a comprehensive, organized online database in BigQuery to store all client and marketing data and integrate lead data from CRMs, digital advertising data, customer opt-ins, and purchasing data to provide meaningful insights that inform marketing decisions. 
Create and maintain data dashboards in Looker Studio for easy data visualization, analysis, and automated reporting. 

60 Days

Develop statistical models for data analysis, including linear regression modeling and predictive lead scoring, that effectively guide marketing actions. 

90 Days

Automated the generation of actionable insights and trends over time from data analysis to inform our marketing strategy."

Title:
Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst
Industry: Financial Services 201-500 employees 222 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.

Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you‚Äôre in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.

Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!

We are seeking a talented and driven Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategies and driving growth.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of decision-making, unlocking valuable insights from data and transforming them into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, problem-solving, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

What you might be doing:


Identify Business Opportunities: Take the lead in exploring new business opportunities for our products and services. Utilise your analytical skills to generate hypotheses and assess the potential benefits of each opportunity, providing valuable insights and driving strategic decisions
App User Activity Analysis: Dive deep into user activity within our app to uncover meaningful patterns, correlations, or bottlenecks. Your keen eye for detail will be essential in identifying areas for improvement and optimising user experiences
Data-Driven Insights: Leverage various data analysis techniques to transform raw data into actionable insights. Your ability to draw meaningful conclusions will be instrumental in guiding the company towards growth and success
Collaboration and Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and measure the impact of the most promising opportunities. Your role as a liaison between the data team and business squads will be essential in ensuring seamless communication and execution
Data Ambassador: Be the primary point of contact and ambassador for the data team within specific business squads. Your expertise will play a crucial role in aligning data-related objectives with overall business goals
Continuous Learning: Exhibit a hunger for knowledge and continuously strive to ask relevant and insightful questions. Embrace new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis processes




What you might bring:


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven insights to influence business decisions
Excellent communication and presentation abilities to convey data insights in a clear and understandable manner
Proficiency in SQL 
Experience with data analysis in Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib) 
Experience with statistics (A/B testing, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing) is a plus
Ability to collect, organise, and analyse large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail. 
Independent and proactive, have the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment




Why you should apply: 


 Freedom to build the company of your dreams
 Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business
 BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system
 Flexible working hours
 25 working days of vacation + local holidays
 We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work
 Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one!
 Continuous learning and development opportunities




If our job description speaks to you, but you don‚Äôt feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!

Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!"

"About the job

Role Overview üöÄ

At Uncapped, we help ambitious founders realise their dreams. We are growing rapidly and have a high-profile role to help drive our expansion operations around the world.

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join the Uncapped.

As part of Uncapped team; you will be involved in building the next generation of products suited specifically for the needs of fast paced digital entrepreneurs. As we continue to expand globally; our goal is to have a team who are capable of getting the most out of our internal data and creating high-level business intelligent streams, while keeping our products ahead of the competition and powering new and exciting services that solve real problems for our customers.

As a dedicated Data analyst within our core product, you will be involved in regularly conducting analysis for all stakeholders. Your daily work will impact how and what we build; as well as drive the direction we are heading as a business. You will dive deeper into crucial team metrics, drive best practices and help scale our data governance. About Uncapped üë´

Founded in 2019, Uncapped is the fastest, most affordable way for growing online businesses to fund marketing and inventory. The company was born out of frustration with the limited financing options available for UK and European entrepreneurs to finance growth.

Uncapped provides working capital loans to brands and retailers around the world, doing between $10m and $100m in turnover.

Uncapped has raised VC funding from most notable investors including Lakestar, Mouro Capital, Global Founders Capital, White Star Capital, Seedcamp, and All Iron Ventures.

Title:

Job Description:
"About the job
Business Intelligence Analyst (BI Analyst) 
Company Description:
We are SkillOnNet. Our aim is to be the world leader in gaming entertainment by providing our customers with the most entertaining and trustworthy experience possible, while also reinventing the gambling industry. We are home to more than 30 well-known brands, including PlayOJO, DruckGluck, BacanaPlay, Genting, and many more. We are committed to long-term development and sustainability, and we are trying to revolutionize our industry for the benefit of our players, ourselves, and the entertainment industry as a whole.

Job Description:
We are looking to hire an experienced business intelligence analyst to support the delivery of data driven information to the marketing and product teams. This role requires strong analytical skills and excellent stakeholder management. As BI Analyst you will be required to drive innovation using BI to enhance process automation and Business performance visibility to generate incremental business benefits. You should have experience working with Tableau. This is a unique opportunity for a talented, self-motivated individual looking to build on their existing experience to join a dynamic Team and contribute to the growth of an already successful business.

Your Responsibilities:
Must be a quick learner with the ability to develop in-depth understanding of underlying data, data structures, and business uses of data
Partner with a variety of business teams and external agencies to gather, document and maintain
business requirements that will inform data modelling decisions
Experience working with multi-nationals with the ability to assimilate relevant cultural and regulatory differences
Utilise SQL and Data visualization tools deliver Dashboards and Analysis to enhance Visibility and Decisions making
Identify opportunities for increased automation and efficiency through technical solution
Experience in building customer lifetime value models
Help department managers with ad hoc projections and other modelling tasks
Deliver day to day data request
Identify cost saving opportunities
Experience in creating financial modelling
Utilize a hypothesis-driven problem-solving approach to design, construct, and rapidly test/iterate
exploratory data-mining analyses to reveal insight
Interprets and communicates insights to senior management
Works with business leaders to identify and develop metrics and visualizations that will track performance and highlight potential inefficiencies
You will require strong analytical acumen with the ability to uncover insights and create stories by seamlessly integrating a variety of data sources
The ability to work with large, complex data sets across multiple platforms and design efficient processes to provide accurate and timely information is crucial
What we are looking for:
Up to 3 years' experience in data science or related field
Experience in the gaming industry is beneficial but not required
Experience with prediction models and quantitative analysis
SQL and Tableau experience
Understanding of digital tracking, measurement, and reporting tools
Strong written and verbal communication in the English Language
Teamworking skills ‚Äì the ability to build relationships internally and externally, with experience
working with third party agencies
Strong organisational skills and experience of balancing multiple projects as once
Strong understanding of current online marketing concepts, strategy and best practice would be beneficial
Trustworthiness

What's in it for YOU?
Excellent work environment
Attractive salary package
Monetary vouchers on Birthdays and other special occasions
Fully equipped kitchen and in-house entertaining space
Options to enrol in Company's medical insurance plan
Possibilities to enrol in Company's pension plan
Exciting company activities including monthly lunches, corporate gatherings, an intercompany football team, competitions, and many other activities.

Title:
Data Analyst, VCO
Data Analyst, VCO with verification
Industry: Biotechnology Research 5,001-10,000 employees 6,236 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
The Company

PerkinElmer is a global analytical services and solutions provider with offerings including the leading OneSource Field and Laboratory services business that serve the biopharma, food, environmental, safety and applied end markets to accelerate scientific outcomes. Since 1937, PerkinElmer has served as a trusted partner in laboratory analysis and management and today complements its service offerings with a broad portfolio of atomic spectroscopy, molecular spectroscopy, and chromatography instruments, consumables, and reagents. With a dedicated team of more than 5,000 team members, the Company serves customers in more than 35 countries. Additional information is available at www.perkinelmer.com

Purpose

PerkinElmer is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join our Value Creation Office (VCO) team. As a Data Analyst, you will play a key role in supporting the Chief of Staff and the VCO team in driving data-driven decision-making processes. You will be aligned to one or several specific workstream(s), and will work closely with various stakeholders to gather, analyze, and present data insights that contribute to the strategic initiatives and value creation efforts of PerkinElmer.

Responsibilities

Data Collection and Analysis:

Collect and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and opportunities. 
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business requirements and translate them into actionable insights. 

Dashboard Development:

Design, create and enhance dashboards to visualize key performance indicators (KPIs) and track progress against strategic goals. 
Provide regular reports to the Chief of Staff and other stakeholders. 

Data Quality Assurance:

Ensure data accuracy and reliability by implementing quality assurance measures. 
Identify and address data discrepancies or inconsistencies. 

Strategic Support:

Assist in developing and executing strategies to drive value creation within the organization. 
Conduct ad-hoc analyses to support decision-making processes. 

Communication and Collaboration:

Effectively communicate data-driven insights to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. 
Collaborate with team members to ensure alignment of data analytics efforts with broader organizational objectives. 

Basic Qualifications

Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field. 
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, preferably within a private equity-backed environment or consulting firm
Proficiency in data visualization tools (Power BI preferred) and data analysis and manipulation tools (Alteryx (preferred), Python, R). 
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. 
Excellent communication and presentation abilities. 

Preferred Characteristics

Experience in understanding issues, analyzing data, deriving conclusions, developing practical solutions and supporting their implementation
Experience in accessing, querying, and manipulating data within ERP systems and enterprise applications, e.g., SAP, Salesforce, ServiceMax
Strong work ethic and motivation, extremely high ownership, low ego (getting things right vs. being right), no-nonsense attitude and ‚Äúwork hard, play hard‚Äù mentality
Ability to balance multiple competing priorities and projects with different stakeholders; Excellent prioritization skills and ‚Äúnose for value‚Äù that focuses efforts on the highest ROI work

What We Offer:

Private healthcare including dental care ‚Äì MEDICOVER
Life and long-term disability insurance ‚Äì GENERALI
Gym card - MULTISPORT
Social Fund Subsidies
Home Office allowance
Tuition reimbursement
Referral awards
Internal career development opportunities in multiple business areas
Up to 4 additional days of vacation by length of service in the company
Hybrid working model (4 days in the office per week)

PerkinElmer is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability status, age, or veteran status or any other characteristics protected by applicable law. PerkinElmer is committed to a culturally diverse workforce."

Title:
BI Analyst, Romania / VBET
BI Analyst, Romania / VBET with verification
Industry: Gambling Facilities and Casinos 1,001-5,000 employees 541 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
About the Role
VBET is a B2C international gaming operator with 20 years of experience in the industry. It is powered in-house by BetConstruct, which holds over ten licenses and operates in 12 European countries. VBet is headquartered in Yerevan, Armenia, operates both B2B and B2C, employs around 8,000 people and has several business lines, such as sports betting, gambling and crypto.
We are looking for a skilled BI/Data Analyst who is in strong collaboration with global VBet analytical teams to help the Romanian branch with data discovery, finding insights, defining user behavior patterns and tracking business into numbers (through metrics and KPIs). As a BI/Data Analyst, you will collaborate with all other departments (Business Development, Marketing, Operations and Finance) of our company and be a part of developing VBET Analytical platforms. 
With the experience gained through this job, you will be able to develop an internal career path and grow within the company.

Responsibilities
Participated in developing and managing the BI platform with global VBet analytical teams
Deep data analysis on information from different departments
Provide analytical support to key decision-makers, enhance reporting capabilities
Participated in developing and tracking product and business metrics and KPI
Support regional, marketing, operations and finance initiatives with data-discovering
Continuously data-discovering, finding insights, identifying trends and patterns in numbers
Present insights, findings and recommendations to key stakeholders at all levels

Our expectations
 University degree in Maths, Statistics, Computer Science, Economics or a related fields
 At least two years of experience in a relevant position (iGaming, online products, e-commerce) is mandatory.
 Strong analytical skills and ability to analyze large datasets, knowledge in data discovering methodology
 Understanding of metrics related to online business (web, product, CRM, general financial)
 SQL skills are mandatory and knowledge of Python will be an advantage
 Experience in web analytics will be an advantage
 Advanced English is required and other languages will be an advantage.
 Proactive communication and presentation skills to communicate with team members, external data providers, C level
 Ability to work independently and as part of a team"

Title:
Business Data Analyst
Business Data Analyst
Industry: Financial Services 201-500 employees 222 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
At SwissBorg, our mission is to build a spectrum of investment experiences that help people redefine wealth. Our app has over 790,000+ verified users, offering the best price and liquidity across 16 fiat currencies to buy 90+ cryptocurrencies. Users can earn yield, diversify their portfolios with our themed crypto bundles, and gain access to exclusive alpha investment opportunities. Our community is rapidly expanding, with more than $1.4 billion in assets held in the app and over 51,000 premium users.

Join us in shaping the future of finance, pushing the boundaries of what's possible, and transforming the way people manage their wealth. Whether you‚Äôre in Austria or Taiwan, and whether your portfolio is worth one dollar or a million, SwissBorg provides the best tools to learn about digital currencies and manage your wealth effectively.

Join the team to help revolutionise the world together!

We are seeking a talented and driven Business Data Analyst to join our dynamic team and play a crucial role in shaping our business strategies and driving growth.

As a Business Data Analyst, you will be at the forefront of decision-making, unlocking valuable insights from data and transforming them into actionable recommendations. If you are passionate about data-driven decision-making, problem-solving, and thrive in a collaborative environment, we want to hear from you!

What you might be doing:


Identify Business Opportunities: Take the lead in exploring new business opportunities for our products and services. Utilise your analytical skills to generate hypotheses and assess the potential benefits of each opportunity, providing valuable insights and driving strategic decisions
App User Activity Analysis: Dive deep into user activity within our app to uncover meaningful patterns, correlations, or bottlenecks. Your keen eye for detail will be essential in identifying areas for improvement and optimising user experiences
Data-Driven Insights: Leverage various data analysis techniques to transform raw data into actionable insights. Your ability to draw meaningful conclusions will be instrumental in guiding the company towards growth and success
Collaboration and Implementation: Work closely with cross-functional teams to implement and measure the impact of the most promising opportunities. Your role as a liaison between the data team and business squads will be essential in ensuring seamless communication and execution
Data Ambassador: Be the primary point of contact and ambassador for the data team within specific business squads. Your expertise will play a crucial role in aligning data-related objectives with overall business goals
Continuous Learning: Exhibit a hunger for knowledge and continuously strive to ask relevant and insightful questions. Embrace new tools and methodologies to enhance data analysis processes




What you might bring:


Proven experience as a Data Analyst or similar role, with a track record of delivering data-driven insights to influence business decisions
Excellent communication and presentation abilities to convey data insights in a clear and understandable manner
Proficiency in SQL 
Experience with data analysis in Python (numpy, pandas, matplotlib) 
Experience with statistics (A/B testing, confidence intervals, hypothesis testing) is a plus
Ability to collect, organise, and analyse large amounts of information with accuracy and attention to detail. 
Independent and proactive, have the ability to multi-task and work effectively in a fast-paced, cross-functional environment




Why you should apply: 


 Freedom to build the company of your dreams
 Learn with (super cool) experts in finance, engineering, AI, psychology and business
 BORG bonus based on our meritocratic system
 Flexible working hours
 25 working days of vacation + local holidays
 We'll provide you with a MacBook and a cutting edge tech stack to help you do your best work
 Annual company and team retreats - We'd love to see you at the next one!
 Continuous learning and development opportunities




If our job description speaks to you, but you don‚Äôt feel like you meet 100% of the requirements, apply anyway! You may have skills we didn‚Äôt even know we needed.

At SwissBorg, we embrace diversity. We strongly believe that getting the best outcome requires different perspectives and backgrounds. We‚Äôre committed to openness, curiosity and creating an inclusive culture because we know that diverse teams build better products and generate better ideas. We strongly encourage applications from everyone!

Familiarising yourself with our product is crucial for anyone looking to join our team. Please make sure to test the app, explore our blog for the latest developments, and follow our Careers Page, LinkedIn, and X for regular company updates!"

Title:
Data Analyst Intern for Marine
Data Analyst Intern for Marine
Company: Oil and Gas Job Search Ltd
Industry: Oil and Gas 201-500 employees 2,824 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
At ABB, we are dedicated to addressing global challenges. Our core values: care, courage, curiosity, and collaboration - combined with a focus on diversity, inclusion, and equal opportunities - are key drivers in our aim to empower everyone to create sustainable solutions. That's our story. Make it your story!

This position reports to

Head Polish Development Center

Your Role And Responsibilities

ABB Marine & Ports is transforming the industry through electrical, digital and connected solutions. Our innovative technologies are redefining the future, bringing new levels of reliability, efficiency and sustainability to shipping while making our ports and terminals safer, greener and more productive. At the forefront is our RDS - Remote Diagnostic System for Marine - a system which is already installed worldwide on board of over 200 vessels. Dedicated solutions enable monitoring of physical assets in the power and propulsion system, reducing or preventing downtimes. As a Data Analyst Intern you will be a part of Marine Analytic Team working on projects primarily related to data obtained from the RDS tool. This internship is an opportunity to apply your knowledge of Data Engineering and Microsoft Power BI in ongoing and future marine digital projects. The work model for the role is: hybrid Your responsibilities:

 Collaborating on designing and building innovative data and analytics solutions, visuals, metrics and KPIs
 Working on Proof Of Concept and demo visualizations
 Troubleshooting unexpected errors within Power BI models and reports
 Working with others to determine the needs of existing and future reports
 Auditing reports for accurate data and functionality
 Interpreting data, analyzing results using statistical techniques
 Assisting with data preparation


Qualifications For The Role

3th or 4th year student in Econometrics, Computer Science, Mathematics and Statistics or equivalent
Knowledge of Power BI or similar BI tool
Good understanding of database structure
Experience with data scripting languages (e.g. SQL, Python) would be an advantage
Knowledge of marine domain and/or basic knowledge of industrial automation systems would be an advantage


More About Us

We value people from different backgrounds. Apply today for your next career step within ABB and visit www.abb.com to learn about the impact of our solutions across the globe. #MyABBStory We offer:

 Paid internship
 Gain experience in an international environment
 Hands-on experience ABB`s tools and applications
 Flexible working hours
 Friendly work environment with great team spirit. To apply for the position, please send your application via our page. We reserve the right to answer only to the chosen candidates. ABB Data Privacy Statement: https://new.abb.com/privacy-notice/candidate ABB Marine on youtube: https://youtu.be/0hWI7RJJ0p8 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HDFNkAq6c"

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst with verification
Industry: Software Development 1,001-5,000 employees 7,191 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
We are building out a first-class Data and Analytics department composed of Data Engineers, Software Engineers, Analytics Engineers, Data Analysts, and Data Scientists. We ensure all teams at Datadog can easily self-serve the data and report they need to drive their projects and make decisions. If you‚Äôre excited to work on a fast-moving team using cutting-edge open-source technologies to collect, store, transform, analyze, and model data, we want to meet you.

At Datadog, we place value in our office culture - the relationships and collaboration it builds and the creativity it brings to the table. We operate as a hybrid workplace to ensure our Datadogs can create a work-life harmony that best fits them.

What you will do:

Clean, transform, test, and deploy, in our data modeling layer, datasets that are ready for analytics so Data Analysts and the whole company can work efficiently with our data
Work with Data Engineers to expose new datasets via our direct integration tool
Apply software engineering best practices to analytics code such as version control, testing, and continuous integration
Develop and communicate strong opinions about best practices in Analytics Engineering with our community of Data Analysts
Automate processes around access to data & analytics using APIs and Python scripts
Put in place solid analytics training, and data documentation, for all Datadog teams so they can learn how to use data to answer questions and build analytics reporting for their team without assistance
Help build actionable foundational reporting used by many teams at Datadog to make strategic decisions

Who you are:

You have 4+ years experience as a Data Analyst and mastered data analysis and visualization in a Business Intelligence tool such as Metabase, Looker, or Tableau
You are fluent in writing analytical SQL, are able to write complex queries with no assistance, understand the difference between SQL that works and performant SQL.
You have worked with a data transformation tool such as dbt
You have experience using the command line and Git
You are a clear, concise communicator and can explain complex concepts to a non-technical audience
You have a natural curiosity and investigative mindset - driven to know ‚Äúwhy‚Äù
You want to work in a fast, high-growth startup environment and thrive on both autonomy and collaboration

Datadog values people from all walks of life. We understand not everyone will meet all the above qualifications on day one. That's okay. If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and want to grow your skills, we encourage you to apply.

Bonus Points (any of the following):

You have some experience with data warehouses such as Redshift, BigQuery, or Snowflake
You have a some experience with working with APIs and a programming language such as Python

Benefits and Growth: 

New hire stock equity (RSUs) and employee stock purchase plan (ESPP)
Continuous professional development, product training, and career pathing
Intradepartmental mentor and buddy program for in-house networking
An inclusive company culture, ability to join our Community Guilds (Datadog employee resource groups)
Access to Inclusion Talks, our internal panel discussions
Free, global mental health benefits for employees and dependents age 6+
Competitive global benefits

Benefits and Growth listed above may vary based on the country of your employment and the nature of your employment with Datadog.

About Datadog: 

Datadog (NASDAQ: DDOG) is a global SaaS business, delivering a rare combination of growth and profitability. We are on a mission to break down silos and solve complexity in the cloud age by enabling digital transformation, cloud migration, and infrastructure monitoring of our customers‚Äô entire technology stacks. Built by engineers, for engineers, Datadog is used by organizations of all sizes across a wide range of industries. Together, we champion professional development, diversity of thought, innovation, and work excellence to empower continuous growth. Join the pack and become part of a collaborative, pragmatic, and thoughtful people-first community where we solve tough problems, take smart risks, and celebrate one another. Learn more about #DatadogLife on Instagram, LinkedIn, and Datadog Learning Center. 

Equal Opportunity at Datadog:

Datadog is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer and is proud to offer equal employment opportunity to everyone regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity, veteran status, and more. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. Here are our Candidate Legal Notices for your reference.

Your Privacy:

Any information you submit to Datadog as part of your application will be processed in accordance with Datadog‚Äôs Applicant and Candidate Privacy Notice."

Title:
Data Analyst - Budapest,Hungary
Data Analyst - Budapest,Hungary
Industry: N/A
Job Description:
"About the job
Data Analyst - Budapest, Hungary

We are seeking a detailed and skilled HR Data Analyst to join us. In this role you will engage with clients, work with a variety of HR datasets, creating comprehensive reports and providing valuable insights to internal clients. If you have a knack for analytics and a desire to drive strategic decision-making through data, we want to hear from you.

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES:

Engage with clients to understand business questions, opportunities, or challenges they're looking to analyse with data.
Identify required information sources, partner with data owners to access data (as required), query and ingest data (from e.g., Business Objects / Power BI / Workday / Excel), clean and join data (as required), and develop reports to address client needs.
Quickly re-engage with clients to deliver reports, ensure questions were addressed, and rapidly iterate as needed.
Train up and become a subject matter expert on our Power BI team, encouraging dashboard adoption with clients.
Partner with our Power BI Development team to create new dashboards where request volumes are high (i.e., be an advocate for self-service and automation)
Support data governance (data source definitions, taxonomy) and provide quality assurance / testing for new data sources coming into our environment.

THIS ROLE IS PERFECT FOR YOU IF YOU HAVE‚Ä¶

A collaborative nature and team-orientation.
Ability to respond to client inquiries promptly and professionally
Ability to work under pressure
A quick thinker and problem solver that operates well under demanding‚ÄØand high pressurized environments. 
A strong ability to pick up new skills in a‚ÄØspeedy fashion. 
Good to have experience with handling tickets and customer service experience
Strong communication and interpersonal skills. 
Ability to work with Excel, Power BI and databases.
An analytic mindset: high attention to detail, even in high-pressure, fast-paced sprints
Ability to prioritize, organize and manage deadlines and attention to detail.
A hunger to learn and grow.
Strong experience with MS Excel (proficient in formulas and pivot tables).
Strength in or keen to learn business intelligence tools ( Power BI, Workday and Business Objects).
You are fluent in English.
You have permanent Right to Work in Hungary

WHAT YOU'LL GET:

24-month full-time contract.
Experience in a Global environment.
Additional training from our Academy.
Pay transparency ‚Äì 0-9 month - 7.500 000, 10-18 month - 8.250 000, 19-24 month - 9.000 000 HUF/yearly/gross
Flexible benefits package.
Ongoing training and support.
Valuable industry experience.
This is a hybrid position, working 3 days per week from our Client's office in Budapest

Important information on Diversity

We take great pride in celebrating the diversity of each and every individual who contributes to making mthree the company it is today and will be in the future. We value diversity both within mthree and with our partner companies, and we're proud to provide an environment where all our colleagues can flourish. That means promoting a strong culture of equality but, most importantly, inclusion. We never want people to change - only add to the amazing mix of people that work for mthree."

Title:
Customer Intelligence Analyst EV
Customer Intelligence Analyst EV
Industry: Software Development 11-50 employees 39 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Customer Intelligence Analyst - EV

RetailSonar is a rapidly expanding SAAS company specializing in geomarketing for major retail and service enterprises. We have offices already in 4 countries (Belgium, The Netherlands, France and Germany) and are technologically ready for further scaling up toward European market leadership. Therefore, we are looking for a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join our sales colleagues in the German office in Hamburg. 

Our recent breakthrough, ""ChargePlanner"" (visit chargeplanner.ai), is a cutting-edge solution that aids European charging point operators like Total Energies, Engie, Shell, Avia, and others in making informed decisions regarding the optimal locations for new EV charging stations. Our unique platform is fed by state of the art AI technology and up-to-date market data, which is the base of our very accurate performance prediction.

To propel the success of ChargePlanner and drive our business forward, we are in search of a Customer Intelligence Analyst specifically for our ChargePlanner product. Your future colleagues have a great affinity with big data, data processing and predictive modeling. Our employees are true multitaskers: they work simultaneously on multiple projects at major clients.

Your responsibilities:
Your daily tasks include the configuration of our European platforms, validating and analysing e-mobility data and guiding our customers towards an optimal charging point network.
You will maintain frequent contact with the customers you work for.
Customer satisfaction is our number one priority. We achieve this by delivering high-quality end results and going the extra mile. Our analysts rise to any challenge and dare to think outside the box.

Moreover, our employees are real team players: together, they always succeed in communicating the most important conclusions and insights to the client in a structured manner. Constructive feedback is important to us and we help each other to get the best out of ourselves. Every day again!

About you:
Preferably, you hold an bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree in technical/economical or business area which is complemented by a master's degree in data technology (e.g. Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Informatics)
A first experience in a data driven position is a strong plus
You have a sharp, analytical mind
You have a passion for data processing (SQL, Excel, Python, , ...)
You have the courage, enthusiasm, persuasiveness and a corresponding language skills to talk to the top management of our (international) customers. 
Ideally you are a German native with excellent English communication skills. 
You‚Äôre not afraid to pick up the phone and get in touch with our customers.
You have an eye for detail and know how to translate data into easy-to-grasp customer insights.
You will join our German colleague, becoming a cornerstone of our expanding local team in Germany.
As part of your onboarding, you will frequently travel to Belgium during the initial months of employment.
You are a self-starter that can work independently. 

What we have to offer:
A varied position with a challenging learning curve in a particularly innovative and extremely exciting field within e-mobility: geomarketing & customer intelligence.
A competitive salary package that is topped off every semester by a team bonus and individual bonus that encourage you to get the most out of yourself and your team.
The opportunity to be part of a young, close-knit and highly driven international team that enthusiastically builds successful, ground-breaking solutions.
A committed and personal organisation that values a good work-life balance.
A very personal coaching program that offers you ample opportunity to further explore your own interests.
The opportunity to work with executives and experts from the largest CPOs and other stakeholders in the e-mobility sector. The ideal way to broaden your world.
Regular team events and trips to Belgium and beyond."

Title:
Middle/Senior Data Analyst (FinTech Domain)
Middle/Senior Data Analyst (FinTech Domain)
Industry: Software Development 1,001-5,000 employees 1,526 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Company Description

We're seeking an accomplished Data Analyst with expertise in data visualization and statistical analysis, proficient in tools such as SQL, Python, and Tableau. The ideal candidate thrives in a collaborative team environment. This role goes beyond data crunching, encompassing responsibilities in data modeling, data interpretation, reporting, technical design, testing, documentation, and maintenance.

Our client has rapidly become one of Europe‚Äôs most fastest-growing fintech companies. They manage all aspects of financial operations, from generating virtual cards to facilitating wire transfers and maintaining customer account balances. As a payment institution, our client provides a platform integrating financial services into its product, including features like account management, card payments, bank transfers, and additional services.

CUSTOMER

Our customer is a leading FinTech company founded in 2016, offering a comprehensive spending solution designed for finance teams to facilitate faster and smarter spending decisions. Rapidly growing, they now serve over 4,000 customers and boast an international team of 500+ employees based in Paris, Berlin, London, Hamburg, and remote locations. They have raised over ‚Ç¨260M from prominent investors and have been recognized as a tech unicorn in France, with ambitious plans for continued expansion.

, Job Description

Title:
Stagiair Data & Analytics
Stagiair Data & Analytics with verification
Industry: Financial Services 51-200 employees 130 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Wij zoeken een Stagiair Data & Analytics  

Ben jij bachelor student en volg je een opleiding waar je te maken hebt met Big Data/ Data Analytics/Data Science en ben je op zoek naar een interessante stageplaats? Waar je goed wordt begeleid en veel leert? Spreekt dit je aan en ben je daarnaast proactief en leergierig? Dan hebben wij de perfecte meewerk stageplek voor jou! 

Periode voor ongeveer 24 weken vanaf september 2024. 
Fijne combi tussen werken op kantoor in Hilversum & hybride werken. 
Wij zorgen voor vakkundige en persoonlijke begeleiding. 
Aandacht voor je ontwikkeling. 
Uiteraard kun je rekenen op een marktconforme stagevergoeding (EUR 500,- bruto per maand op basis van 38 uur per week). 
Gezellige collega‚Äôs om mee te sparren en te netwerken. 

Wat ga je doen? 
Het Team Brand & Marketing is verantwoordelijk voor het merk, de marketing, analytics en onderzoek van Scildon. We zijn met z‚Äôn zessen een energiek en dynamisch team. En werken elke dag aan de transitie van Scildon als digitale verzekeraar. Dat doen we agile. Want samenwerken en transparant zijn vinden we belangrijk. Elke dag focussen we ons op het maximaal toevoegen van waarde. 

In het Team Brand & Marketing is de Data Analist verantwoordelijk voor data-analyse en marktonderzoek. Binnen Scildon is veel behoefte aan inzicht op basis van data. We proberen meer en meer data driven te zijn en fact based te werken. Dit kan op basis van marktdata, interne data en data die je kunt halen uit analysetools. 

De Data Analist houdt zich ook bezig met de commerci√´le pricing van onze producten en het begeleiden van marktonderzoekstrajecten. Er liggen heel veel vragen en wensen en we hebben niet de tijd om alles op te pakken. Daarom zoeken we jou. Om samen met de Data Analist een groot deel van de wensen met een data-insteek in te gaan vullen. 

Een greep uit de verschillende werkzaamheden:
Data onttrekken uit verschillende bronnen. 
De data bewerken tot kant en klare rapportages om inzicht te bieden aan interne stakeholders (Directie, Marketing, Sales). 
Pro-actief op zoek naar marktdata en deze toepassen in onze strategie. 
Analyseren van (online) marketingcampagnes. 
Meewerken aan commerci√´le pricing. 

Wie ben jij? 
Je volgt momenteel een Bacheloropleiding gericht op Data Analytics, Big Data, Data Science of Business Studies. 
Je bent communicatief en ondernemend. Heb je een goed idee, dat vinden we altijd leuk. Grote kans dat je het idee mag gaan uitvoeren. 
Data exploreren om impact mee te cre√´ren vind je net zoals wij geweldig. 
We gebruiken graag jouw kennis van Excel, Power BI en Google Analytics, want jouw rapportages helpen ons de juiste dingen goed te doen. 
Periode stage: februari 2024 ‚Äì juni 2024 (in overleg kan een andere periode ook) 

Wat bieden wij? 
Een interessante stageplek bij een top-10 levensverzekeraar met ambitie.
Een gedreven marketingteam. Je gaat samenwerken met Online Marketeers, Product Owner Online, Content Manager, Data Analist en de Manager Brand & Marketing. We werken Agile.
Een stage voor de periode van 4 tot 6 maanden, 32- 38 uur per week (in overleg).
Een stagevergoeding van ‚Ç¨ 500,- bruto per maand op basis van 38 uur per week.
Als je in het bezit bent van een studenten OV-jaarkaart, heb je geen recht op een reiskostenvergoeding. Soms voldoet het openbaar vervoer niet voor je. Mogelijk kom je in aanmerking voor een alternatieve regeling, zoals een kilometervergoeding. Neem contact met ons op om de mogelijkheden te bespreken.

Interesse 
Ben jij onze nieuwe stagiair? Stuur ons je CV met motivatie via de button SOLLICITEREN op de WerkenBij website en leg ons uit waarom jij deze stage zou willen doen. Voor meer informatie kun je ook bellen met Jan Kees Brouwer, onze Data Analist / 06 23610232. 

Waar kom je terecht?
Wij geloven dat veel zaken in de financi√´le wereld simpeler kunnen. En dat dit leidt tot meer grip en rust bij mensen. Daarom nemen we het voortouw om alles weer simpel te maken. 

Zo simpel kan het zijn
Meer duidelijkheid, minder zorgen

Dat is onze belofte. Wij gaan de markt veroveren met een eigen en origineel geluid. Eigenzinnig en duidelijk. We varen een onafhankelijke koers. Durven onze mening uit te dragen. Zijn duurzaam. En continu op zoek naar hoe het beter kan. Simpeler. Dat maakt mensen blij. 

Het Brand & Marketing team is een gedreven en innovatief team. Kijken waar het beter of anders kan. We bouwen aan een geweldige online klantreis en het neerzetten van slimme datadriven online marketing. Ons doel: het optimaliseren van onze online service, en het realiseren van de strategische en commerci√´le doelen. Met centraal onze merkbelofte: Scildon, zo simpel kan het zijn. 

Het team is een belangrijke schakel om de groei en het succes van Scildon verder uit te breiden. Dus ben jij energiek, creatief en gedreven? En voldoe je aan bovenstaande punten? Neem contact met ons op!"

Exoticca is an equal opportunity employer. Diversity and inclusiveness are our core. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under European, country, or local law."

Title:
Data Analyst
Data Analyst
Industry: IT Services and IT Consulting 11-50 employees 7 on LinkedIn
Job Description:
"About the job
Who We Are

At Joko, we leverage technology to help our users shop smarter: we help people preserve their purchasing power, buy more responsibly, and save time - all at once. Our ambition is to have a positive impact on the everyday life of hundreds of millions of consumers around the world.

To achieve that, we have built an app as well as a smart browser that provides users with:

online and in-store cashback
automatically applied coupon codes
interest-free 'buy now pay later' on any shopping website
information on their purchases' carbon emissions
and much more!

Joko was created in 2018 by Xavier, Alexandre, and Nicolas and the team has reached great milestones already:

3m+ users
3000+ merchant partners
‚Ç¨12m+ raised from leading European investors
50 team members
‚Ç¨21b transactions processed to date

Joko was also awarded the B-Corp certification for their actions in favor of employees, their positive impact on the community (Pro-Bono days, Duo Day...), and their commitment to protecting our environment.

 Our perks

We believe that flexibility and trust are important parts of a company. Our work environment reflects this thanks to:

 Flexible remote: If you live in Paris, you can work from our office or from your place with no constraints. If you live elsewhere, you can get access to a coworking space.

 Work from anywhere: Do you want to travel to South America for a month and work from there? For up to 3 months a year, you can work from most countries in the world.

On top of that, we offer many perks such as:

a budget for remote work equipment

a Swile card for your meals

a premium Alan Blue health insurance

a budget for training to keep learning new things

frequent team events and the Joko house every quarter!

More about it here

This position is remote-friendly.

 Our Data team

The Data team at Joko is turning mountains of data into actionable insights for all the teams! The Data team is part of our Operations department led by Quentin, our COO, and our mission is to empower the company to make informed decisions.

More Specifically, The Team's Responsibilities Are

Data for Business: We create top-notch reports and tools, making it easy for teams to dive into data and excel in their decision-making.
Help our stakeholders with the best data stack: We load and transform data, automate reports, and continuously improve our data stack. This allows teams to use valuable insights built on robust and scalable foundations.
Spread the data culture: At Joko, we have a strong engineering and tech culture across all teams, making it an ideal environment for our Data team to have a significant impact. We provide support and training on data tools to our stakeholders, and by closely collaborating with them, we ensure that our solutions align perfectly with their operational needs.

What You Will Do

As a Data Analyst, you will have a cross-functional role and collaborate closely with teams to understand our data and develop insights.

Deep-dive analyses: You will explore and analyse data to uncover trends, patterns, and potential issues that will help in the decision-making processes across all teams.
Reporting and Data Visualization: You will participate in creating content, such as dashboards and charts, using our data visualization tool. You will be involved in defining the report's content and constructing dashboards and charts to effectively communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders.
Data loading and transformation: You will be involved in loading and transforming the data as we have a ""full stack"" approach in Data at Joko. Of course, you will get some help on Data Engineering parts but you will be involved in the entire lifecycle of our data.
Interactions with stakeholders: You will work hand-in-hand with them to understand their needs, collect their feedback, and also evangelize data usage to help them make smarter choices.
Continuous Learning and Improvement: As ""never stop learning"" is one of our values, you will grow along the way and learn how to use analytical methods and the different tools that we use (and will use) in our data stack.

Who We're Looking For

Experience: You have 1-3y of professional experience in data analysis (relevant internships can count).
Education: You have graduated from a top-tier business or engineering school.
Mindset: You have an entrepreneurial mindset, you like challenges, you welcome feedback and you are willing to get better everyday to reach excellence.
Problem-solving & Analytical skills: You love solving complex problems and analyzing data.
Coding knowledge: Mastering SQL and Python is not mandatory, as you can still learn when joining, but it's a plus.
Business acumen: You can understand the needs of your business stakeholders and get the big picture of how the business is running.
Communication: You know how to present your conclusions clearly and synthetically (written and oral).
Languages: You are fluent in English, both written and spoken.

 Our Hiring Process

Discovery & screening call - one team member (15 min)
Cultural fit interview - two team members (45 min)
Case study debrief - two team members (45 min)
Founders interview - two founders (45 min)
Reference calls

You might also be invited to meet other team members at the office for a coffee or a drink!"
